original: phung po dang sems dag ngar 'dzin gyi yul du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po dang sems dag ngar 'dzin gyi yul du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates and mind are asserted to be the object of the conception of “I.”🔽Therefore, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag gi dngos po med par shes pas rang gi lta ba de 'jig tshogs la lta ba dpyis kyang 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag gi dngos po med par shes pas rang gi lta ba de 'jig tshogs la lta ba dpyis kyang 'byin pa ste /
translated: Those who say that by knowing that the entity of a self that is different from the aggregates does not exist, that view of the transitory collection is completely eradicated,

original: drungs 'byin pa yin no zhes smra ba gang yin pa de ni shin tu ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: drungs 'byin pa yin no zhes smra ba gang yin pa de ni shin tu ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: that it is uprooted, are utterly amazing.

original: bdag tu lta ba bdag gi yul can ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dpyis 'byin pas de la ci zhig byas par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba bdag gi yul can ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dpyis 'byin pas de la ci zhig byas par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: What would be the point of eradicating a view of self that does not have a self as its object and an object that is not its object?

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If, etc.

original: de med pas zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag pa med pas so //
analyzed: de med pas zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag pa med pas so //
translated: Because it does not exist means because a permanent self does not exist.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni gzhan yin zhing zhes bya ba ni phung po dang sems dag go //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni gzhan yin zhing zhes bya ba ni phung po dang sems dag go //
translated: The object of the conception of “I” is different means the aggregates and mind.

original: gzhan dang dngos po med pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag gi dngos po med pa mthong ba las so //
analyzed: gzhan dang dngos po med pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag gi dngos po med pa mthong ba las so //
translated: “From seeing the nonexistence of another and of a thing” means from seeing the nonexistence of a thing that is a self different from the aggregates.

original: kye ma khyod kyi @258a * //
analyzed: kye ma khyod kyi @258a * //
translated: From seeing the non-existence of another and of a real entity means from seeing the non-existence of a real entity of a self that is different from the aggregates.🔽Oh!

original: mdzes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdzes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Beautiful!

original: co 'dri ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: co 'dri ba'i tshig go //
translated: is a word of derision.

original: phan tshun 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa mthong bas phung po dang sems dag gi yul can gyi ngar 'dzin ldog par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa mthong bas phung po dang sems dag gi yul can gyi ngar 'dzin ldog par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: There is no mutual connection means that by seeing the non-existence of a self that is different from the aggregates, the grasping of I and mine that has the aggregates and mind as its object does not cease.

original: dpe ston pa ni /
analyzed: dpe ston pa ni /
translated: The example is taught:

original: rang khyim zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rang khyim zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The statement in my house and so on.

original: 'di ni glang chen med ces dogs pa bsal te zhes bya ba ni khyim 'di na glang po che yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams nas sprul 'jigs pa yang yongs su dor ba de ni kye ma gzhan dag gi gad mor 'gyur nyid de bzhad gad kyi
analyzed: 'di ni glang chen med ces dogs pa bsal te zhes bya ba ni khyim 'di na glang po che yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams nas sprul 'jigs pa yang yongs su dor ba de ni kye ma gzhan dag gi gad mor 'gyur nyid de bzhad gad kyi
translated: This is the dispelling of the doubt there is no elephant here. The thought there is no elephant in this house and the complete abandonment of fear of the magical creation is, oh! a cause of laughter for others. It is a cause of laughter,

original: gnas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du phung po lnga dang sems ni sprul lta bu yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po lnga dang sems ni sprul lta bu yin la /
translated: Likewise, the five aggregates and mind are like the magical creation,

original: glang po che ni bdag lta bu yin la /
analyzed: glang po che ni bdag lta bu yin la /
translated: and the elephant is like the self.

original: dpe'i skabs su ci ltar glang po che med par yongs su shes kyang skyes bu de sprul gyis 'dzin la /
analyzed: dpe'i skabs su ci ltar glang po che med par yongs su shes kyang skyes bu de sprul gyis 'dzin la /
translated: In the example, although one knows that the elephant does not exist, the person is still seized by the magical creation.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag med par yongs su shes kyang phung po dang sems dag yod pa de'i yul can gyi ngar 'dzin 'jug pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i du: kha nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi thar pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag med par yongs su shes kyang phung po dang sems dag yod pa de'i yul can gyi ngar 'dzin 'jug pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i du: kha nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi thar pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, here also, although one knows that the self does not exist, one still experiences the suffering of cyclic existence, because the apprehension of an “I” that has the aggregates and mind as its object still occurs.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:🔽“One who, although knowing the means of protection, does not apply it, will be seized by fear when the conditions for fear are present.”

original: 'jigs pa'i rkyen nyer zin kyang zhes bya ba ni sprul dang nye yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rkyen nyer zin kyang zhes bya ba ni sprul dang nye yang ngo //
translated: “Although knowing the means of protection” means although knowing the means of protection from the elephant.

original: phyir 'chos par mi byed par zhes bya ba ni sprul gyi 'jigs pa spong ba'i don du gnyen po mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: phyir 'chos par mi byed par zhes bya ba ni sprul gyi 'jigs pa spong ba'i don du gnyen po mi brten pa'o //
translated: “Does not apply it” means does not rely on the antidote in order to abandon the fear of the elephant.

original: de la yod pa'i 'jigs pa ma mthong zhes bya ba ni sprul la yod pa'i 'jigs pa ma mthong bas so //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i 'jigs pa ma mthong zhes bya ba ni sprul la yod pa'i 'jigs pa ma mthong bas so //
translated: The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽The phrase such a person is clearly deluded means that he is clearly deluded.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,

original: de lta bu'i skyes bu de ni bdag nyid rmongs pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i skyes bu de ni bdag nyid rmongs pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽The phrase such a person is clearly deluded means that he is clearly deluded.

original: rmongs pa nyid de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rmongs pa nyid de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that delusion,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.

original: phung po lnga dang bdag dag rten dang brten par 'dod pa'i phyogs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang bdag dag rten dang brten par 'dod pa'i phyogs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that delusion,🔽he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,🔽he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,

original: ci ltar mi rigs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar mi rigs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,🔽he says,

original: phung po bdag yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po bdag yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,🔽he says,🔽The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.🔽In order to demonstrate that delusion,🔽he says,

original: phung po bdag yod ma yin zhes bya ba ni rten phung po la brten pa bdag yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po bdag yod ma yin zhes bya ba ni rten phung po la brten pa bdag yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase he does not see the fear that exists there means that he does not see the fear that exists in the magical creation.

original: bdag la yang phung po de rnams yod min zhes bya ba ni brten par 'gyur ba'i phung po rnams rten du 'gyur ba'i bdag la yang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la yang phung po de rnams yod min zhes bya ba ni brten par 'gyur ba'i phung po rnams rten du 'gyur ba'i bdag la yang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Nor do they exist for the self” means that the aggregates that would be the basis do not exist for the self that would be the basis.

original: ci'i phyir @258b zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir @258b zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: de la lan ni /🔽gang phyir 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la lan ni / gang phyir 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The answer is:🔽“Because they are not different from the self.”

original: de ltar bdag las tha dad pa ma yin la /🔽gang gi phyir phung po dang bdag dag gzhan yin par 'gyur na rten dang brten pa'i rtog pa 'dir 'gyur bar 'os na bdag dang phung po dag gzhan nyid du med pas phung po dang bdag dag rten dang brten par rtog pa tsam ste don cung zad kyang
analyzed: de ltar bdag las tha dad pa ma yin la / gang gi phyir phung po dang bdag dag gzhan yin par 'gyur na rten dang brten pa'i rtog pa 'dir 'gyur bar 'os na bdag dang phung po dag gzhan nyid du med pas phung po dang bdag dag rten dang brten par rtog pa tsam ste don cung zad kyang
translated: Thus, the self is not different from the aggregates.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: If the aggregates and the self were different, then this conception of the basis and the based would be appropriate. But since the self and the aggregates are not different, the conception of the aggregates and the self as basis and based is merely a conception, and not even the slightest object exists.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gzhan nyid yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “If they were different, etc.”

original: de ltar bdag las tha dad pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bdag las tha dad pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, the self is not different from the aggregates.

original: sngar tha dad pa'i bdag bkag pas so //
analyzed: sngar tha dad pa'i bdag bkag pas so //
translated: Previously, the self that is different was refuted.

original: de ltar rten dang brten pa'i phyogs bkag nas bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa'i sgo nas ldan pa'i phyogs gzhan gyis khas len na de dag dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rten dang brten pa'i phyogs bkag nas bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa'i sgo nas ldan pa'i phyogs gzhan gyis khas len na de dag dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, after refuting the position of the support and the supported, in order to refute the other position that accepts the self and the aggregates as related through the character of the possessor and the possessed, he says:

original: phung po ldan pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po ldan pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The possession of the aggregates is also not tenable.

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The self, etc.

original: bdag ni gzugs dang ldan par 'dod pa yang mi bya ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs dang ldan par 'dod pa yang mi bya ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The self should not be asserted as possessing form. Why?

original: lan ni / gang phyir bdag yod min zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni / gang phyir bdag yod min zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The answer is: Because the self does not exist.

original: phung po las tha dad pa'i dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag sngar bkag zin pas so //🔽de'i phyir ldan don sbyor ba med //
analyzed: phung po las tha dad pa'i dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag sngar bkag zin pas so // de'i phyir ldan don sbyor ba med //
translated: Since the self that is different or not different from the aggregates was previously refuted,🔽therefore, the meaning of possession is not applicable.

original: ces bya ba ni bdag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa'i don yod pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bdag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa'i don yod pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that because the self does not exist, the meaning of possession does not exist.

original: ldan pa'i don ci ltar med pa de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ldan pa'i don ci ltar med pa de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to extensively demonstrate how the meaning of possession does not exist, he says:

original: gzhan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽lhas byin gnag dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'dir gnag dang lhas byin dag tha dad par yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: gzhan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / lhas byin gnag dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'dir gnag dang lhas byin dag tha dad par yod du zin kyang /
translated: If they are different, then the meaning of possession is not tenable.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas ldan pa'i don mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas ldan pa'i don mthong ba yin la /
translated: In the statement “Devadatta possesses a cow,” although the cow and Devadatta exist as different, the meaning of possession is seen in terms of the relation of owner and owned.

original: 'dir gzugs dang bdag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bdag la ldan pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //🔽de bzhin du lhas byin ni gzugs dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'dir tha mi dad pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs dang bdag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bdag la ldan pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o // de bzhin du lhas byin ni gzugs dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'dir tha mi dad pa'i phyir ram /
translated: But in this case, since form and the self are not different, the meaning of possession does not exist in the self.

original: so sor ma grub pa'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas ldan pa'i don mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: so sor ma grub pa'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas ldan pa'i don mthong ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, in the statement “Devadatta possesses form,” the meaning of possession is seen in terms of the relation of inherence, because they are not different or because they are not established separately.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid dang so sor ma grub pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid dang so sor ma grub pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But they are not not different and not established separately.

original: phung po dang tha mi dad par gyur pa'i bdag bkag pa dang tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po dang tha mi dad par gyur pa'i bdag bkag pa dang tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self that is not different from the aggregates is refuted, and the self that is different from them is refuted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: de nyid gzhan nyid med ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽bdag la tha dad pa dang tha ma dad @259a * //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan nyid med ces bya ba gsungs te / bdag la tha dad pa dang tha ma dad @259a * //
translated: he says, “Neither identical nor different.”

original: pa nyid med pas so //
analyzed: pa nyid med pas so //
translated: because the self does not have the nature of being either different or non-different from the aggregates.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very point,

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The self, etc.”

original: de ltar bdag phung po dang ldan pa nyid bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag phung po dang ldan pa nyid bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the self as possessing the aggregates,

original: phung po dang bdag dag la phyogs ci snyed bkag pa de grangs kyi sgo nas mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dang bdag dag la phyogs ci snyed bkag pa de grangs kyi sgo nas mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the summary of the refutations of the various positions regarding the self and the aggregates in terms of their number, he says,

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Now, etc.”

original: bkag zin pa'i phyogs rnams bsdoms te bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'i phyogs bsdus nas bstan pas so //
analyzed: bkag zin pa'i phyogs rnams bsdoms te bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'i phyogs bsdus nas bstan pas so //
translated: “Having enumerated the refutations” means having enumerated the refutations of the various positions.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dmigs pa la rnam pa log pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa de dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dmigs pa la rnam pa log pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa de dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates is said to engage its object by way of a distorted mode of apprehension. The mode of apprehension is the mode of apprehension of that object. It is a distinctive apprehension of the object.

original: de log pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de log pa yang yin te /
translated: The view of the perishable constituents is said to be an entrance by way of a perverted aspect in regard to the objective support. The aspect of the objective support is the special apprehension of the objective support.

original: rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is perverted because it is not tenable by reason.

original: de'i 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la log pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la log pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Its entrance is entrance by way of a perverted aspect in regard to the objective support.

original: grangs kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: grangs kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'i sgo nas so //
translated: By way of number means by way of the twenty aspects.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: gzugs bdag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gzugs bdag ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni tha mi dad pa'i bdag bkag pa yin no //🔽bdag ni gzugs ldan min zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i phyogs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs bdag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gzugs bdag ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni tha mi dad pa'i bdag bkag pa yin no // bdag ni gzugs ldan min zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i phyogs bkag pa yin no //
translated: Form is not the self, etc.🔽By the statement: “Form is not the self,” the self that is not different from form is refuted.🔽By the statement: “The self does not possess form,” the position of possession is refuted.

original: gzugs la bdag med ces bya ba 'dis ni gzugs rten dang bdag brten pa nyid bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la bdag med ces bya ba 'dis ni gzugs rten dang bdag brten pa nyid bkag pa yin no //
translated: By the statement: “The self is not in form,” the self as the support and form as the supported are refuted.

original: bdag la'ang gzugs yod min zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag rten dang gzugs rten nyid bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la'ang gzugs yod min zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag rten dang gzugs rten nyid bkag pa yin no //
translated: This is the refutation of the self as the basis and form as the based.

original: de ltar rnam bzhir phung po kun shes bya //
analyzed: de ltar rnam bzhir phung po kun shes bya //
translated: Thus, the aggregates are to be understood in four ways.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phung po rnams la rnam pa bzhi bzhir khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phung po rnams la rnam pa bzhi bzhir khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The aggregates characterized by feeling, perception, disposition, and consciousness are to be understood in four ways each.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba bdag ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba bdag ma yin //
translated: Thus, feeling is not the self,

original: bdag ni tshor dang ldan pa ma yin zhing tshor ba la bdag med pa dang / bdag la'ang tshor ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'du shes la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tshor dang ldan pa ma yin zhing tshor ba la bdag med pa dang / bdag la'ang tshor ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'du shes la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the self does not possess feeling, the self is not in feeling, and feeling is not in the self. The same is to be applied to perception and the other aggregates.

original: grangs sdom pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de dag bdag tu lta ba nyi shur 'dod //
analyzed: grangs sdom pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de dag bdag tu lta ba nyi shur 'dod //
translated: In order to demonstrate the summary of the enumeration, he says:

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: They are asserted to be the twenty views of the self.

original: phung po re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi'i sgo nas 'jug pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi'i sgo nas 'jug pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Since each of the aggregates is engaged in terms of four aspects, the view of the transitory collection has twenty aspects.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa @259b gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa @259b gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The aggregates, etc.”

original: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the opponent’s former position,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “If, etc.”

original: rnam par dpyad pa rnam pa lnga lnga skabs su bab pa la zhes bya ba ni phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pa'i phyogs dang tha dad pa'i phyogs dang / de dang ldan pa'i phyogs dang ; phung po dang bdag rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dang /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa rnam pa lnga lnga skabs su bab pa la zhes bya ba ni phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pa'i phyogs dang tha dad pa'i phyogs dang / de dang ldan pa'i phyogs dang ; phung po dang bdag rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dang /
translated: The fivefold analysis is relevant here: the position that the self is not different from the aggregates, the position that it is different from the aggregates, the position that it possesses the aggregates, the position that the self and the aggregates are the support and the supported,

original: bdag dang phung po dag rten dang brten par 'dod pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bdag dang phung po dag rten dang brten par 'dod pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and the position that the self and the aggregates are asserted to be the support and the supported.

original: de ltar phung po re re rnam pa lnga lngar byas pas rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lngar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar phung po re re rnam pa lnga lngar byas pas rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lngar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, since each of the aggregates is taken as fivefold, there are twenty-five aspects.

original: des na 'dir ci ltar phung po re re la tha dad pa'i phyogs dor nas rnam pa bzhi bzhir brjod pas rnam pa nyi shur ji ltar ston /
analyzed: des na 'dir ci ltar phung po re re la tha dad pa'i phyogs dor nas rnam pa bzhi bzhir brjod pas rnam pa nyi shur ji ltar ston /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that here, by describing each of the aggregates in terms of four aspects, twenty aspects are taught?

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga las dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga las dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the Root Verses on the Middle Way, twenty-five aspects are taught.

original: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Treatise says,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na de phung po'i rang bzhin nam /🔽phung po las tha dad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la de 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na de phung po'i rang bzhin nam / phung po las tha dad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la de 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the so-called tathāgata were to exist, he would be of the nature of the aggregates,

original: phung po de 'gyur ba'am /🔽phung po dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phung po de 'gyur ba'am / phung po dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: or he would be different from the aggregates, or the tathāgata would possess the aggregates,🔽or the aggregates would possess the tathāgata,🔽or the tathāgata would possess the aggregates.

original: de la phung po nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phung po nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates themselves are not the tathāgata.

original: gal te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid nye bar len pa yin na byed pa po dang las dag gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gal te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid nye bar len pa yin na byed pa po dang las dag gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: If the perfect Buddha were the appropriator, then the agent and the action would be identical, and it would follow, absurdly, that he would be born and would perish.

original: des na phung po nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phung po nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is not the aggregates.

original: phung po las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not different from the aggregates,🔽because if the Buddha were different from the appropriated aggregates, then he would exist even without the appropriated aggregates.

original: gal te nye bar len pa las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin na nye bar len pa de med du zin kyang yod par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du phung po las tha dad par gyur pa yin na phung po'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin na nye bar len pa de med du zin kyang yod par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du phung po las tha dad par gyur pa yin na phung po'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the Buddha were different from the aggregates, then he would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir phung po la de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po zhes bya ba yang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir phung po la de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po zhes bya ba yang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the Buddha is the aggregates or that the aggregates are the Buddha, because the Buddha and the aggregates are not different.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that the Tathāgata possesses the aggregates,

original: de nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyogs bkag pas so //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyogs bkag pas so //
translated: because the position that he is identical to or different from them has been refuted.

original: des na de ltar rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas dpyad na gang mi dmigs pa de ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas dpyad na gang mi dmigs pa de ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when analyzed in these five ways, how could that which is not perceived be the Tathāgata?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @260a * //🔽gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @260a * // gang zhig yin //
translated: the Tathāgata

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: is not perceived.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir rnam pa bzhir ji ltar brjod snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir rnam pa bzhir ji ltar brjod snyam pa'o //
translated: Since these five aspects are taught, how can it be said here that there are four aspects?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The view of the transitory collection, etc.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba cha de dag ni zhes bya ba nyi shu'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba cha de dag ni zhes bya ba nyi shu'o //
translated: The “parts” of the view of the transitory collection are the twenty.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas so //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas so //
translated: “By that” means by the view of the transitory collection.

original: phung po rnams ma bzung bas zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams la mi dmigs par ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams ma bzung bas zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams la mi dmigs par ro //
translated: “Without apprehending the aggregates” means without perceiving the aggregates.

original: rnam pa bzhi bzhi'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag gi phyogs dor nas so //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi bzhi'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag gi phyogs dor nas so //
translated: The phrase in terms of fourfold aspects means that one should set aside the position of a self that is separate from the aggregates.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus... and so on.

original: phung po ma gtogs par ni zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig la phung po ma gtogs par tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag la tha dad du mngon par zhen pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po ma gtogs par ni zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig la phung po ma gtogs par tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag la tha dad du mngon par zhen pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Apart from the aggregates... means that apart from the aggregates, there is no self that is separate from them, and one should not cling to their separateness.

original: phung po la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba'i ming thob pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: phung po la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba'i ming thob pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained earlier that the view of the transitory collection receives its name because it takes the aggregates as its object.

original: des na bdag tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs lnga pa dor nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa nyi shu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs lnga pa dor nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa nyi shu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having set aside the fifth position that the self is separate, he demonstrates that the view of the transitory collection has twenty aspects.

original: 'o na bstan bcos las rnam pa lnga ji ltar bkag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bstan bcos las rnam pa lnga ji ltar bkag ce na /
translated: Well then, how is the fivefold position refuted in the treatise?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that, he says:

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The treatise states, “The self is not the aggregates, nor different from them, etc.”

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyis tha dad pa'i bdag yongs su rtog pa de dgag pa'i phyir rnam pa lnga bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyis tha dad pa'i bdag yongs su rtog pa de dgag pa'i phyir rnam pa lnga bkag pa yin no //
translated: In order to refute the non-Buddhist’s imagination of a separate self, five aspects are refuted.

original: 'di'i don ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbye ba'i gnas skabs su gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba phung po ma gtogs par tha dad pa'i bdag la dmigs pa yin na de'i tshe de la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lngar 'gyur ba yin pa las 'on kyang
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbye ba'i gnas skabs su gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba phung po ma gtogs par tha dad pa'i bdag la dmigs pa yin na de'i tshe de la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lngar 'gyur ba yin pa las 'on kyang
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the view of the transitory collection, in the context of its divisions, were to observe a self that is separate from the aggregates, then it would have twenty-five aspects.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phung po la mi dmigs par mi 'jug pa de'i phyir tha dad pa'i bdag la dmigs pa med pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa nyi shu kho nar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phung po la mi dmigs par mi 'jug pa de'i phyir tha dad pa'i bdag la dmigs pa med pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa nyi shu kho nar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: However, the view of the transitory collection does not operate without observing the aggregates. Therefore, since it does not observe a separate self, the view of the transitory collection has only twenty aspects.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag dgag pa ni mu stegs pa'i 'dod pa dgag pa'i don du'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag dgag pa ni mu stegs pa'i 'dod pa dgag pa'i don du'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The refutation of a separate self is for the purpose of refuting the assertions of the tīrthikas.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbye ba bstan pa'i sgo nas lung gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs bdag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtse mo nyi shu 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gang la yod @260b pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbye ba bstan pa'i sgo nas lung gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs bdag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtse mo nyi shu 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gang la yod @260b pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the scripture by way of teaching the divisions of the view of the transitory collection, he says:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ri yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ri yin te /
translated: Therein, the mountain of the view of the transitory collection,

original: ye shes kyi rdo rje ma yin pas 'joms par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rdo rje ma yin pas 'joms par mi nus pas so //
translated: with twenty high peaks, is destroyed by the vajra of wisdom.🔽Having destroyed it, one attains the result of stream-enterer.🔽Therein refers to the view of the transitory collection.🔽The twenty high peaks are the twenty peaks such as form is the self and so on. The mountain of the view of the transitory collection is the view of the transitory collection itself, because it cannot be destroyed by anything other than the vajra of wisdom.

original: ye shes kyis bcom nas zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyis bcom nas zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas so //
translated: Having destroyed it means having destroyed it with the vajra of the wisdom of selflessness.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The result of stream-enterer has been explained previously.

original: lta ri zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ri yin pas so //
analyzed: lta ri zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ri yin pas so //
translated: The mountain of views is the view of the transitory collection itself, because it is a mountain.

original: bdag med rtogs pa'i rdo rje ye shes zhes bya ba ni bdag med rtogs pa de nyid rdo rje yin te /
analyzed: bdag med rtogs pa'i rdo rje ye shes zhes bya ba ni bdag med rtogs pa de nyid rdo rje yin te /
translated: The so-called vajra intuition that realizes selflessness is just the realization of selflessness itself, which is a vajra.

original: 'joms par byed pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'joms par byed pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It has the nature of a conqueror.

original: gang dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'i rtse mo dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'i rtse mo dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: Together with what? Together with the peak of the twenty aspects.

original: lhun stug la gnas la zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas goms pas so //
analyzed: lhun stug la gnas la zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas goms pas so //
translated: It is based on a thick peak, because it is cultivated from beginningless cyclic existence.

original: rtse mo mtho bar 'gyur ba 'di dag go //
analyzed: rtse mo mtho bar 'gyur ba 'di dag go //
translated: These are the high peaks.

original: zhes bya ba ni lung las gang rtse mo bstan pa de ni 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lung las gang rtse mo bstan pa de ni 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is the very peak that is taught in the scriptures.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “the mountain of the view of the transitory collection,” and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje babs pas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi yul can gyi ye shes gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje babs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje babs pas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi yul can gyi ye shes gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje babs pa yin te /
translated: The descent of the vajra intuition of the āryas means that the very descent of the vajra is the intuition of the āryas, the intuition that has the emptiness of all phenomena as its object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i brag ri thams cad snyil bar byed pa yin la de med pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i brag ri thams cad snyil bar byed pa yin la de med pas so //
translated: It is the one that causes the collapse of all the rocky mountains of discursive thought.

original: nyin re zhing nyon mongs pa'i brag ri 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re re zhing du 'phel ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags pa rnams kho na brag rdo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: nyin re zhing nyon mongs pa'i brag ri 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re re zhing du 'phel ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags pa rnams kho na brag rdo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The mountain of the afflictions grows day by day means that the mountain of the afflictions, such as desire, grows day by day.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'phel bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'phel bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: The mountain of the afflictions, such as desire, grows by the power of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas byung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas byung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has existed since beginningless cyclic existence means that it has existed since the beginning of the teaching.

original: dpangs khams gsum du mtho ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas khams gsum du khyab pas so //
analyzed: dpangs khams gsum du mtho ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas khams gsum du khyab pas so //
translated: It is high, rising up through the three realms means that the view of the transitory collection pervades the three realms.

original: phyogs kyi ngos ma lus pas khyab pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas phyogs thams cad du grub bas so //
analyzed: phyogs kyi ngos ma lus pas khyab pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas phyogs thams cad du grub bas so //
translated: It extends without limit in all directions means that the view of the transitory collection extends to all directions.

original: ji ltar ri rab gser gyi sa gzhi las 'thon pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar ri rab gser gyi sa gzhi las 'thon pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that just as Sumeru emerges from the golden ground, so does this,

original: ma rig pa'i gser gyi sa gzhi las 'thon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gser gyi sa gzhi las 'thon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, “emerges from the golden ground of ignorance.”

original: ma rig pa nyid gser gyi sa gzhi yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid gser gyi sa gzhi yin la /
translated: Ignorance itself is the golden ground.

original: de las byung ba yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /🔽'jig @261a * //
analyzed: de las byung ba yin pas na de skad ces bya ste / 'jig @261a * //
translated: Since it arises from that, it is called that.🔽The peak of the mountain is the view of the transitory collection.

original: tshogs la lta ba ni ma rig pa las byung bas so //
analyzed: tshogs la lta ba ni ma rig pa las byung bas so //
translated: Since it arises from ignorance, it is called that.

original: rtse mo ches mtho ba dag dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'i dang ngo //
analyzed: rtse mo ches mtho ba dag dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'i dang ngo //
translated: The highest peaks are the twenty aspects.

original: de dag ni rtse mo yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs bdag yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rtse mo yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs bdag yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They should be known as the peaks.

original: de ltar mang pos bkur ba pas btags pa'i phung po las tha mi dad pa'i btags yod kyi bdag bkag nas rdzas su yod pa'i bdag dgag par bya ba'i phyir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar mang pos bkur ba pas btags pa'i phung po las tha mi dad pa'i btags yod kyi bdag bkag nas rdzas su yod pa'i bdag dgag par bya ba'i phyir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, having refuted the self that is imputed to be different from the aggregates, which is imputed to exist, the Saṃmitīyas say, “Now, the self that is substantially existent is to be refuted.”

original: de la dang po phyogs snga ma ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po phyogs snga ma ston pa ni /
translated: The first, the presentation of the opponent’s position, is as follows.

original: kha cig de nyid gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig de nyid gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Some say, “It is neither identical nor different, etc.”

original: de la kha cig ces bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig ces bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “ Some” refers to a specific Vaiśeṣika.

original: de nyid gzhan nyid rtag mi rtag / la sogs brjod med ces bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la sngar brjod pa'i skyon yod par 'gyur bas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par brjod du med pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan nyid rtag mi rtag / la sogs brjod med ces bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la sngar brjod pa'i skyon yod par 'gyur bas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par brjod du med pa dang /
translated: “ It is neither identical nor different, etc.” means that since the error mentioned earlier would apply to the positions of the person being different from the aggregates and not different from the aggregates, it is inexpressible as either different or not different.

original: de bzhin du rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar thal bar 'gyur bas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar thal bar 'gyur bas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med pas so //
translated: And since it would follow that the extreme of eternalism or nihilism would apply, it is also inexpressible as permanent or impermanent.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ther zug pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ther zug pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes permanence.

original: rdzas yod ces bya ba ni don dam par yod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas yod ces bya ba ni don dam par yod pa'o //
translated: “ Substantial existence” means ultimate existence.

original: rnam shes drug gi shes byar de 'dod cing //
analyzed: rnam shes drug gi shes byar de 'dod cing //
translated: They assert that it is an object of knowledge of the six consciousnesses.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po ma gtogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa ma grub pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po ma gtogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa ma grub pas so //
translated: This is because the apprehension of a self that is separate from the aggregates is not established.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “That” refers to the self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:🔽“In that regard, first of all . . .”

original: de la zhes bya ba nas brjod du med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa nyid dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas brjod du med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa nyid dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The passage from “In that regard . . .” up to “cannot be described” demonstrates that it cannot be described as being different or non-different, or as being permanent or impermanent.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it exists substantially, he says:

original: gang zag de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zag de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “That person . . .”

original: de la byed pa po nyid dang zab po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag de las kyi byed pa po dang 'bras bu longs spyod pa po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa po nyid dang zab po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag de las kyi byed pa po dang 'bras bu longs spyod pa po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because it is described as the agent and the experiencer” means that the self is described as the agent of actions and the experiencer of their results.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcings pa dang thar pa dang 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcings pa dang thar pa dang 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should supply “exists” because of being related to cyclic existence, nirvana, bondage, liberation, and so on.

original: de la 'khor ba ni 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ni 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Here cyclic existence is going from one transmigration to another.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Nirvana is not going from one transmigration to another.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is the nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: bcings pa ni 'dod chags la @261b sogs pa nyon mongs pas so //
analyzed: bcings pa ni 'dod chags la @261b sogs pa nyon mongs pas so //
translated: Bondage is by the afflictions such as desire.

original: thar pa ni de rnams dang bral ba las so //🔽de ltar phyogs snga ma bstan nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thar pa ni de rnams dang bral ba las so // de ltar phyogs snga ma bstan nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Liberation is from being bound by those.

original: smra ba 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: smra ba 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus presented the opponent’s position, in order to teach the response, he says, “This statement . . .”

original: smra ba 'di yang zhes bya ba ni bdag rdzas su yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba 'di yang zhes bya ba ni bdag rdzas su yod par smra ba'o //
translated: This statement is the statement that the self substantially exists.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rdzas su yod na brjod du med pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rdzas su yod na brjod du med pa ma yin pas so //
translated: As to “because,” etc., it is because if it were substantially existent, it would not be inexpressible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dngos yod brjod med rtogs pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos yod brjod med rtogs pa ma yin nyid //
translated: Why?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “For, a thing that exists is not realized as inexpressible.”

original: gang rdzas su yod pa de ni brjod du med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rdzas su yod pa de ni brjod du med pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is substantially existent is not inexpressible.

original: dngos por yod na de nyid dang gzhan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por yod na de nyid dang gzhan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it existed as a thing, it would not transcend being the same as or different from that.

original: gal te dngos po yod pa brjod du med pa yin na sems kyang brjod du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa brjod du med pa yin na sems kyang brjod du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If an existent thing were inexpressible, mind would also be inexpressible.

original: dpe bstan nas don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the example, in order to apply it to the meaning, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “If, etc.”

original: gal te bdag 'ga' zhig rdzas su yod par 'gyur na brjod du med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bdag 'ga' zhig rdzas su yod par 'gyur na brjod du med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a self were to exist substantially, it would not be inexpressible.

original: sems bzhin du brjod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems bzhin du brjod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Like mind, it would be expressible.

original: gang gi phyir bdag brjod du med pa de'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag brjod du med pa de'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because the self is inexpressible, therefore it does not exist substantially.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i ngag gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i ngag gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the words of this verse,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Therefore, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “ Because, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pa yan lag can ma grub pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag 'di yang brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pa yan lag can ma grub pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag 'di yang brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: means that because the whole, such as a pot, is not established, it cannot be said to be identical to or different from form, etc. Therefore, since this self is also inexpressible, it does not exist as a thing.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “What self, etc.”

original: bdag gang phung po las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par gyur pa'i bdag de la rang gis yod par grub pa yin no zhes bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gang phung po las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par gyur pa'i bdag de la rang gis yod par grub pa yin no zhes bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not think that the self, which is inexpressible as identical to or different from the aggregates, is established as existing by itself.

original: 'on kyang btags pa tsam du yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang btags pa tsam du yod pa yin no //
translated: However, it exists as a mere designation.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “A pot, etc.”

original: de nyid dang gzhan brjod du med cing zhes bya ba ni gal te bum pa gzugs la sogs pa las tha mi dad par 'dod na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa kho na yin pas bum pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan brjod du med cing zhes bya ba ni gal te bum pa gzugs la sogs pa las tha mi dad par 'dod na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa kho na yin pas bum pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If one asserts that a pot is not different from form, etc., then since it is just form, etc., it follows that a pot does not exist.

original: gal te tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa spangs nas kyang snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du @262a * //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa spangs nas kyang snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro // des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du @262a * //
translated: If it is different, then it follows that it would appear even when form, etc., are abandoned.

original: brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: btags par yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad tsam du yod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: btags par yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad tsam du yod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is asserted to exist as a designation means that it is asserted to exist as a mere convention.

original: de bzhin du bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: “The self is also like that” and so on is the application to the meaning.

original: dgag pa dang bsgrub pa nye bar bstan nas zhes bya ba ni de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni dgag pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa dang bsgrub pa nye bar bstan nas zhes bya ba ni de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni dgag pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Having taught the negation and the affirmation, the first verse teaches the negation.

original: brjod du med pa nyid rdzas su yod pa la mi 'thad pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid rdzas su yod pa la mi 'thad pa bstan pas so //
translated: It is untenable that the inexpressible exists substantially.🔽

original: gnyis pas ni bsgrub pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni bsgrub pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: The second half shows the proof,

original: brjod du med pa de btags pa la yod pas so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa de btags pa la yod pas so //
translated: because that inexpressibility exists in the imagined.

original: dngos po'i chos kyi rten can ma yin pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i chos ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid yin la de dag gi rten du bdag mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos kyi rten can ma yin pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i chos ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid yin la de dag gi rten du bdag mi 'gyur te /
translated: The statement “because it is not the basis of the qualities of an entity” means that the qualities of an entity are identity and difference, and the self is not their basis,

original: brjod du med par khas blangs pas so //🔽bdag 'gog par rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod du med par khas blangs pas so // bdag 'gog par rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rten ma yin te /
translated: because it is accepted as inexpressible.

original: phyir bdag ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //🔽de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir bdag ni yod pa ma yin pa'o // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement “the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity” means that the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity, such as being produced, because it is not an entity.🔽The statement “the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity” means that the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity, such as being produced, because it is not an entity.🔽The statement “the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity” means that the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity, such as being produced, because it is not an entity.

original: khyod kyi rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyi rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement “the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity” means that the self is not the basis of the qualities of an entity, such as being produced, because it is not an entity.

original: ci ltar khyod kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas tha mi dad par 'dod cing gzugs la sogs pa la ltos nas tha dad par 'dod pas des na dngos po la rnam pa gnyis mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar khyod kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas tha mi dad par 'dod cing gzugs la sogs pa la ltos nas tha dad par 'dod pas des na dngos po la rnam pa gnyis mthong ba yin te /
translated: Just as you assert that consciousness is not different in reliance on its own nature, and you assert that it is different in reliance on form and so on, therefore you see two modes of things.

original: rnam par shes pa dngos po yod pa la de nyid dang gzhan nyid du khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos po yod pa la de nyid dang gzhan nyid du khas blangs pa'o //
translated: You accept that consciousness is both the same and different in regard to an existent thing.

original: des na dngos po'i chos tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa med pas na bdag med pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na dngos po'i chos tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa med pas na bdag med pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference or non-difference and so on of the attributes of things, there is no self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it were to arise from itself,🔽then it would arise without end.

original: rang gi bdag nyid las zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag nyid las so //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid las zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag nyid las so //
translated: From its own self means from the self that is characterized by the five aggregates.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that it does not exist,

original: ngar 'dzin gyi rten du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin gyi rten du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that it is also not the basis of the conception of “I,” he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with “because” indicates

original: gang gi phyir gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi rigs pa de'i phyir dngos po med par ngar 'dzin gyi rten du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi rigs pa de'i phyir dngos po med par ngar 'dzin gyi rten du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that since it is not tenable that the person exists substantially, therefore, it is not the basis of the conception of “I” that apprehends a nonexistent thing.

original: phung po las gzhan min zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phung po las gzhan min zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'gog pa'o //
translated: “ It is not different from the aggregates” refutes the self that is different from the aggregates.

original: phung po'i ngo bo min zhes bya ba ni phung po dang gcig pa'i bdag 'gog pa'o //🔽phung po rten min zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka la rten dang brten pa'i phyogs 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i ngo bo min zhes bya ba ni phung po dang gcig pa'i bdag 'gog pa'o // phung po rten min zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka la rten dang brten pa'i phyogs 'gog pa'o //
translated: “ It is not the entity of the aggregates” refutes the self that is the same as the aggregates.🔽“ The aggregates are not its support” refutes the position that the self is both the support and the supported.

original: 'di ni de ldan min zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i phyogs 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de ldan min zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i phyogs 'gog pa'o //
translated: “ It does not possess them” refutes the position that the self possesses the aggregates.

original: de 'grel @262b pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel @262b pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this,

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: the passage beginning with “The object of the conception of ‘I’” is easy to understand.

original: gnyis ka la rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ka la rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the position that the self is both the support and the supported,

original: phung po rnams kyi rten yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rten yang ma yin no //
translated: the text says, “The aggregates are not its support.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: phung po rnams kyi rten yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rten yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the self the support of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag phung po rnams kyi rten du yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag phung po rnams kyi rten du yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that the self would not be the support of the aggregates.

original: 'di la rten phung po yod pas na phung po rten zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rten yin la bdag brten pa yin pa'i phyogs su yang mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rten phung po yod pas na phung po rten zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rten yin la bdag brten pa yin pa'i phyogs su yang mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are the support of the self, but the self is not the support of the aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rten dang brten pa'i phyogs gnyis ka bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rten dang brten pa'i phyogs gnyis ka bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: Therefore, in order to refute both the position of the support and the supported, he says,🔽Because of the non-apprehension of the self as described.

original: / ma dmigs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu stegs pas btags pa'i bdag yod pa yin gyi ma dmigs pa yin no zhes 'dod pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: / ma dmigs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu stegs pas btags pa'i bdag yod pa yin gyi ma dmigs pa yin no zhes 'dod pas kyang ngo //
translated: The non-apprehension of the self is also asserted by those who believe that the self exists as it is imagined by the heterodox, but is not apprehended.

original: ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gzugs bdag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gzugs bdag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: By the aspects described means by the aspects taught previously, such as “form is not the self.”

original: khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bas ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam par dag pas khas blang bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bas ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam par dag pas khas blang bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: “One should not accept it” means that one should not accept it through the purity taught above,

original: brtags na mi bzod pas so //
analyzed: brtags na mi bzod pas so //
translated: because it cannot withstand analysis.

original: 'o na ji ltar khas blang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khas blang bar bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how should one accept it?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: 'di ni phung po rnams rten 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni phung po rnams rten 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “This self is established in dependence on the aggregates.”

original: phung po rnams la brten nas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam gyis bdag btags pa tsam 'di grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phung po rnams la brten nas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam gyis bdag btags pa tsam 'di grub pa yin gyi /
translated: The self is merely imputed, established by mere unexamined convention, in dependence on the aggregates.

original: dpyad na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dpyad na ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not established through analysis.

original: btags shing dpyad na rnam pa gang yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags shing dpyad na rnam pa gang yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when it is imputed and analyzed, it is not tenable in any way.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: ji ltar 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “How is this?” and so on.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ma chad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i skye ba nyid 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad tsam du yod pas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ma chad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i skye ba nyid 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad tsam du yod pas so //
translated: In order to not cut off the presentation of conventional truth, because arising as “this arises from that” exists as mere worldly convention.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon dang ldan pa'i rnam pa bsal nas zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa'i phyogs bsal nas so //🔽bdag tu tha snyad btags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon dang ldan pa'i rnam pa bsal nas zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa'i phyogs bsal nas so // bdag tu tha snyad btags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag 'dra'o //
translated: Having cleared away the aspects that have the faults explained, having cleared away the aspects of difference, non-difference, and so on.🔽Because the designation of self is seen, because the designation of self is seen as “I am like this,”

original: 'di bdag gi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di bdag gi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad mthong bas so //
translated: and because the designation of mine is seen as “this is mine.”

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag dpyad par mi rigs shing ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du yod pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag dpyad par mi rigs shing ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du yod pas so //
translated: In order to clarify the meaning that was explained, because the self is not suitable to be analyzed, and because it exists as mere pleasure when not analyzed.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽shing rta @263a * //
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir / shing rta @263a * //
translated: In order to teach an example for that,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “A chariot,” and so on.

original: gzhan 'dod min zhes bya ba ni shing rta yan lag las tha dad du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dod min zhes bya ba ni shing rta yan lag las tha dad du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Nor is it different from the others” means that the chariot is not observed to be different from its parts.

original: gzhan min ma yin zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams du ma yin pa'i phyir shing rta yang du mar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / yan lag re re yang shing rta nyid du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan min ma yin zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams du ma yin pa'i phyir shing rta yang du mar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / yan lag re re yang shing rta nyid du 'gyur bas so //
translated: “Nor is it not different” means that because the parts are many, it follows that the chariot would also be many, and that each individual part would be a chariot.

original: gal te tshogs pa las tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa las tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not different from the collection,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: that is also not so.

original: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can las tha dad du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can las tha dad du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the collection is not different from the things that are collected,

original: skyon de nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: skyon de nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
translated: the same error would ensue.

original: de ldan yang min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ldan yang min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Nor does it possess them” means that

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs bsal bas ;
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs bsal bas ;
translated: the positions of difference and non-difference have been eliminated,

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs kyang ma grub pas so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs kyang ma grub pas so //
translated: and the position of possession is also not established.

original: yan lag la min yan lag dag der min //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag la min yan lag dag der min //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is not in the parts, nor are the parts in it.”

original: yan lag rnams la shing rta yod par mi 'gyur ba dang / shing rta de la yang yan lag yod par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams la shing rta yod par mi 'gyur ba dang / shing rta de la yang yan lag yod par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The chariot would not exist in the parts, and the parts would not exist in the chariot.

original: tha dad yod na gnyis ka rten dang brten par 'gyur ba las tha dad pa nyid med pas so //
analyzed: tha dad yod na gnyis ka rten dang brten par 'gyur ba las tha dad pa nyid med pas so //
translated: If they were different, both would be the basis and the based.

original: 'dus pa tsam min zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams 'dus pa tsam yang shing rtar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam min zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams 'dus pa tsam yang shing rtar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase “not merely the collection” means that the mere collection of parts is not the chariot.

original: yan lag 'dus pa yang shing rta nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: yan lag 'dus pa yang shing rta nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: For it would follow, absurdly, that the mere collection of parts would be the chariot.

original: dbyibs min zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi dbyibs tsam yang shing rtar mi rigs te /
analyzed: dbyibs min zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi dbyibs tsam yang shing rtar mi rigs te /
translated: The phrase “not the shape” means that the mere shape of the parts is not the chariot.

original: yan lag can med pa'i phyir yan lag kyang med pas so //
analyzed: yan lag can med pa'i phyir yan lag kyang med pas so //
translated: For if there is no whole, there are no parts.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: de'i phyir 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Therefore, here . . .”

original: sngar bstan zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bdag bkag pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bdag bkag pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: “Already refuted” refers to the section on the refutation of the self.

original: phyogs lnga po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs lnga po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the five points, he says,🔽“The chariot is not asserted to be other than its parts . . . ”

original: de nyid kyi phyogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That is the reason why the verse says, “The collection and shape of parts, etc.”

original: de dag ston pa brtsam par bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa dang dbyibs dag go //
analyzed: de dag ston pa brtsam par bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa dang dbyibs dag go //
translated: “Those” refers to the collection and shape.

original: tshogs tsam zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi tshogs spungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs tsam zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi tshogs spungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “The mere collection” is the mere heap of the collection of parts.

original: 'di ni sngar bshad zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bshad zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “This has already been explained”🔽is explained in the following lines:

original: de tshe de yi yan lag tshogs gnas rnams //
analyzed: de tshe de yi yan lag tshogs gnas rnams //
translated: At that time, the collection of its parts would be a chariot,
