original: shing rta nyid 'gyur shing rta dang bdag mtshungs //🔽zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: shing rta nyid 'gyur shing rta dang bdag mtshungs // zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: and the chariot would be the same as the self.

original: skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba de /
translated: “Another fault is stated”

original: yan lag can med pa'i phyir yan lag rnams kyang med pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshogs shing rta yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yan lag can med pa'i phyir yan lag rnams kyang med pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshogs shing rta yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: is stated in the following lines: “Since the parts would not exist, because the possessor of the parts does not exist.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshogs pa la @263b yang skyon mtshungs par yod pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshogs pa la @263b yang skyon mtshungs par yod pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” is stated because the same fault would apply to the collection.

original: dbyibs tsam shing rtar rigs pa'ang min //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam shing rtar rigs pa'ang min //
translated: It is also not logical that the mere shape is the chariot.

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽cha shas rnams kyi dbyibs tsam yang shing rtar rigs pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / cha shas rnams kyi dbyibs tsam yang shing rtar rigs pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what is being said:🔽It is not logical that the mere shape of the parts is the chariot.

original: rang gi sgras ni cha shas kyi tshogs pa tsam yang shing rta ma yin na //
analyzed: rang gi sgras ni cha shas kyi tshogs pa tsam yang shing rta ma yin na //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the mere collection of parts is also not the chariot.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can med pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gang gi phyir yan lag can med na yan lag kyang med pa de'i phyir yan lag tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can med pas zhes bya ba gsungs te / gang gi phyir yan lag can med na yan lag kyang med pa de'i phyir yan lag tshogs pa'am /
translated: He says, “Because without an owner of the parts, the parts do not exist.”

original: yan lag gi dbyibs tsam shing rta ma yin pa'o //🔽de 'grel bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag gi dbyibs tsam shing rta ma yin pa'o // de 'grel bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because without an owner of the parts, the parts do not exist, therefore the collection of parts or the mere shape of the parts is not the chariot.

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, “Because without an owner of the parts,” and so on.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “also” has the meaning of inclusion.

original: dbyibs tsam shing rtar rigs pa'ang min //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam shing rtar rigs pa'ang min //
translated: It is also not logical that the mere shape is the chariot.

original: zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgras ni tshogs pa tsam shing rta ma yin no zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgras ni tshogs pa tsam shing rta ma yin no zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “also” in the line “The mere collection is not the chariot” includes the statement that the mere collection is not the chariot.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: tshogs pa tsam po'ang mi rigs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam po'ang mi rigs so //
translated: the mere collection is also not tenable.

original: zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to make this understood.🔽From what?

original: gang las she na zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa tsam med par gang las shes she na'o //
analyzed: gang las she na zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa tsam med par gang las shes she na'o //
translated: From the nonexistence of the mere collection.

original: lan ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer is stated in the line “Because the parts do not have the nature of a collection.”

original: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba nyid kyis so //
translated: By themselves means by the mere Saṃkhyas.

original: gang gi phyogs kyi yan lag can yod par 'dod pa de'i phyogs la yang g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dang / dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa la sogs pa mi rigs pas cha shas can med pas yan lag kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs kyi yan lag can yod par 'dod pa de'i phyogs la yang g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dang / dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa la sogs pa mi rigs pas cha shas can med pas yan lag kyang med pa'o //
translated: For those who assert that the part-possessor exists, it is also untenable that the part-possessor is moving or not moving, red or not red, and so on. Therefore, since the part-possessor does not exist, the parts also do not exist.

original: dbyibs smra ba'i phyogs la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbyibs smra ba'i phyogs la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate another error in the position of those who advocate shape, it is said:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽tshogs pa'i yin par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / tshogs pa'i yin par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, if the chariot is not different from its parts, the chariot would not exist prior to its parts.

original: 'phang lo la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'phang lo la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The parts of the chariot are the wheels, etc.🔽The chariot is not different from its parts.🔽The chariot is not the same in existence as its parts.🔽The chariot is not in the parts.🔽The parts are not in the chariot.🔽The chariot does not possess the parts.🔽The parts do not possess the chariot.🔽The chariot is not the collection of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the shape of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the arrangement of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the configuration of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.

original: / sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ma btang ba dag gi zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par gang gis bar mdor med la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: / sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ma btang ba dag gi zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par gang gis bar mdor med la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.

original: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par la gnas pa'o zhes pa'o //🔽btang ba dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par la gnas pa'o zhes pa'o // btang ba dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.

original: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par btang ba dag gi zhes pa'o //🔽gong ma shos 'dod na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par btang ba dag gi zhes pa'o // gong ma shos 'dod na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.

original: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ma btang ba'o //
translated: The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.

original: ci ltar khyod kyi phyogs la 'phang lo la sogs pa'i yan lag rnam pa lngar te sngar gyi gnas skabs na re re ste /
analyzed: ci ltar khyod kyi phyogs la 'phang lo la sogs pa'i yan lag rnam pa lngar te sngar gyi gnas skabs na re re ste /
translated: The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its configuration.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its arrangement.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its parts.🔽The chariot is not the possessor of its shape.

original: so so la dbyibs yod pa'i yan lag de rnams shing rtar gyur pa'i dus su yang dbyibs @264a * //
analyzed: so so la dbyibs yod pa'i yan lag de rnams shing rtar gyur pa'i dus su yang dbyibs @264a * //
translated: The parts that have shape individually also have that shape when they become a chariot.

original: de bzhin du yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the opponent’s position, “It is just like that,”

original: lan 'debs pa ni bye bar gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni bye bar gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the reply is stated: “When they are disassembled . . .” and so forth.

original: de ltar de dag tshogs pa'i dus na shing rta med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag tshogs pa'i dus na shing rta med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, when they are assembled, the chariot does not exist,

original: sngar gyi rang bzhin ma btang bas so //
analyzed: sngar gyi rang bzhin ma btang bas so //
translated: because its previous nature is not relinquished.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir bye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir bye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that example, “When they are disassembled” is stated.

original: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa bye bar gyur pa rnams la shing rta nyid yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du da ltar yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //🔽de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa bye bar gyur pa rnams la shing rta nyid yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du da ltar yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as the chariot does not exist when the wheels and so on are disassembled, it does not exist now either.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that with an example, “If the shape of the parts . . .” and so forth is stated.

original: de'i yan lag gi dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag gi dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The shape of the parts is not different from the shape of the individual parts.

original: shing rta'i yan lag 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs bye bar gyur pa'i skabs dang khyad par med pas so //
analyzed: shing rta'i yan lag 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs bye bar gyur pa'i skabs dang khyad par med pas so //
translated: because there is no difference between the time when the shape of the parts of the chariot, such as the wheels, is distinct and the time when it is not.

original: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the second position is

original: khyad par btang ba dag gi zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: khyad par btang ba dag gi zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin no //
translated: the position that abandons the distinction.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽dbyibs gzhan kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / dbyibs gzhan kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: khyad par can gyi shing rta'i yan lag gi dbyibs las dbyibs gzhan 'byung bar 'dod na'o //🔽de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi shing rta'i yan lag gi dbyibs las dbyibs gzhan 'byung bar 'dod na'o // de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you assert that a different shape arises from the shape of the parts of the distinguished chariot.

original: dbyibs gzhan yongs su rtog na'o //
analyzed: dbyibs gzhan yongs su rtog na'o //
translated: Even so, if you imagine a different shape,

original: da ltar gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir 'phang lo la sogs pa la da ltar te /
analyzed: da ltar gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir 'phang lo la sogs pa la da ltar te /
translated: then now, if you say that the shape of the parts of the chariot, such as the wheels, is different from the shape of the chariot, then the shape of the parts of the chariot, such as the wheels, is the shape of the chariot.

original: shing rta nyid kyi dus na gal te dbyibs kyi khyad par yod par 'dod na de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs las 'phang lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par bzung bar gyur na ste /
analyzed: shing rta nyid kyi dus na gal te dbyibs kyi khyad par yod par 'dod na de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs las 'phang lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par bzung bar gyur na ste /
translated: If you assert that at the time of the chariot there is a difference in shape, then at that time, the difference in shape of the wheels and so on would be apprehended as a different state from the previous one.

original: 'phang lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs gzhan kho na 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phang lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs gzhan kho na 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is, the difference in shape of the wheels and so on would be apprehended as something else.

original: de yang yod min te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang yod min te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And that does not exist.

original: 'phang lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par gzhan du 'dzin par yod pa ni ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phang lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par gzhan du 'dzin par yod pa ni ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: That is, the apprehension of the difference in shape of the wheels and so on as something else does not exist.

original: de'i phyir dbyibs tsam shing rta yod ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs tsam shing rta yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the mere shape does not exist as the chariot.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you say that the shape of the parts🔽is the chariot, that is not tenable.

original: lham pa zhes bya ba ni leb ma'o //
analyzed: lham pa zhes bya ba ni leb ma'o //
translated: The word “flat” means flat.

original: zlum pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kun na zlum pa'o //
analyzed: zlum pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kun na zlum pa'o //
translated: The word “round” means round on all sides.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mnyam pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mnyam pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “and so on” includes even, and so on.

original: gang zhig sngar yod par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bya bar gyur ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngar yod par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bya bar gyur ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: That which is called “previously existent” is the state of being an activity.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par las so //
translated: “ From that” means from the previous particular shape.

original: gzhan zhig @264b kho na zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs las gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan zhig @264b kho na zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs las gzhan nyid do //
translated: “ Another” means just different from the previous shape.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par las gzhan pa'i dbyibs so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par las gzhan pa'i dbyibs so //
translated: “ That” means a shape that is different from the previous particular shape.

original: gzung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: “ It is not apprehended” is the explanation.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “ In this way” and so on is stated.

original: rang gi dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni rtsibs la sogs pa'i gzhan nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni rtsibs la sogs pa'i gzhan nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “ The transformation of its own shape” means the difference of the spokes and so on is seen.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: “ Therefore” is the conclusion.

original: de ltar yan lag rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ni shing rta ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yan lag rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ni shing rta ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that the particular shape of the parts is not the chariot,🔽now, in response to the question, “What is the chariot?”

original: da ni tshogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par yang shing rta ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni tshogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par yang shing rta ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the shape of the collection is also not the chariot, he says:

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “But if you think that the shape of the parts is the chariot, that also is not logical.”

original: phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent’s position.

original: de la lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de la lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: de yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dbyibs de yan lag tshogs kyi ma yin na //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dbyibs de yan lag tshogs kyi ma yin na //
translated: “That also is not logical.”🔽The shape of the collection of parts is not the chariot.

original: zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi tshogs kyi dbyibs de ni shing rta ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi tshogs kyi dbyibs de ni shing rta ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is because the shape of the collection of parts is not the chariot.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la lan ni /🔽gang phyir khyod kyi tshogs pa cang med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gang gi phyir khyod kyi 'dod pas tshogs pa ste spyi 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la lan ni / gang phyir khyod kyi tshogs pa cang med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te / gang gi phyir khyod kyi 'dod pas tshogs pa ste spyi 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reply to that is:🔽“Because your collection is nothing at all.”🔽This is because, according to your assertion, the collection, that is, the universal, does not exist at all.

original: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can las gzhan las gzhan du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can las gzhan las gzhan du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the collection is not established as other than the members of the collection.

original: des na tshogs pa med pa'i phyir tshogs pa la brten pa'i dbyibs kyi rang bzhin can yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na tshogs pa med pa'i phyir tshogs pa la brten pa'i dbyibs kyi rang bzhin can yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no collection, there is no shape that has the nature of depending on a collection.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “Because there is no collection, etc.”

original: gang tshogs pa de ci yang med de dngos po med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang tshogs pa de ci yang med de dngos po med pa yin la /
translated: Because there is no collection, it does not exist.

original: de la brten nas shing rta ci ltar 'gyur te rdzas su med pa'i tshogs pa ni dbyibs kyi nye bar len par mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: de la brten nas shing rta ci ltar 'gyur te rdzas su med pa'i tshogs pa ni dbyibs kyi nye bar len par mi rigs pas so //
translated: How can a chariot be based on that? It is not logical that a collection that does not exist as a substance can be the substantial cause of shape.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this with an example, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de'i rten can zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i tshogs pa'i rten can no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de'i rten can zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i tshogs pa'i rten can no //
translated: “If, etc.”🔽“Based on that” means based on a collection that exists as a substance.

original: 'di'i rten can gyi zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'i rten can no //
analyzed: 'di'i rten can gyi zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'i rten can no //
translated: “Based on this” means based on a collection that does not exist at all.

original: btags pa ni rdzas kyi rten can kho nar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba bas rdzas su yod pa'i nye bar len pa la brten nas dbyibs su nye bar 'dogs par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: btags pa ni rdzas kyi rten can kho nar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba bas rdzas su yod pa'i nye bar len pa la brten nas dbyibs su nye bar 'dogs par 'dod pas so //
translated: The Saṃmitīyas assert that shape is designated in dependence on the substantial appropriated aggregates.

original: gal te mang pos bkur ba bas rdzas su med pa'i snying po med pa tshogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rang bzhin can la shing rtar 'dogs par 'dod na de'i tshe kho bo cag gi 'dod pa yang 'grub pa yin no zhes @265a * //
analyzed: gal te mang pos bkur ba bas rdzas su med pa'i snying po med pa tshogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rang bzhin can la shing rtar 'dogs par 'dod na de'i tshe kho bo cag gi 'dod pa yang 'grub pa yin no zhes @265a * //
translated: If the Saṃmitīyas assert that the chariot is designated in dependence on the shape of the collection of parts that are not substantially existent and lack a core, then at that time our assertion is also established.

original: bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this,

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “If you say,” and so on.

original: khyod kyi 'di ni ci ltar 'dod //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'di ni ci ltar 'dod //
translated: How do you assert this?

original: ces bya ba ni khyod kyi phyogs kyis ji ltar brdzun pa'i tshogs la brten nas brdzun pa'i dbyibs 'dogs par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni khyod kyi phyogs kyis ji ltar brdzun pa'i tshogs la brten nas brdzun pa'i dbyibs 'dogs par 'dod pa'o //
translated: This means that your position asserts that a false shape is designated in dependence on a collection of falsehoods.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du'o //
translated: “In that case” means “in the same way.”

original: mi bden pa yi rgyu la brten byas nas //
analyzed: mi bden pa yi rgyu la brten byas nas //
translated: In dependence on an unreal cause,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu brdzun pa la brten zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu brdzun pa la brten zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the cause, which is based on the false.

original: 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu thams cad skye ba yin par shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu thams cad skye ba yin par shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: The result, etc. means that you should understand that all results, which have a false nature, are produced.

original: des na shing rta'i yan lag rdul phra rab kyi bar la yang bden pa nyid khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na shing rta'i yan lag rdul phra rab kyi bar la yang bden pa nyid khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not accept that even the parts of a chariot, down to the most subtle particles, are real.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Ignorance, etc.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams so //
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams so //
translated: The compositional factors are virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: ma lus pa la yang zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad la yang ngo //🔽dngos po'i grib ma'i ri dags lta bu la mngon par //
analyzed: ma lus pa la yang zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad la yang ngo // dngos po'i grib ma'i ri dags lta bu la mngon par //
translated: In all without exception means in all outer and inner things.🔽The things are like the shadow of a deer.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid grib ma'i ri dags dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid grib ma'i ri dags dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The things themselves are like the shadow of a deer.

original: ci ltar ri dags kyi grib ma la rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du dngos po rnams kyang yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar ri dags kyi grib ma la rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du dngos po rnams kyang yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the shadow of the deer has no intrinsic nature, so also are all things.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni grib ma'i ri dags so //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni grib ma'i ri dags so //
translated: “Whose” refers to the shadow of the deer.

original: 'dis ni bum pa la sogs pa yang bstan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni bum pa la sogs pa yang bstan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to state that this also applies to pots and so on, he says:

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “This” and so on.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i dpes so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i dpes so //
translated: “This” refers to the example of the chariot.

original: de ltar gnas rnams la zhes bya ba ni dbyibs khyad par can la gnas pa rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas rnams la zhes bya ba ni dbyibs khyad par can la gnas pa rnams te /
translated: “In this way, in the case of the components” means in the case of the components that have a distinctive shape.

original: ci ltar shing rta la rnam par dpyad par byas pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la yang bya ste ;
analyzed: ci ltar shing rta la rnam par dpyad par byas pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la yang bya ste ;
translated: Just as the chariot was analyzed, so also form and so on should be analyzed.

original: 'di ltar gal te dbyibs tsam bum par 'dod na dbyibs de yan lag gi'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dbyibs tsam bum par 'dod na dbyibs de yan lag gi'am /
translated: In this way, if the mere shape is asserted to be the pot, then that shape should be considered as belonging to the parts or to the collection.

original: tshogs pa'i yin par rtog pa zhes pa'i rnam par dpyad pa 'dir yang 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i yin par rtog pa zhes pa'i rnam par dpyad pa 'dir yang 'jug par bya'o //
translated: This analysis should be applied here as well.

original: gzhan yang gal te gzugs la yod par gyur na de'i tshe de rnams kyi dbyibs bum par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gzugs la yod par gyur na de'i tshe de rnams kyi dbyibs bum par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, if it existed in form, then at that time its shape would be a pot.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa nyid med pa de rnams kyi dbyibs bum par ci ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa nyid med pa de rnams kyi dbyibs bum par ci ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: However, since form, etc. do not exist, how could their shape be a pot?

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Non-arising is

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: not from self, not from another,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa skye ba bkag pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa skye ba bkag pas so //
translated: etc. Since arising is refuted,

original: @265b de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: @265b de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas kyang ngo //
translated: therefore, also means because of non-arising.

original: mi rigs zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dbyibs bum par rigs pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dbyibs bum par rigs pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Inapplicable means that the shape of form, etc. is not applicable as a pot.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Just like, etc.

original: de ltar ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Just like that has been explained previously means

original: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: because it is said, “Not from itself, etc.”

original: rdzas kyi nye bar len pa can //
analyzed: rdzas kyi nye bar len pa can //
translated: It has substantial appropriation

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa can du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa can du'o //
translated: means it has substantial form, etc., as its appropriated aggregates.

original: de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the opponent’s position,

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Candrakīrti says, “Here they say,” and so on.

original: rnam pa bdun gyis brtsal ba na //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyis brtsal ba na //
translated: When it is sought in the seven ways,

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dang / ldan pa'i phyogs dang / 'dus pa tsam dang / dbyibs kyi rnam par dpyad pa na'o //🔽'di'i don ni gal te shing rta med par 'gyur na shing rta'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dang / ldan pa'i phyogs dang / 'dus pa tsam dang / dbyibs kyi rnam par dpyad pa na'o // 'di'i don ni gal te shing rta med par 'gyur na shing rta'i sgo nas /
translated: means when it is analyzed in terms of identity, difference, the relation between the support and the supported, the relation of inherence, mere aggregation, and shape.

original: shing rta 'on cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i lo ka na tha snyad med par 'gyur ba las tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir shing rta yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shing rta 'on cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i lo ka na tha snyad med par 'gyur ba las tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir shing rta yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the chariot did not exist, then the conventions of the world, such as “Bring the chariot,” would not exist. But since we see that such conventions do exist, the chariot exists.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says:

original: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽nyes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / nyes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should be said” and so forth.

original: shing rta'i tha snyad med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: shing rta'i tha snyad med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: “This fault” is the characteristic of the non-existence of the convention of chariot.

original: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni ;
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni ;
translated: That itself is taught in detail:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In this way” and so forth.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “The method explained previously” is “The chariot is not asserted to be different from its parts” and so forth.

original: shing rta la skye ba med pa yin du chug rnam par ma dpyad par shing rta'i tha snyad byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: shing rta la skye ba med pa yin du chug rnam par ma dpyad par shing rta'i tha snyad byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: One may think that although the chariot does not arise, the convention of chariot is made without analysis.

original: de la lan ni khyod kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni khyod kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reply to that is “You also” and so forth.

original: grub pa'i mtha' pas gzhan zhes bya ba ni lo ka'i tha snyad tsam gyis dngos po rnams yod par 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pas gzhan zhes bya ba ni lo ka'i tha snyad tsam gyis dngos po rnams yod par 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The one who holds the philosophical position says “other” is the characteristic of positing things as existent by the mere convention of the world.

original: 'di'i don ni khyod kyis rnam par dpyad na dngos po rnams grub par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni khyod kyis rnam par dpyad na dngos po rnams grub par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that you assert that things are established when analyzed.

original: rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas dpyad na shing rta yod par ma grub pas ci ltar shing rta'i sgo nas tha snyad byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas dpyad na shing rta yod par ma grub pas ci ltar shing rta'i sgo nas tha snyad byed ces pa'o //
translated: Since the chariot is not established as existent when analyzed in the seven ways, how can you use the chariot to make conventions?

original: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs la skyon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs la skyon brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the faults of the opponent’s position,

original: rang nyid kyi phyogs la nyes pa med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi phyogs la nyes pa med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that our own position is free of faults,

original: kho bo cag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Candrakīrti says, “For us, however, . . .”

original: gang gi phyir de nyid dang lo ka ru yang rnam pa bdun gyis dpyad na shing rta @266a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid dang lo ka ru yang rnam pa bdun gyis dpyad na shing rta @266a * //
translated: Since the chariot is not established as existent when analyzed in the seven ways in either reality or the world,

original: 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: the chariot is not established.

original: de ltar na yang rnam par dpyad pa med par 'phang lo la sogs pa'i rang gi yan lag la brten nas shing rta zhes tha snyad 'dod pas shing rtar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rnam par dpyad pa med par 'phang lo la sogs pa'i rang gi yan lag la brten nas shing rta zhes tha snyad 'dod pas shing rtar grub pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, without analysis, since we assert the convention “chariot” in dependence on its own parts, such as the wheels, the chariot is established.

original: 'di'i don ni kho bos ni rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob khas len pa med kyang kun rdzob ni lo ka'i tha snyad kyi don du lo ka'i sgo nas khas len pa'i phyir kho bo phyogs la ni shing rta'i tha snyad med pa'i mtshan nyid can
analyzed: 'di'i don ni kho bos ni rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob khas len pa med kyang kun rdzob ni lo ka'i tha snyad kyi don du lo ka'i sgo nas khas len pa'i phyir kho bo phyogs la ni shing rta'i tha snyad med pa'i mtshan nyid can
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Although I do not accept the conventional by way of analysis, I do accept the conventional as the object of worldly conventions from the perspective of the world.🔽

original: gyi skyon nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pas so //
analyzed: gyi skyon nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pas so //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Although I do not accept the conventional by way of analysis, I do accept the conventional as the object of worldly conventions, from the worldly perspective. Therefore, I do not commit the error of having a thesis that lacks the conventions of a chariot.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽shing rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / shing rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:🔽The so-called chariot.🔽The words “and so on”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: include the lines:

original: gzhan min ma yin de ltar yang min zhing //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan min ma yin de ltar yang min zhing // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: It is not different from them, nor is it just those.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shing rta'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shing rta'o //
translated: “This” refers to the chariot.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang la ltos nas dpe gnyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang la ltos nas dpe gnyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: “Like blue and so on, or feelings and so on” indicates two examples in terms of external and internal phenomena.

original: ci ltar sngon po la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin du zin kyang lo ka'i tha snyad kyis yod pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ci ltar sngon po la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin du zin kyang lo ka'i tha snyad kyis yod pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as blue, etc. and feelings, etc. are not existent, yet exist by worldly convention.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The words “therefore” and so on conclude the argument.

original: phyogs 'dir zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du kun rdzob yod pas so //
analyzed: phyogs 'dir zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du kun rdzob yod pas so //
translated: In this context, i.e., following worldly convention, without analysis, mere worldly convention is accepted as existent.

original: phyogs 'di la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in this context all worldly conventions are tenable, he says:

original: 'jig rten grags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The world is known to be without analysis.”

original: 'di'i ming gi khyad par zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang cha shas can dang / bya ba dang byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming gi khyad par zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang cha shas can dang / bya ba dang byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “distinctions of names” refers to parts and wholes, actions and agents, etc.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i'o //
translated: The term “this” refers to the world.

original: ming gi khyad par grub pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ming gi khyad par grub pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the establishment of the distinctions of names in this context, he says:

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de nyid yan lag can zhes bya ba ni shing rta de nyid 'phang lo la sogs pa rang gi yan lag la ltos nas yan lag 'di rnams la yod pas na yan lag can zhes bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de nyid yan lag can zhes bya ba ni shing rta de nyid 'phang lo la sogs pa rang gi yan lag la ltos nas yan lag 'di rnams la yod pas na yan lag can zhes bya ba grub bo //
translated: It is thus, etc.🔽That very thing is called the whole, because these parts exist in it, in dependence on the wheel, etc.

original: cha shas can zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa'i cha shas rnams de la yod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: cha shas can zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa'i cha shas rnams de la yod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the possessor of parts, because the parts, such as the wheel, exist in it.

original: shing rta byed pa po zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i bya ba la ltos nas shing rta nyid la byed pa po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing rta byed pa po zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i bya ba la ltos nas shing rta nyid la byed pa po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the maker of the chariot, in dependence on the activity of appropriating the wheel, etc.

original: de ltar skye bo rnams la mi rnams gang yin pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam la ltos nas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar skye bo rnams la mi rnams gang yin pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam la ltos nas grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in dependence on mere unexamined pleasure for people, it is established for people.

original: @266b de 'ba' zhig de ltar grub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'phang lo la sogs pa rang gi nye bar blang bar bya ba len pa'i phyir skye bo rnams la len pa po nyid du yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: @266b de 'ba' zhig de ltar grub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'phang lo la sogs pa rang gi nye bar blang bar bya ba len pa'i phyir skye bo rnams la len pa po nyid du yang grub pa yin no //
translated: Not only is that so, but also, because of taking up its own appropriated aggregates such as wheels, etc., it is established for people as an appropriator.

original: tha dad pa med na ci ltar tha snyad byed ce na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med na ci ltar tha snyad byed ce na /
translated: If there is no difference, how can there be a convention?

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' bar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam gyis grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' bar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam gyis grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is established by the mere convention of the world, which is pleasing when not examined.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: de la shing rta ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la shing rta ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “In that regard, the chariot,” and so on.

original: gang zhig rnam par dpyad par byas nas yan lag la sogs pa 'ba' zhig khas len pa de la ming gi khyad par med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par dpyad par byas nas yan lag la sogs pa 'ba' zhig khas len pa de la ming gi khyad par med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that there is no difference in the name for that which is accepted as only the parts, etc., when it is analyzed,

original: gang 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If someone,” and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: “Such an arrangement” is an arrangement merely by the worldly conventions of what is pleasing when not analyzed.

original: gsung rab kyi don phyin ci log tu rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni lung la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi don phyin ci log tu rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni lung la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: “ Due to a distorted understanding of the meaning of the scriptures” means that the scriptures are distorted by the characteristics of conventional truth.

original: phyin ci log tu rtogs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtogs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that distorted understanding,

original: yan lag tshogs pa tsam yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yan lag tshogs pa tsam yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The mere collection of parts exists” and so on.

original: 'di yang ci ltar phyin ci log yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang ci ltar phyin ci log yin zhe na /
translated: How is this distorted?

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Due to that very reason.”

original: ma dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi yin te /🔽ji ltar yan lag las tha dad pa'i yan lag can la ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi yin te / ji ltar yan lag las tha dad pa'i yan lag can la ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is due to that very reason of the nonobservation of the reason.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is not observed as being different from the parts,

original: yan lag can med pa de bzhin du yan lag kyang ma dmigs pa'i phyir yan lag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can med pa de bzhin du yan lag kyang ma dmigs pa'i phyir yan lag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because the possessor of the parts does not exist, in the same way, the parts also do not exist because they are not observed.

original: yan lag rnams yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the parts depend on the whole.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: de'i phyir gal te rnam par dpyad na ni de'i tshe ni gnyis ka yang yod pa ma yin la gal te rnam par ma dpyad na ni de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du ni gnyis ka la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rnam par dpyad na ni de'i tshe ni gnyis ka yang yod pa ma yin la gal te rnam par ma dpyad na ni de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du ni gnyis ka la yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, if there is analysis, then neither exists; but if there is no analysis, then both exist in mere mundane convention.

original: ma dpyad na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad grub pas so //
analyzed: ma dpyad na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad grub pas so //
translated: For, if there is no analysis, mundane convention is established.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yod par smra ba'o //
translated: This is the one who advocates the existence of the whole.

original: ci ltar dgag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dgag par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be refuted?

original: lan ni / 'jig rten grags pa'i kun rdzob ma brlag cig / ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni / 'jig rten grags pa'i kun rdzob ma brlag cig / ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The reply is: Do not destroy the conventional which is known in the world.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa'i 'jig rten la grags pa'i kun rdzob de brlag par ma byed cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa'i 'jig rten la grags pa'i kun rdzob de brlag par ma byed cig ces pa ste /
translated: Do not destroy that conventional which is known in the world, such as part and whole, etc.

original: de brlag na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de brlag na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For, if it is destroyed, mundane convention is severed.

original: ma dpyad par grub pa'i kun rdzob khas blangs na de kho na nyid la bde blag tu @267a * //
analyzed: ma dpyad par grub pa'i kun rdzob khas blangs na de kho na nyid la bde blag tu @267a * //
translated: If one accepts the unanalyzed relative, one will easily understand suchness.🔽

original: 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if one accepts the unanalyzed relative, one will easily engage the suchness of reality,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Because of this, the wise should not analyze the relative.”

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan min zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan min zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “By this very process” refers to “not from self” and so on, and “the chariot is not different from its parts” and so on.

original: de kho na nyid la bde blag tu ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhes 'dri ba ni /🔽ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la bde blag tu ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhes 'dri ba ni / ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He asks, “How will they easily engage suchness?”

original: lan ni rnam bdun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni rnam bdun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He answers, “By the seven ways.”

original: rnam bdun gyis med gang zhes bya ba ni shing rta gang sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam bdun gyis med gang zhes bya ba ni shing rta gang sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas med pa'o //
translated: “The seven ways of nonexistence” refers to the seven ways by which the chariot is said to be nonexistent.

original: de ji lta bur yod ces bya ba ni shing rta de rnam pa gang gi sgo nas yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji lta bur yod ces bya ba ni shing rta de rnam pa gang gi sgo nas yod par 'gyur te /
translated: “How is it existent?” refers to the way in which the chariot is said to exist.

original: rnam pa bdun las tha dad pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun las tha dad pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pas so //
translated: Because there is no aspect of the chariot that is different from the seven parts.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i'o //🔽de nyid la yang bde blag 'jug 'gyur bas //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i'o // de nyid la yang bde blag 'jug 'gyur bas //
translated: “This” refers to the chariot.🔽“It is easy to understand”

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir kun rdzob 'di ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir kun rdzob 'di ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: means that because this conventional truth is not established by way of its own nature,

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba yin pa de'i phyir de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba yin pa de'i phyir de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: but rather appears in that way due to the power of ignorance, therefore it is easy to understand suchness.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If things existed by way of their own nature,

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis bzlog par mi nus pa de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par mi 'gyur pa las gang gi phyir ma rig pa tsam gyi dbang gis snang bar gyur pa de'i tshe ma rig pa log par gyur na kun rdzob snang
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis bzlog par mi nus pa de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par mi 'gyur pa las gang gi phyir ma rig pa tsam gyi dbang gis snang bar gyur pa de'i tshe ma rig pa log par gyur na kun rdzob snang
translated: it would not be possible to reverse the nature of things, and it would not be easy to understand suchness. But because things appear due to the power of mere ignorance, when ignorance is reversed, the conventional truth that appears

original: ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: will not exist.

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is easy to understand suchness.

original: 'dir / de yi grub pa de bzhin 'dod par bya //
analyzed: 'dir / de yi grub pa de bzhin 'dod par bya //
translated: one should accept its establishment in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa yod par 'dod par bya ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa yod par 'dod par bya ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that one should accept the existence of the conventional truth of the world, which is merely pleasant if not analyzed.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: nye bar rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “conceptualization,” and so on.

original: nye bar rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: “ Conceptualization” means analysis.

original: de zhes bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the entity.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “also” means

original: des de nyid la 'ang bde blag 'jug 'gyur bas //
analyzed: des de nyid la 'ang bde blag 'jug 'gyur bas //
translated: that one should also easily engage with reality through that.

original: zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgras so //
translated: The word “also” means🔽that one should also easily engage with reality through that.

original: kun rdzob nyams par yang mi 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam gyi kun rdzob khas len pas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob nyams par yang mi 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam gyi kun rdzob khas len pas so //
translated: “ The conventional is not destroyed” means that one accepts the conventional, which is merely pleasant if not analyzed.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shing rta'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shing rta'o //
translated: “ This” refers to the chariot.

original: skyon med cing zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang rjes @267b su mthun pas so //
analyzed: skyon med cing zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang rjes @267b su mthun pas so //
translated: “Faultless” means that it is in accordance with worldly conventions.

original: phan yon dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni kho na nyid dang bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phan yon dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni kho na nyid dang bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
translated: “Beneficial” means that it is easy to engage in.

original: da ni shing rta med du zin kyang yan lag med pa nyid gzhan gyis ma bzod na phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: da ni shing rta med du zin kyang yan lag med pa nyid gzhan gyis ma bzod na phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Now, even though the chariot does not exist, if the opponent cannot bear the absence of parts, the prior position is stated:

original: 'dir smras zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the opponent says,

original: lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply,

original: bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The reply is as follows.”

original: bzhad gad du bya ba zhig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shing rta med kyang yan lag tshol bar byed pa de ni snam bu tshig na thal ba la snal ma tshol ba dang 'dra bas khyod ni bzhad gad du bya bar 'os pa yin no
analyzed: bzhad gad du bya ba zhig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shing rta med kyang yan lag tshol bar byed pa de ni snam bu tshig na thal ba la snal ma tshol ba dang 'dra bas khyod ni bzhad gad du bya bar 'os pa yin no
translated: “It is laughable” and so on. Even though the chariot does not exist, the one who searches for its parts is like the one who searches for the threads in the ashes of a burned woolen cloth. Therefore you are worthy of ridicule.

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: shing rta yod nyid min na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shing rta yod nyid min na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If the chariot itself does not exist” and so on.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni shing rta ma dmigs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni shing rta ma dmigs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: “At that time” refers to the time when the chariot is not observed.

original: yan lag can med de'i yan lag kyang med ces bya ba ni gal te yan lag med par gyur na de'i tshe gang gis yan lag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag can med de'i yan lag kyang med ces bya ba ni gal te yan lag med par gyur na de'i tshe gang gis yan lag tu 'gyur te /
translated: “If the parts do not exist, then what will be the parts of that?” means that if the parts do not exist, then what will be the parts of that?

original: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams la ltos pas so //
analyzed: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams la ltos pas so //
translated: Because the possessor of the parts depends on the parts.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gyi'o //
translated: “That” refers to the possessor of the parts.

original: gzhan dag gis yan lag can med kyang yan lag ni yod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis yan lag can med kyang yan lag ni yod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that even without the possessor of the parts, the parts exist, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽shing rta zhig na zhes bya ba ni gzer phyung ba'i gnas skabs na'o//
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / shing rta zhig na zhes bya ba ni gzer phyung ba'i gnas skabs na'o//
translated: “If the chariot is destroyed, etc.”🔽“If the chariot is destroyed, then what will be the parts of that?” means that if the chariot is destroyed, then what will be the parts of that?

original: yan lag can med par yan lag dag kyang med do zhes ci ltar brjod ce na zhes bya ba ni shing rta med kyang shing rta'i yan lag dag ni yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can med par yan lag dag kyang med do zhes ci ltar brjod ce na zhes bya ba ni shing rta med kyang shing rta'i yan lag dag ni yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “How can you say that the parts do not exist without the possessor of the parts?” means that even without the chariot, the parts of the chariot exist.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says:

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That is not so, etc.

original: 'brel pa rig pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni gang gis sngar 'phang lo la sogs pa dang shing rta 'brel pa mthong ba de kho nas shing rta'i yan lag yin no snyam du rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa rig pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni gang gis sngar 'phang lo la sogs pa dang shing rta 'brel pa mthong ba de kho nas shing rta'i yan lag yin no snyam du rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Only through knowing the relation means that only he who previously saw the relation of the wheel, etc. to the chariot thinks, “They are parts of the chariot,”

original: 'brel pa ma mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not he who does not see the relation.

original: des ni shing rta'i yan lag rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yan lag tu grub par gyur na de'i tshe 'brel pa ma mthong bas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba las rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni shing rta'i yan lag rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yan lag tu grub par gyur na de'i tshe 'brel pa ma mthong bas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba las rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since the parts of the chariot would be established as parts by intrinsic reality, then one would understand them even without seeing the relation.

original: des na 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams yan lag gi ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: des na 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams yan lag gi ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs pas so //
translated: But one does not understand them, and therefore it is not tenable to say that the wheel, etc. exist as parts by intrinsic reality.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: des ni rang gi cha shas la //
analyzed: des ni rang gi cha shas la //
translated: By that, the parts

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: are not established as parts.

original: gzhan yang shing rta @268a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang shing rta @268a * //
translated: Moreover, a chariot is not the shape of its parts.🔽

original: mi rigs pa'i shing rta'i yan lag kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i shing rta'i yan lag kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the parts of a chariot are not reasonable even if the chariot is reasonable.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach by means of an example, he says, “Moreover, etc.”

original: dpe 'di las zhes bya ba ni shing rta tshig pa'i dpe'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dpe 'di las zhes bya ba ni shing rta tshig pa'i dpe'i sgo nas so //
translated: “ In this example, etc.” means by means of the example of a burned chariot.

original: don 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi shing rta bsregs na shing rta'i yan lag kyang tshig pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: don 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi shing rta bsregs na shing rta'i yan lag kyang tshig pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: “ This meaning, etc.” means that if the chariot of wisdom is burned, the parts of the chariot are also burned.

original: shing rta tshig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar mes shing rta tshig par 'gyur ba na 'phang lo la sogs pa'i shing rta'i yan lag rnams kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shing rta tshig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar mes shing rta tshig par 'gyur ba na 'phang lo la sogs pa'i shing rta'i yan lag rnams kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “ When the chariot is burned, etc.” means that when the chariot is burned by fire, the parts of the chariot, such as the wheels, do not exist.

original: shing rta tshig na de rnams kyang tshig pas so //
analyzed: shing rta tshig na de rnams kyang tshig pas so //
translated: When the chariot is burned, they are also burned.

original: dpe bstan nas /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the example,

original: don dang sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: don dang sbyar ba ni /
translated: he applies the meaning:

original: blo mes yan lag can bsregs yan lag go //
analyzed: blo mes yan lag can bsregs yan lag go //
translated: The fire of intelligence burns the whole and the parts.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says this.

original: yan lag can te shing rta'i mtshan nyid can shes rab kyi mes bsregs par 'gyur ba na yan lag rnams kyang tshig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can te shing rta'i mtshan nyid can shes rab kyi mes bsregs par 'gyur ba na yan lag rnams kyang tshig pa nyid yin te /
translated: When the parts are burned up, the whole, which is characterized as a chariot, is also burned up.

original: yan lag rnams ni yan lag can kho na la ltos pa'i phyir yan lag can med pas yan lag rnams ga la yod /
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni yan lag can kho na la ltos pa'i phyir yan lag can med pas yan lag rnams ga la yod /
translated: The parts exist only in dependence on the whole. How can the parts exist when the whole does not exist?

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, the root text says:

original: dper na shing rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na shing rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example, when the chariot is burned, its parts are also burned.

original: rnam par dpyod pa'i gtsub shing gtsubs pa las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa'i gtsub shing gtsubs pa las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The friction of the analysis

original: rnam par dpyod pa nyid shing gtsubs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa nyid shing gtsubs pa yin te /
translated: is like the friction of the sticks.🔽The analysis itself is like the friction of the sticks.

original: me byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i shing gi khyad par gtsubs par de ji ltar gtsub shing gtsubs pa las me byung ba de bzhin du rnam par dpyad pa las blo rno ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: me byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i shing gi khyad par gtsubs par de ji ltar gtsub shing gtsubs pa las me byung ba de bzhin du rnam par dpyad pa las blo rno ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as the friction of the sticks is the cause of the fire, the analysis is the cause of the arising of the sharp mind.🔽The fire of the mind

original: blo'i me zhes bya ba ni blo nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: blo'i me zhes bya ba ni blo nyid ma yin te //
translated: is not the mind itself.

original: ji ltar mes sreg par byed pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi mes kyang shing rta mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can du sreg par byed pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa'i sreg par byed pa can gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mes sreg par byed pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi mes kyang shing rta mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can du sreg par byed pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa'i sreg par byed pa can gyi /
translated: Just as fire burns, so too does the fire of wisdom burn, with the characteristic of not observing a chariot.🔽For that very reason, it is said to be

original: shing rta lus pa med par bsregs pas na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: shing rta lus pa med par bsregs pas na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the burning of non-observation, since the chariot is burned without remainder.

original: shes rab kyi mi'i bud shing du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi me'i bsreg byar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi'i bud shing du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi me'i bsreg byar gyur pa ste /
translated: The fuel of the person of wisdom means that which is to be burned by the fire of wisdom.

original: de dag kyang tshig bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshig bar gyur pa'o //
translated: And those are consumed.

original: ji ltar shing rta lo ka'i tha snyad tsam du khas len pa de bzhin du bdag kyang btags pa tsam du yod pa 'jig rten gyi grags pa las khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar shing rta lo ka'i tha snyad tsam du khas len pa de bzhin du bdag kyang btags pa tsam du yod pa 'jig rten gyi grags pa las khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that just as a chariot is accepted as mere worldly convention, so too the self should be accepted as existing as mere designation from the perspective of worldly renown, it is said:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Just as... and so on.

original: shing rta rnam par dpyod pa'i tshul la bsams te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa @268b bdun gyi sgo nas rnam par dpyad na shing rta mi 'thad pa yin no snyam pa'i tshul sems la bzhag nas so //
analyzed: shing rta rnam par dpyod pa'i tshul la bsams te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa @268b bdun gyi sgo nas rnam par dpyad na shing rta mi 'thad pa yin no snyam pa'i tshul sems la bzhag nas so //
translated: The phrase having reflected on the method of investigating the chariot means that one should reflect on the method of thinking, The chariot is not tenable when investigated in the seven ways.

original: brten nas gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i yan lag la brtan nas shing rta 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: brten nas gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i yan lag la brtan nas shing rta 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The phrase the presentation of dependent designation means that the chariot is designated in dependence upon its parts, and it has that nature.

original: de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan zin to //🔽de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas dpyad na bdag mi rigs pas bdag med du zin kyang phung po la sogs pa la brten nas bdag 'gro'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan zin to // de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas dpyad na bdag mi rigs pas bdag med du zin kyang phung po la sogs pa la brten nas bdag 'gro'o //
translated: The phrase in order to easily enter into reality has been explained above.

original: bdag gis shes so //
analyzed: bdag gis shes so //
translated: The phrase in the same way and so on means that just as the self is not tenable when investigated in the seven ways, and so is non-existent, still, in dependence upon the aggregates and so on, one says, I go, I know, I see.

original: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi bcad pa'i don du bdag nye bar len pa po nyid du brtags na 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi bcad pa'i don du bdag nye bar len pa po nyid du brtags na 'dod pa'o //
translated: The self is imagined to be the appropriator for the purpose of not cutting off the conventions of the world, such as this is mine, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: 'jig rten grags pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: in accordance with what is familiar in the world.

original: gzhan du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, the conventions of the world would be explained.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,🔽it is said:

original: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag la brten nas shing rtar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag la brten nas shing rtar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: just as a chariot is described in dependence upon wheels and so on.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bdag tu khas len pa de bzhin du las dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i tha snyad btags pa yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khas blang bar
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bdag tu khas len pa de bzhin du las dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i tha snyad btags pa yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khas blang bar
translated: Just as the self is accepted in accordance with the world, so too the conventions of action, agent, and so on are also accepted in accordance with the world in order to not cut off the conventions of the world.🔽In order to demonstrate this,

original: bya zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag shing rta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag shing rta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as the wheel and so on are called the chariot,” etc.

original: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa dang phung po la sogs pa dag ni nye bar len pa yin la shing rta dang bdag la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa po
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa dang phung po la sogs pa dag ni nye bar len pa yin la shing rta dang bdag la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa po
translated: This presentation of the appropriated and the appropriator: the wheel, etc. and the aggregates, etc. are the appropriated, and the chariot, self, etc. are the appropriator.

original: ste de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa'o //🔽las dang byed pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams ni bdag gis nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na phung po rnams ni las su rnam par gzhag la phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag gis nye bar len par
analyzed: ste de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa'o // las dang byed pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams ni bdag gis nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na phung po rnams ni las su rnam par gzhag la phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag gis nye bar len par
translated: This is their presentation.🔽The presentation of action and agent: the aggregates are presented as action because they are what is appropriated by the self. The self is presented as the appropriator of the aggregates, etc.

original: byed pas na bdag la nye bar len pa po nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: byed pas na bdag la nye bar len pa po nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: because it appropriates the aggregates, etc.

original: shing rta ltar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni btags par yod pa tsam du khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta ltar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni btags par yod pa tsam du khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “Like a chariot” means that it should be accepted as merely an imputation.

original: nyer len zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyer len zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Appropriation” refers to the aggregates and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bdag go /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bdag go /
translated: “ This” refers to the self.

original: de ltar brten nas btags pa la yon tan bstan par bya ba'i @269a * //
analyzed: de ltar brten nas btags pa la yon tan bstan par bya ba'i @269a * //
translated: In this way, in order to teach the benefits of dependent imputation,

original: phyir ; brten nas btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir ; brten nas btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] states, “Because it is not a basis for the concepts of permanence, impermanence, and so on,” and so forth.

original: brtan pa dang mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i rten nyid ma yin pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po yod na brtan pa dang mi brtan par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: brtan pa dang mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i rten nyid ma yin pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po yod na brtan pa dang mi brtan par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: “ Because it is not a basis for the concepts of permanence, impermanence, and so on” means that if things existed, they would be permanent or impermanent.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas bdag dngos por med pa bdag brtan pa dang mi brten pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i rten du ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas bdag dngos por med pa bdag brtan pa dang mi brten pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i rten du ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: But because the self does not exist as a thing, as was taught earlier, how could the self be a basis for the concepts of permanence, impermanence, and so on?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sos pa bsdu bar bya'o //
