analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sos pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The so-called “concepts of permanence, impermanence, and so on” should be included in the same category as “sameness and difference.”

original: de la skyes nas mi 'jig pa ni rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: de la skyes nas mi 'jig pa ni rtag pa yin la /
translated: Therein, that which is born and does not perish is permanent.

original: skyes nas 'jig pa ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig pa ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: That which is born and perishes is impermanent.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid med ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa dang bdag las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa bdag med pas so //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid med ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa dang bdag las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa bdag med pas so //
translated: “ Neither sameness nor difference” means that the self is not the same as or different from the aggregates, and so on.

original: brtan pa dang mi brtan pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtan pa dang mi brtan pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for “neither stable nor unstable,”

original: dngos po yod min zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po yod min zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “no entity exists,” and so on.

original: bdag dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because the self is not an existent entity.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: phung po dag la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po dag la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “in dependence upon the aggregates,” and so on.

original: de la gal te bdag mi brtan pa yin na ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gal te bdag mi brtan pa yin na ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: If the self is not stable, then it would contradict the treatise.

original: bstan bcos dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: It would contradict the treatise Fundamental Wisdom of the Middle Way.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir nye bar len pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir nye bar len pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says “because it is the appropriated aggregates” and so on.

original: gang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba de dag ni skad cig so so la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yin la bdag ni phung po las de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par mi nus te skyon
analyzed: gang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba de dag ni skad cig so so la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yin la bdag ni phung po las de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par mi nus te skyon
translated: Those called the five appropriated aggregates arise and disintegrate in every moment, but the self cannot be said to be the same as the aggregates or different from them or permanent or impermanent, because many

original: du mi 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: du mi 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: faults would ensue.

original: 'di ltar gal te bdag rtag pa yin na rtag par smra bar 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag na chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bdag rtag pa yin na rtag par smra bar 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag na chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus if the self were permanent, it would follow that one would be an advocate of permanence, and if impermanent, it would follow that one would be an advocate of annihilation.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa zhes bya ba'i gnyis ka yang don ma yin pa chen por 'gyur bas khas blang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa zhes bya ba'i gnyis ka yang don ma yin pa chen por 'gyur bas khas blang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o ;
translated: Since both “eternalism” and “annihilationism” are great non-meanings, they are not to be accepted.

original: / de ltar nye bar blang ba'i phung po lnga nyid bdag nyid du mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: / de ltar nye bar blang ba'i phung po lnga nyid bdag nyid du mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is not logical that the five appropriated aggregates themselves are the self.

original: gzhan yang nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa por ji ltar 'gyur te bum pa dang rdza mkhan dag kyang gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa por ji ltar 'gyur te bum pa dang rdza mkhan dag kyang gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, how could the appropriated become the appropriator? It follows that the pot and the potter would be one.

original: de bzhin du ma byung ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te bdag sngar ma byung ba @269b phyis 'byung bar 'gyur na de'i tshe bdag byas par thal bar 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byung ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te bdag sngar ma byung ba @269b phyis 'byung bar 'gyur na de'i tshe bdag byas par thal bar 'gyur ba las /
translated: Similarly, if the self were to arise from what did not exist previously, then it would follow that the self is created.

original: bdag byas par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag byas par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not asserted that the self is created,

original: mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow that it is impermanent.

original: de las tha dad pa'i de sgrub par byed pa'i byed pa po yang med pas bdag byas pa nyid du khas len pa ni 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sngar byed pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur ba las de ltar 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i de sgrub par byed pa'i byed pa po yang med pas bdag byas pa nyid du khas len pa ni 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sngar byed pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur ba las de ltar 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no creator of the self that is different from the self, the assertion that the self is created would entail that cyclic existence has a beginning, and that sentient beings who did not exist previously would come into existence.

original: des na bdag ni byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag ni byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the self is not created.

original: gzhan yang 'byung ba rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung ba rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, the elements would arise without a cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar med pa'i bdag 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar med pa'i bdag 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the self that did not exist previously were to arise,

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: it would arise without a cause.

original: sngar bdag med pas byed pa po med pas rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bdag med pas byed pa po med pas rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since the self does not exist previously, it would arise without a cause because there would be no creator.

original: 'dis ni bstan bcos las bdag mi rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bstan bcos las bdag mi rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This demonstrates that the treatise does not state that the self is impermanent.

original: gal te bdag mi rtag pa nyid kyi rten du khas len na de'i tshe bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag mi rtag pa nyid kyi rten du khas len na de'i tshe bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: If you assert that the self is the basis of impermanence, then you contradict the treatise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'dod pas so //
translated: Therefore, because of that, means because of not asserting impermanence.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is not tenable as impermanence, is the conclusion.

original: bstan pa yang mi 'thad pa de bstan bcos kyi khungs kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa yang mi 'thad pa de bstan bcos kyi khungs kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the teaching is untenable by way of the source of the treatise,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, likewise, and so on.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: Just as it is said is from Fundamental Wisdom.🔽As for past and so on, if that which arose in the past were to become present, then it would be tenable to say that it arose in the past.

original: 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang 'das pa'i skye bar byung ba 'di nyid gal te da ltar byung bar gyur na de'i tshe 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa las ltar yang mi 'thad de rtag pa
analyzed: 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang 'das pa'i skye bar byung ba 'di nyid gal te da ltar byung bar gyur na de'i tshe 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa las ltar yang mi 'thad de rtag pa
translated: However, that is not tenable because it would be permanent.

original: nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rtag pa 'khor bar yang mi rigs pa dang / 'gro ba gcig la gnas su zin kyang 'gro ba sna tshogs pa 'dzin par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rtag pa 'khor bar yang mi rigs pa dang / 'gro ba gcig la gnas su zin kyang 'gro ba sna tshogs pa 'dzin par 'gyur bas so //
translated: and even if one being were to be the support, it would be impossible for the various beings to be supported.🔽Here, if one imagines that one who was a being of hell and so on, was born as a human now, he would be a being of hell.

original: 'dir dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba can du gyur nas da ltar mir skyes nang nyid dmyal bar gnas so zhes de ltar rtog na de nyid 'di la mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba can du gyur nas da ltar mir skyes nang nyid dmyal bar gnas so zhes de ltar rtog na de nyid 'di la mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not logical that a human would be a being of hell and so on.

original: ji ltar na mi nyid dmyal ba la sogs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na mi nyid dmyal ba la sogs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: How could a human be a being of hell and so on?

original: 'on mdo las de'i tshe de'i dus nang nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nga las nu zhes bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba de ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on mdo las de'i tshe de'i dus nang nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nga las nu zhes bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba de ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: But how should one understand the sutra statement, “At that time, at that epoch, I was the king of the world called Mahapadma”?

original: de ltar gsungs pa de ni gzhan nyid dgag pa tsam yin gyi de nyid du ston par mdzad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa de ni gzhan nyid dgag pa tsam yin gyi de nyid du ston par mdzad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This statement is to be understood as a mere denial of difference, not as an assertion of identity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe de'i dus na gzhan ma yin no @270a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe de'i dus na gzhan ma yin no @270a * //
translated: For that reason, at that time, I was not someone else.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that “at that time, in those days, he was not another.”

original: gal te sngon gyi de nyid da ltar gyi 'di yin no zhes de bzhin du gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi de nyid da ltar gyi 'di yin no zhes de bzhin du gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is asked, “If the former self is the present self, what is the error?”

original: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon brjod du zin kyang yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon brjod du zin kyang yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: it is said that “there would be the error of eternalism.”

original: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that “that very self would be the self,”

original: nye bar len pa tha dad par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa tha dad par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said that “there would be the error of the difference of appropriation.”

original: gal te sngon gyi bdag nyid de nyid da ltar gyi yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi bdag nyid de nyid da ltar gyi yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the former self were the present self,

original: de'i tshe phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi nye bar len pa la khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi nye bar len pa la khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be no difference in appropriation, which is characterized by the five aggregates.

original: bdag ni nye bar len pa la khyad par med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len pa la khyad par med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not without difference in appropriation.

original: 'on kyang nye bar len pa ni khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar len pa ni khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: However, appropriation is different.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu las tha dad pa dang / dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu las tha dad pa dang / dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different from the appropriated aggregates and because it is a different time.

original: des na nye bar len pa khyad par can ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid de nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa khyad par can ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid de nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the self is not distinguished by the appropriated aggregates, it is not reasonable that it is the same in reality.

original: gal te nye bar len pa khyad par can yin du chug / bdag ni gcig nyid yin pas bdag la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na de ltar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa khyad par can yin du chug / bdag ni gcig nyid yin pas bdag la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na de ltar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is distinguished by the appropriated aggregates, but is one only, and that therefore there is no distinction in the self, and that it is said that “I was like this in the past,”🔽we reply:

original: de la lan ni nye bar len pa las ma gtogs par /
analyzed: de la lan ni nye bar len pa las ma gtogs par /
translated: Apart from the appropriated aggregates,

original: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: what is your self?

original: gal te nye bar len pa gzhan yin la bdag min par gyur na /🔽de'i tshe nye bar len pa khyad par yin du zin kyang bdag las khyad par med par 'gyur ba las 'di ni bdag go //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa gzhan yin la bdag min par gyur na / de'i tshe nye bar len pa khyad par yin du zin kyang bdag las khyad par med par 'gyur ba las 'di ni bdag go //
translated: If the appropriated aggregates were one thing and the self were another,

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha dad du bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha dad du bstan par mi nus te /
translated: then even if the appropriated aggregates were distinguished, the self would not be distinguished. But it cannot be demonstrated that “this is the self” and “that is the appropriated aggregates.”

original: bdag de nye bar len pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa yin na rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / tha dad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur bas so //🔽gang gi tshe nye bar len pa las ma gtogs par bdag ston par mi nus pa de'i tshe nye bar len pa ni khyad par can yin la /
analyzed: bdag de nye bar len pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa yin na rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / tha dad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur bas so // gang gi tshe nye bar len pa las ma gtogs par bdag ston par mi nus pa de'i tshe nye bar len pa ni khyad par can yin la /
translated: If that self were different from the nature of the appropriated aggregates, it would follow that it would be causeless, and it would follow that it would be apprehended as different.🔽When it is not possible to demonstrate a self apart from the appropriated aggregates, then it is not possible to conceive that the appropriated aggregates are qualified,

original: bdag ni khyad par can ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag ni khyad par can ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar brtag par mi nus so //
translated: while the self is not qualified.

original: de ltar bstan bcos kyi sgo nas bdag bstan pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos kyi sgo nas bdag bstan pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable to demonstrate a self by means of the treatise.

original: skye 'jig med pa nyid bstan bcos kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye 'jig med pa nyid bstan bcos kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nonexistence of origination and destruction by means of the treatise,

original: skye 'jig can du 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skye 'jig can du 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It would possess the two attributes of origination and destruction,” and so on.

original: khyad par gnyis zhes bya ba ni skye 'jig yin zhes bya ba'i khyad par gnyis so //
analyzed: khyad par gnyis zhes bya ba ni skye 'jig yin zhes bya ba'i khyad par gnyis so //
translated: The two attributes means the two attributes of origination and destruction.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa yang bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan bcos kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa yang bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan bcos kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this by means of the treatise,

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Here, it is said,” and so on.

original: ji @270b skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji @270b skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “ Just as” means in Fundamental Wisdom of the Middle Way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i tshul gyis bdag yongs su rtog par mdzad pa na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su brtags nas dpyod pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i tshul gyis bdag yongs su rtog par mdzad pa na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag yongs su brtags nas dpyod pas so //
translated: “ When the Tathāgata analyzes the self” means when the Tathāgata analyzes and investigates the self.

original: rtag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs la de rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs la de rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: “ Permanent” and so on refers to the fourteen undeclared topics that the Bhagavān stated in the sūtras, which have already been explained above.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la stong pa nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa de bzhin du rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi yang srid pa ma yin pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs dang dkar sham la sos pa bzhin du
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la stong pa nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa de bzhin du rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi yang srid pa ma yin pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs dang dkar sham la sos pa bzhin du
translated: Just as emptiness, etc. are impossible for the Tathāgata, in the same way, permanence, etc. are also impossible. Therefore, the Lord has not declared the four possibilities regarding the Tathāgata, just as he has not declared the dark or light complexion of the son of a barren woman.

original: 'jig rten pa la rnam pa bzhi lung ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la rnam pa bzhi lung ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the four possibilities are not declared for the world.

original: ci ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bzhi po 'di mi srid pa de bzhin du mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa yang zhi ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa la srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ci ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bzhi po 'di mi srid pa de bzhin du mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa yang zhi ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa la srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Just as these four are impossible for the Tathāgata, in the same way, “having an end,” “not having an end,” etc. are also not possible for the peaceful Tathāgata. In order to demonstrate this,

original: mtha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mtha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says “end,” etc.🔽In order to demonstrate that the four conceptual thoughts, “The Tathāgata arises after passing away,” etc. are impossible,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi 'jug pa mi srid do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi 'jug pa mi srid do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says “The Tathāgata,” etc.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse that begins By whom explains this.

original: gang gis mngon par zhen pa chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes shin tu stug pos gzung bar 'gyur ba ste yongs su rtog pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis mngon par zhen pa chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes shin tu stug pos gzung bar 'gyur ba ste yongs su rtog pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: By whom, means by whom, through a great attachment, the Tathāgata is apprehended as existing, that is, by whom the conception is generated.

original: des nges par de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur na grongs pa'i phyis kyi dus su de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: des nges par de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur na grongs pa'i phyis kyi dus su de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If, by that, the Tathāgata were to pass into nirvāṇa, then after his death, the Tathāgata would not arise,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chad pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chad pa'am /
translated: or the Tathāgata would be annihilated,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa byed na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa byed na'o //
translated: or the Tathāgata would not exist.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog na de'i tshe lta ba'i rnam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog na de'i tshe lta ba'i rnam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one conceives in this way, then at that time, it is a view.

original: gang gi phyogs la gnas skabs 'ga' zhig na yang de bzhin gshegs pa la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid med pa de'i phyogs la ni nam mkha' la ri mo'i gzugs rtog pa bzhin du rtog pa ni yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la gnas skabs 'ga' zhig na yang de bzhin gshegs pa la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid med pa de'i phyogs la ni nam mkha' la ri mo'i gzugs rtog pa bzhin du rtog pa ni yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o
translated: For one who does not have the position that the Tathāgata exists or does not exist in any way, there is no position that is like a painting in space.

original: // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ngo bo nyid kyis stong de la //
analyzed: // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ngo bo nyid kyis stong de la //
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “That which is empty of intrinsic reality,” and so on.

original: de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du bstan nas /🔽bstan bcos kyi sgo nas de nyid dang gzhan nyid yod @271a * //
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du bstan nas / bstan bcos kyi sgo nas de nyid dang gzhan nyid yod @271a * //
translated: Thus, having taught the nonexistence of permanence, impermanence, and so on,

original: pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that identity and difference do not exist through the treatise,

original: 'di ni phung po dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni phung po dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This is the purification of the aggregates,” and so on.

original: sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This was explained earlier.

original: de bzhin du shing nyid me ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shing nyid me ni ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, “Wood is not fire,” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The phrase “and so on” means

original: shing las me ni gzhan min te //🔽me ni bud shing dag ldan min //
analyzed: shing las me ni gzhan min te // me ni bud shing dag ldan min //
translated: Fire is not different from fuel,🔽Fire does not possess fuel,

original: me la shing min der de min //
analyzed: me la shing min der de min //
translated: Fire is not in fuel, nor is fuel in fire.

original: bdag dang nye bar len pa yin //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar len pa yin //
translated: This is the case with the self and the appropriated.

original: rim pa thams cad ma lus par //
analyzed: rim pa thams cad ma lus par //
translated: All of the stages are explained

original: me dang shing dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: me dang shing dag gis bshad do //
translated: By fire and fuel.

original: 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gal te bud shing me yin na //
analyzed: gal te bud shing me yin na //
translated: If fuel were fire,

original: las dang byed po gcig nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: las dang byed po gcig nyid 'gyur //
translated: Then there would be the error that the object and agent are the same.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis shing dang me dag gcig nyid bkag pas shing nyid me ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis shing dang me dag gcig nyid bkag pas shing nyid me ma yin no //
translated: This shows that since fire and fuel are refuted as being the same, fuel is not fire.

original: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
translated: If fire were different from fuel,

original: shing med par yang yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: shing med par yang yod par 'gyur //
translated: It would exist without fuel.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis gzhan nyid yin pa bkag pas shing las me gzhan nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis gzhan nyid yin pa bkag pas shing las me gzhan nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that since difference is refuted, fire is not different from fuel.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs gnyis ka bkag pas de dang ldan pa'i phyogs dang rten dang ldan pa'i phyogs dag kyang shugs kyis bkag nas /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs gnyis ka bkag pas de dang ldan pa'i phyogs dang rten dang ldan pa'i phyogs dag kyang shugs kyis bkag nas /
translated: Since both the positions of sameness and difference are refuted, the position of the possessor of fuel and the position of the basis of fuel are also implicitly refuted.

original: de mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the conclusion of this, it is said:

original: me ni bud shing dang ldan min //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: me ni bud shing dang ldan min // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Fire is not possessed of fuel.🔽Fuel is possessed of fire.

original: bud shing 'di la yod pas bud shing dang ldan no //
analyzed: bud shing 'di la yod pas bud shing dang ldan no //
translated: Fuel is possessed of fire because it exists in the fuel.

original: de yang tha dad pa 'am tha mi dad pa nyid du yod par 'gyur na 'thad pa las me dang bud shing dag la phyogs gnyis ka bkag pa'i phyir me bud shing dang ldan pa nyid bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa 'am tha mi dad pa nyid du yod par 'gyur na 'thad pa las me dang bud shing dag la phyogs gnyis ka bkag pa'i phyir me bud shing dang ldan pa nyid bkag pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it would exist as either different or non-different. But since both alternatives are refuted in the case of fire and fuel, the possession of fire by fuel is refuted.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni 'khar gzhong bzhin du rten nyid du grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni 'khar gzhong bzhin du rten nyid du grub pa yin la /
translated: If it were different, it would be established as a support, like a winnowing fan.

original: bud shing dang me dag las gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir med la bud shing ngo zhes pa yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: bud shing dang me dag las gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir med la bud shing ngo zhes pa yang mi rigs so //
translated: But since it is not different from fire and fuel, it is not tenable to say, “Fuel is of fire.”

original: bud shing la yang me yod pa ma yin pa ste gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud shing la yang me yod pa ma yin pa ste gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is fire possessed of fuel, because difference is refuted.🔽Just as it is not tenable to analyze in five ways, so also the self is not tenable.

original: ji ltar rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas dpyad na mi 'thad pa de bzhin du bdag kyang ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas dpyad na mi 'thad pa de bzhin du bdag kyang ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: bdag dang nye bar len pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar len pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The self and the appropriated, etc.

original: de la nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na nyer len te nyer len gyi phung po lnga'o ;
analyzed: de la nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na nyer len te nyer len gyi phung po lnga'o ;
translated: Therein, since they are to be appropriated, they are the appropriated aggregates.

original: / de dag la brten nas btags pa nye bar len pa 'dzin cing sgrub par byed pa'i bdag ces bya ste /
analyzed: / de dag la brten nas btags pa nye bar len pa 'dzin cing sgrub par byed pa'i bdag ces bya ste /
translated: The self is that which is imputed in dependence on them, and it is said to be the appropriator because it appropriates and establishes the appropriated aggregates.

original: bdag de dang nye bar len pa dag grub pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de thams cad med pa shing dag gis bshad pa nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag de dang nye bar len pa dag grub pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de thams cad med pa shing dag gis bshad pa nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: All the stages of the establishment of the self and the appropriated should be understood as explained in the case of the fire and fuel.

original: thams cad dang ma lus pa la khyad par ci zhig yod @271b snyam na thams cad smos pas ni bshad ma thag pa'i phyogs lnga bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad dang ma lus pa la khyad par ci zhig yod @271b snyam na thams cad smos pas ni bshad ma thag pa'i phyogs lnga bstan pa yin la /
translated: If one asks, “What is the difference between all and none remaining?” the statement “all” indicates the five positions just explained.

original: des na phyogs lnga po thams cad me dang bud shing bzhin du bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la ma tshang ba med par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na phyogs lnga po thams cad me dang bud shing bzhin du bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la ma tshang ba med par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all five positions should be applied without exception to the self and the appropriated, just as was done in the case of fire and fuel.

original: gang phyogs lnga bstan pa la 'thad pa'i rim pa bstan pa ma lus par bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang phyogs lnga bstan pa la 'thad pa'i rim pa bstan pa ma lus par bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la yang shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the entire presentation of the five topics is applicable to the self and the appropriated aggregates.

original: me dang bu shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud par ba'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: me dang bu shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud par ba'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The words “in every way” indicate that the self and the appropriated aggregates are similar to fire and fuel in being refuted in every way.

original: ma lus zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ma lus zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The word “entirely” is used to indicate that.

original: de la nye bar len pa gang yin pa de nyid du bdag nyid du mi rigs te las dang byed pa po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa gang yin pa de nyid du bdag nyid du mi rigs te las dang byed pa po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: It is not logical for the appropriated aggregates to be the self, because it would then follow, absurdly, that the agent and the object of an action would be one and the same.

original: nye bar blang bar bya ba gzhan nyid dang nye bar len pa po gzhan nyid du yang mi rigs te phung po las tha dad du bdag dmigs par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nye bar blang bar bya ba gzhan nyid dang nye bar len pa po gzhan nyid du yang mi rigs te phung po las tha dad du bdag dmigs par 'gyur bas so //
translated: It is also not logical for the self to be different from the appropriated aggregates, because the self would then be perceived as separate from the aggregates.

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa dag bkag pas bdag phung po dang ldan la yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa dag bkag pas bdag phung po dang ldan la yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since we have refuted the self being either the same as or different from the aggregates, the self does not possess the aggregates.

original: gzhan nyid med pas bdag la phung po dang phung po la yang bdag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pas bdag la phung po dang phung po la yang bdag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference, the self does not exist in the aggregates, nor do the aggregates exist in the self.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas bdag yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir las dang byed pa po bzhin du bdag dang nye bar len pa dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas bdag yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir las dang byed pa po bzhin du bdag dang nye bar len pa dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since the self does not exist in five ways, therefore, like action and the agent, the self and appropriation are not established in mutual dependence.

original: bstan bcos kyi gzhung 'dis ni bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la de nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi gzhung 'dis ni bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la de nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pa yin no //
translated: This treatise text refutes the self and appropriation being the same or different.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for not being the basis of the conception of permanence, etc.,

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de la zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de la zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //
translated: he says “Why is that?” and so on.🔽There means in the self.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: That means the self.

original: bdag med pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the sūtra source for selflessness,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “As it is said,” and so on.

original: 'jig rten mgon gyi zhes bya ba ni lo ka rnams kyi mgon po ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon gyi zhes bya ba ni lo ka rnams kyi mgon po ste /
translated: The “lord of the world” is the protector of the world.

original: rje'o sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: rje'o sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: The “Buddha Bhagavat” is the Lord.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sems can yongs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “the complete extinction of sentient beings, etc.”

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu la sogs pa 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu la sogs pa 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: The “Buddha qualities” are the ten powers, etc., which will be explained below.

original: sems can la sogs pa rnams ci ltar na mi zad pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa rnams ci ltar na mi zad pa yin snyam na /
translated: How is it that sentient beings, etc., are inexhaustible?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gal te sems can la sogs pa rnams la rdzas su @272a * //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gal te sems can la sogs pa rnams la rdzas su @272a * //
translated: He says, “If, etc.”

original: yod par 'gyur na de'i tshe yongs su zad par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: yod par 'gyur na de'i tshe yongs su zad par 'gyur ba las /
translated: If sentient beings, etc., existed substantially, then they would be completely extinguished.

original: 'on kyang bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: However, he teaches that they are primordially non-arisen, saying, “not from self, etc.”

original: ji ltar na 'di rnams yongs su zad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di rnams yongs su zad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: How could they be completely extinguished?

original: de ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i yul bdag ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i yul bdag ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that the self is not the object of the concepts of permanence, etc.,

original: bdag la mngon par zhen pa ni 'ching ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: bdag la mngon par zhen pa ni 'ching ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: he states that the cause of bondage is the adherence to the self,

original: bdag la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni grol ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni grol ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and that the cause of liberation is the absence of adherence to the self.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To this end he says, “Whoever searches for the self in the seven ways, etc.”

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “Whoever” refers to the self.

original: rnam pa bdun gyis btsal na zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / de dang ldan pa dang / rten dang brten pa'i rnam pa gnyis dang / phung po'i tshogs dang / phung po'i dbyibs kyi tshogs pa ste bdun gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyis btsal na zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / de dang ldan pa dang / rten dang brten pa'i rnam pa gnyis dang / phung po'i tshogs dang / phung po'i dbyibs kyi tshogs pa ste bdun gyis so //
translated: “In the seven ways” refers to the seven ways of searching for the self as different from the aggregates, not different from the aggregates, possessing the aggregates, the aggregates as its support, the form aggregate as its support, the collection of aggregates, and the shape of the aggregates.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “Whoever” refers to the self.

original: 'khor bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In cyclic existence” refers to

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
translated: When there is a self, one knows of another.

original: bdag gzhan gnyis la 'dzin dang chags //
analyzed: bdag gzhan gnyis la 'dzin dang chags //
translated: From the two, self and other, there is grasping and attachment.

original: de gnyis dang ni 'brel pa las //
analyzed: de gnyis dang ni 'brel pa las //
translated: From the connection with those two,

original: nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba yin // zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because all faults arise in that way.

original: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'o //🔽rtag tu 'gro rnams ngar 'dzin blo //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'o // rtag tu 'gro rnams ngar 'dzin blo //
translated: The phrase “this is the self” refers to the belief in the existence of a self where there is no self, which is the cause of saṃsāra.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang la rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba rnams la ngar 'dzin pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni bdag yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //🔽de'i gang yin der ngar 'dzin blo 'byung la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang la rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba rnams la ngar 'dzin pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni bdag yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o // de'i gang yin der ngar 'dzin blo 'byung la //
translated: The phrase “the mind that grasps an ‘I’ always occurs in relation to the world” should be understood to mean that the self is that in relation to which the mind that grasps an “I” always occurs in relation to the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po gang yin pa bdag de dang 'brel pa gang zhig gis 'brel pa de ngar 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po gang yin pa bdag de dang 'brel pa gang zhig gis 'brel pa de ngar 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “the mind that grasps an ‘I’ occurs in relation to that” means that the mind that grasps an “I” occurs in relation to whatever internal or external thing is connected to that self.

original: dngos po thams cad yod pa ma yin na ngar 'dzin gyi blo dang bdag gi ba'i blo ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yod pa ma yin na ngar 'dzin gyi blo dang bdag gi ba'i blo ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If all things are nonexistent, how can the mind that grasps an “I” and the mind that grasps “mine” occur?

original: ma brtags grags par gti mug las yin no //
analyzed: ma brtags grags par gti mug las yin no //
translated: It is from delusion, in the worldly unexamined way.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mi shes pas ma brtags par grub pa'i log pa'i tha snyad las so //
analyzed: mi shes pas ma brtags par grub pa'i log pa'i tha snyad las so //
translated: It is from the false conventions of the ignorant, who do not examine things.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That which is imagined by the tīrthikas, etc.

original: yongs su tshol ba na zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin la dpyad pa na'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba na zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin la dpyad pa na'o //
translated: When it is investigated, i.e., when its nature is examined.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽mu stegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / mu stegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:🔽The nature of that is distorted, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin la byin ci log tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin @272b la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la byin ci log tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin @272b la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The nature of the self is distorted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rigs pas mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rigs pas mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says: Because it is not tenable by reason.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas bdag 'di mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas bdag 'di mi rigs pas so //
translated: Because this self is not tenable by reason, as was previously demonstrated.

original: phung po las tha dad par zhe na cing zhes bya ba ni phung po las bdag tha dad par yod par zhen nas so //
analyzed: phung po las tha dad par zhe na cing zhes bya ba ni phung po las bdag tha dad par yod par zhen nas so //
translated: If it is different from the aggregates, etc.

original: rang gi sde pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa rnams so //
translated: “Our own group” refers to Buddhists.

original: gal te phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin pas phung po rnams bdag nyid du ci ltar 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin pas phung po rnams bdag nyid du ci ltar 'thad snyam na /
translated: If the aggregates are impermanent, how could it be tenable that the aggregates are the self?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is as follows.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “due to confusion.”

original: phung po rnams la bdag med pa la bdag gi ngo bor 'khrul pas so //
analyzed: phung po rnams la bdag med pa la bdag gi ngo bor 'khrul pas so //
translated: Since there is no self in the aggregates, there is confusion about the nature of the self.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “This” refers to the self.

original: brgya phrag ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: brgya phrag ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: “Hundreds” is just an illustration.

original: du ma yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: du ma yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Many are liberated.

original: de ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag de lta bu'i khyad par can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag de lta bu'i khyad par can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “That is the self” means that the self should be understood to have such a distinction.

original: de'i gang yin der zhes bya ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir gang du 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i gang yin der zhes bya ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir gang du 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain “that which is his is his,” it is said, “wherever this . . .”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “This” refers to the self.

original: dbang ba nyid dam zhes bya ba ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa ste de'i dbang gis 'jug pas so //
analyzed: dbang ba nyid dam zhes bya ba ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa ste de'i dbang gis 'jug pas so //
translated: “Under the control of” refers to sons, wives, and so on, because one is controlled by them.

original: 'brel pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni khang pa dang nor la sogs pa rnams la ste de rnams la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'brel pa yod pas so //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni khang pa dang nor la sogs pa rnams la ste de rnams la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'brel pa yod pas so //
translated: “In some relation” refers to houses, wealth, and so on, because there is a relation of mine and mine to them.

original: 'di gdags pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gdags pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o //
translated: “The basis of designation” means the ground for the designation of self.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni bu dang chung ma dang khang pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rang gi ngo bos grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni bu dang chung ma dang khang pa la sogs pa'o // rang gi ngo bos grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “External” refers to sons, wives, houses, and so on.🔽“Not by intrinsic reality” means not by intrinsic nature.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin mi 'thad pas so /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin mi 'thad pas so /
translated: Since the reasoning explained earlier shows that intrinsic reality is not tenable, intrinsic nature is not tenable.

original: rnal 'byor pa dag gis rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi shes pa'i dbang gis de yod pa yin la ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams la mi shes pa med pas de mi dmigs🔽pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag gis rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi shes pa'i dbang gis de yod pa yin la ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams la mi shes pa med pas de mi dmigs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Yogis do not apprehend it in any way” means that because it exists through the power of ignorance, not through its own intrinsic reality, yogis do not have ignorance and therefore do not apprehend it.

original: de'i nye bar len pa rnams mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nye bar len pa mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa rnams mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nye bar len pa mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Its appropriation does not occur” means that the appropriation of the self, the eyes, and so on, does not occur.

original: bdag gi ba ni bdag la ltos pa yin pas bdag ma dmigs na bdag gi yang ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: bdag gi ba ni bdag la ltos pa yin pas bdag ma dmigs na bdag gi yang ma dmigs pas so //
translated: Since the self’s appropriation depends on the self, if the self is not apprehended, the self’s appropriation is not apprehended either.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags na bdag dang @273a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags na bdag dang @273a * //
translated: “Therefore, they are liberated from cyclic existence” means that when the self and the self’s appropriation are not apprehended,

original: bdag gi ba ma dmigs pas /
analyzed: bdag gi ba ma dmigs pas /
translated: the self and the self’s appropriation do not exist.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dag yongs su zad pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad log pas skye ba zad cing rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dag yongs su zad pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad log pas skye ba zad cing rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: From the complete exhaustion of the grasping at “I” and “mine, ” all afflictions such as desire are reversed, and so birth is exhausted and one becomes liberated.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “ As it is said” is from the wisdom chapter of the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: nang dang phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽nang ste nang du ngar 'dzin zad pas phyi rol gyi bdag gi'o snyam pa zad pas na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi nye bar len pa 'gags par 'gyur zhing nye bar len pa zad pas na srid pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi skye ba zad
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / nang ste nang du ngar 'dzin zad pas phyi rol gyi bdag gi'o snyam pa zad pas na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi nye bar len pa 'gags par 'gyur zhing nye bar len pa zad pas na srid pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi skye ba zad
translated: As for “the inner and the outer,” and so forth,

original: par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o ;
translated: the inner, the grasping at “I” is exhausted, and so the outer, the grasping at “mine” is exhausted. Thus the appropriation characterized by the aggregates and so forth is arrested, and with the exhaustion of appropriation, the birth characterized by existence is exhausted.🔽Thus it is.

original: / de skad du yang rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: / de skad du yang rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: In the Precious Garland too it is said:

original: ngar 'dzin las ni phung po 'byung //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin las ni phung po 'byung //
translated: From the grasping at “I” the aggregates arise.

original: don du ngar 'dzin de mi bden //🔽gang gi sa bon mi bden pa //
analyzed: don du ngar 'dzin de mi bden // gang gi sa bon mi bden pa //
translated: In reality, this grasping at “I” is not true.🔽How can the result be true

original: de yi 'bras bu ci phyir bden //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu ci phyir bden //
translated: when its seed is not true?

original: de ltar phung po brdzun mthong na //
analyzed: de ltar phung po brdzun mthong na //
translated: Thus, if one sees the aggregates as false,

original: ngar 'dzin rab tu spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin rab tu spong bar 'gyur //
translated: one will completely abandon the apprehension of “I.”

original: ngar 'dzin rab tu spangs pas na //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin rab tu spangs pas na //
translated: And by completely abandoning the apprehension of “I,”

original: yang na phung po srid ma yin //
analyzed: yang na phung po srid ma yin //
translated: the aggregates will not exist.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bdag ma dmigs na mig la sogs pa yang mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni yang /
analyzed: bdag ma dmigs na mig la sogs pa yang mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni yang /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if the self is not perceived, the eyes and so on are also not perceived, the opponent’s position is set forth:

original: ci ltar zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “How is that?”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says, “It is just as, without an agent, there is no action.”

original: ci ltar byed pa po med na las med pa de bzhin du bdag med na bdag gi ba yod pa ma yin la des na bdag dang bdag gi ba stong par lta zhing rnal 'byor pa rnam par lta zhing grol ba thob par 'gyur ba yin no zhes🔽pa'o // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar byed pa po med na las med pa de bzhin du bdag med na bdag gi ba yod pa ma yin la des na bdag dang bdag gi ba stong par lta zhing rnal 'byor pa rnam par lta zhing grol ba thob par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as without an agent there is no action, so without a self there is no “mine.” Therefore, seeing the emptiness of the self and “mine,” the yogi sees and attains liberation.🔽In order to explain that, he says, “How is that?”

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni phung po rnams par 'dzin pa las 'byung ba yin pas ngar 'dzin med na phung po mi srid pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni phung po rnams par 'dzin pa las 'byung ba yin pas ngar 'dzin med na phung po mi srid pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that since it arises from the apprehension of the aggregates, if there is no apprehension of an “I,” the aggregates are impossible.

original: 'khor ba ma gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba brgyud pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khor ba mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba ma gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba brgyud pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khor ba mi dmigs pas so //
translated: “ Not seeing saṃsāra” means not observing saṃsāra, which is characterized by a succession of births.

original: ci ltar rnam par grol ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam par grol ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that kind of liberation,

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “form,” etc.

original: der rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: der rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: “ Realizing that” means realizing form, etc.

original: len pa de dbang bar zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med par ro //
analyzed: len pa de dbang bar zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med par ro //
translated: “ Giving up that appropriation” means giving it up without remainder.

original: snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / chos dang / dmigs pa med pa'i snying @273b rje rnam pa gsum gyi gzhan gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / chos dang / dmigs pa med pa'i snying @273b rje rnam pa gsum gyi gzhan gyi dbang gis so //
translated: “ Under the influence of compassion” means under the influence of the three kinds of compassion: compassion for sentient beings, compassion for the Dharma, and non-apprehending compassion.

original: byang chub kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni byang chub la mchis kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni byang chub la mchis kyi bar du'o //
translated: “ Until enlightenment” means until the attainment of enlightenment.

original: da ni ji ltar shing rta dang bdag btags yod du bstan pa de bzhin du gzhan yang btags yod du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar shing rta dang bdag btags yod du bstan pa de bzhin du gzhan yang btags yod du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that, just as a chariot and the self are imputedly existent, so too are other things imputedly existent,

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, “Just as a chariot is described in dependence upon its parts,” and so on.

original: dngos po gzhan rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Other things” refers to such things as pots.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'dir bum pa la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa dang tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin grang na /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'dir bum pa la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa dang tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin grang na /
translated: In this context, are such things as pots different from form and so on, or are they not different?

original: tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not different,

original: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad du dmigs par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad du dmigs par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that they would be perceived as separate from form and so on.

original: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not not different,

original: bum pa la sogs pa gcig la yang gzugs la sogs pa du ma yod pas bum pa du mar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gcig la yang gzugs la sogs pa du ma yod pas bum pa du mar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because in a single pot, for example, there are many forms and so on, and it would follow, absurdly, that the pot would be many.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs med pas gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs med pas gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs mi rigs te /
translated: Since there is no position of difference or non-difference, it is not reasonable to say that the pot is endowed with form, etc.

original: phyogs de la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas khyab pas so //
analyzed: phyogs de la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas khyab pas so //
translated: Because that position is pervaded by difference and non-difference.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i phyogs gnyis kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i phyogs gnyis kyang mi rigs te /
translated: Since there is neither difference nor non-difference, the two positions of support and supported are also unreasonable.

original: rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dag la tha dad pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dag la tha dad pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the positions of support and supported are pervaded by difference.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs bum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs bum pa ma yin te /
translated: The collection of form, etc. is not the pot,

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang bum pa nyid du thal bas so //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang bum pa nyid du thal bas so //
translated: because it follows that the form, etc. existing in the lump of clay would be the pot itself.

original: dbyibs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not shape,

original: cha shas las tha dad pa'i cha shas can ma dmigs pa dang / yan lag can med pas yan lag med pa'i phyir dbyibs kyang med pas so //
analyzed: cha shas las tha dad pa'i cha shas can ma dmigs pa dang / yan lag can med pas yan lag med pa'i phyir dbyibs kyang med pas so //
translated: because shape does not exist since a whole that is different from its parts is not observed, and since there are no parts without a whole.

original: de bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Cloth, etc. should be understood in the same way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de rnams shing rta'i rnam par dpyad pa rnam bdun yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de rnams shing rta'i rnam par dpyad pa rnam bdun yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: those do not exist in the seven ways when analyzed like a chariot.

original: de las gzhan du gyur pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur pa /
translated: But they exist in another way,

original: 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
translated: in terms of what is renowned in the world.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa gnyis 'dir sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa gnyis 'dir sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'o ;
translated: The two lines of the latter verse should be applied here.

original: / de las gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa las gzhan du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: / de las gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa las gzhan du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ste /
translated: “In another way” means in a way that is different from a pot, etc. It is the reason for the imputation of form, etc.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, pots, etc. exist in terms of what is renowned in the world.

original: yang bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to elaborate further,🔽it is said,

original: gang la zhes bya ba @274a * //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba @274a * //
translated: “That which . . .”

original: la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: de lta bu'i rigs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rigs can cha shas can la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rigs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rigs can cha shas can la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The phrase such a type of logicians refers to those who have parts, such as pots and cloth, and who have a nature that depends on others.

original: de bzhin de rnams rtogs bya ste //
analyzed: de bzhin de rnams rtogs bya ste //
translated: One should understand them in the same way.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: One should supply the words in the same way.

original: de la de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i 'jig rten grags pas so //
analyzed: de la de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i 'jig rten grags pas so //
translated: Here, the phrase in the same way means that one should understand them in the same way that one understands the world, which is delightful when not investigated.

original: de rnams rtogs bya ste zhes bya ba ni yan lag can la sogs pa rnams khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams rtogs bya ste zhes bya ba ni yan lag can la sogs pa rnams khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase one should understand them means that one should comprehend wholes and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rigs can gyi dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rigs can gyi dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the things that have such a type?

original: gang dag sgo nas skyes 'dis bsnyad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag sgo nas skyes 'dis bsnyad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The root text states, Those things by which this person is designated.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa gang dag gi sgo nas skyes bu 'dis tha snyad byed pa de rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa gang dag gi sgo nas skyes bu 'dis tha snyad byed pa de rnams so //
translated: Those things by which this person is designated are wholes, parts, and so on.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ma brtags par grags pa kho nar ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ma brtags par grags pa kho nar ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the phrase in the same way is that one should understand them in the same way that one understands the world, which is delightful when not investigated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par grags pa kho nar khas len pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par grags pa kho nar khas len pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: Why? means “Why do you accept it only through unexamined reputation?”

original: de la lung gi sgo nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lung gi sgo nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer through scripture,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “because” and so on.

original: thub pa'i dbang po ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten pa dang lhan cig tu rtsod pa mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten pa dang lhan cig tu rtsod pa mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: The Lord of Sages, the Buddha Bhagavat, does not debate with worldly people.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jig rten grags pa'i don zhal gyis bzhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jig rten grags pa'i don zhal gyis bzhes pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat accepts the meaning that is renowned in the world.

original: rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad chad par 'gyur la des na chos ston pa la sogs pa yang mi rigs pas bcings pa dang grol ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad chad par 'gyur la des na chos ston pa la sogs pa yang mi rigs pas bcings pa dang grol ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: If one analyzes, worldly conventions would be severed. Therefore, it would be illogical to teach the dharma and so on. Therefore, the presentation of bondage and liberation and so on would not exist.

original: de la lung gi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lung gi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the source of that scripture,

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “world” and so on.

original: 'jig rten nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi zhes bya ba ni kho bo dang 'gal ba 'jig rten khas len pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi zhes bya ba ni kho bo dang 'gal ba 'jig rten khas len pas so //
translated: The statement the world disputes with me is because the world accepts what is contrary to me.

original: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod de zhes bya ba ni des khas blangs pa ngas kyang khas len pas so //
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod de zhes bya ba ni des khas blangs pa ngas kyang khas len pas so //
translated: The statement I do not dispute with the world is because I accept what it accepts.

original: gang dag sgo nas skye 'dis bsnyad pa zhes gsungs pa la 'di 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: gang dag sgo nas skye 'dis bsnyad pa zhes gsungs pa la 'di 'dri ba ni /
translated: The statement by whatever door this world enters is asked in this way.

original: yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement the world and so on is spoken.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gang gi sgo nas 'jig rten tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gang gi sgo nas 'jig rten tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The statement that is that by which the world is conventionally designated.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach just that, the statement the parts and so on is spoken.

original: yan lag ni gyo du ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag ni gyo du ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the parts is the potsherds and so on.

original: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the qualities is form and so on.

original: 'dod chags ni mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: The statement attachment is the manifest attachment.

original: @274b mtshan nyid ni lto ldir ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @274b mtshan nyid ni lto ldir ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the characteristics is the round belly and so on.

original: bud shing ni bsreg par bya ba'i shing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bud shing ni bsreg par bya ba'i shing la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the fuel is the wood and so on that is to be burned.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gro ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gro ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes going and so on.

original: yan lag can gyi gyo du ma la sogs pas brtsams pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi gyo du ma la sogs pas brtsams pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A pot, etc., is that which is produced by many parts, etc.

original: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A pot, etc., is that which possesses qualities such as form.

original: chags can ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: chags can ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: A passionate person is a person who possesses desire.

original: mtshan gzhi ni mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi ni mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: A basis of characteristics is an entity that is characterized by means of a definition.

original: me ni sreg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me ni sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: Fire is that which burns.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gro ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gro ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes going and so on.

original: des na skyes bu rnams gang gi sgo nas tha snyad byed pa de bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na skyes bu rnams gang gi sgo nas tha snyad byed pa de bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that people use conventions in terms of that.

original: yan lag la sogs pa'i sgo nas tha snyad byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag la sogs pa'i sgo nas tha snyad byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said that they use conventions in terms of parts and so on.

original: de rnams shing rta'i rnam dpyad byas pas rnam bdun yod min zhing zhes bya ba ni de ltar shing rta tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas mi rigs pa de bzhin du yan lag dang yan lag can la
analyzed: de rnams shing rta'i rnam dpyad byas pas rnam bdun yod min zhing zhes bya ba ni de ltar shing rta tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas mi rigs pa de bzhin du yan lag dang yan lag can la
translated: The line “The sevenfold analysis shows that it does not exist” means that just as a chariot is not tenable in terms of the seven ways, such as being different from or the same as its parts, in the same way, the parts and the whole are not tenable in terms of the seven ways, such as being different from or the same as each other.

original: sogs pa yang rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa yang rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The line “The sevenfold analysis shows that it does not exist” means that just as the chariot is illogical in terms of the seven ways of being—different from, the same as, and so on—in the same way, the parts and the whole do not exist in terms of the seven ways of being.

original: 'di ltar gal te cha shas las cha shas can tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe tha dad du snang bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te cha shas las cha shas can tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe tha dad du snang bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: The seven ways of being are as follows. If the part-possessor were different from the parts, then it would follow that it would appear as different.

original: gal te tha mi dad na de'i tshe yan lag kho na yin pas yan lag can med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / yan lag can med pas yan lag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad na de'i tshe yan lag kho na yin pas yan lag can med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / yan lag can med pas yan lag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not different, then it would follow that there would be no part-possessor because it would be the parts themselves. And it would follow that there would be no parts because there would be no part-possessor.

original: yan lag ni yan lag can la ltos pas so //
analyzed: yan lag ni yan lag can la ltos pas so //
translated: This is because the parts depend on the part-possessor.

original: gang gi phyir yan lag dang yan lag can dag la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs mi rigs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag dang yan lag can dag la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs mi rigs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the positions of difference and nondifference are illogical for the parts and the part-possessor,

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs dang rten dang brten pa'i phyogs kyang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs dang rten dang brten pa'i phyogs kyang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: The position of the possessor of parts and the position of the part-possessor are also illogical.

original: yan lag tshogs pa'i phyogs kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: yan lag tshogs pa'i phyogs kyang mi rigs te /
translated: The position of the collection of parts is also illogical,

original: tshogs pa dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / yan lag can med pas yan lag med pa'i phyir gang dag gis tshogs par mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / yan lag can med pas yan lag med pa'i phyir gang dag gis tshogs par mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
