translated: because the collection is a non-entity, and because the parts do not exist without a part-possessor, by whom the collection would be made.🔽Shape is also illogical, because the parts do not exist at all.

original: dbyibs kyang mi rigs te yan lag rnams med pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyibs kyang mi rigs te yan lag rnams med pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said as before.

original: de bzhin du yon tan can bum pa las sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams tha dad pa yin na tha dad du snang bar thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan can bum pa las sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams tha dad pa yin na tha dad du snang bar thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if the qualities such as blueness of the pot, which is the possessor of qualities, are different, it follows that they would appear as different.

original: bum pa sngo bsangs ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te tha mi dad na ni rdzas kho na yod par 'gyur gyi yon tan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa sngo bsangs ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro // gal te tha mi dad na ni rdzas kho na yod par 'gyur gyi yon tan ni ma yin te /
translated: But it follows that the pot would not be blue.🔽If they are not different, only the substance would exist, not the qualities,

original: yon tan rdzas las tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: yon tan rdzas las tha mi dad pas so //
translated: because the qualities are not different from the substance.

original: @275a * // tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs bkag pas de dang ldan pa dang rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dag mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: @275a * // tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs bkag pas de dang ldan pa dang rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dag mi srid pa'o //
translated: Since the positions of difference and non-difference are refuted, the positions of possession and the possessed, and the positions of the support and the supported are impossible.

original: tshogs pa dang dbyibs kyi phyogs kyang mi srid pas brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang dbyibs kyi phyogs kyang mi srid pas brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since the positions of the collection and shape are also impossible, they are not mentioned.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags can dag gal te tha dad na skyes bu chags pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags can dag gal te tha dad na skyes bu chags pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, if attachment and one who is attached are different, then a man would not possess attachment.

original: skyes bu 'dod chags las tha dad pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod chags las tha dad pas so //
translated: Because a man is different from attachment.

original: gal te tha mi dad na ni 'dod chags med par thal bar 'gyur te 'dod chags skyes bu las tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad na ni 'dod chags med par thal bar 'gyur te 'dod chags skyes bu las tha mi dad pas so //
translated: If they are not different, then it follows that there would be no attachment, because attachment is not different from a man.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs bkag pas phyogs gzhan yang bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs bkag pas phyogs gzhan yang bkag pa yin no //
translated: Since the positions of difference and non-difference are refuted, the other positions are also refuted.

original: tshogs pa dang dbyibs dag ni srid pas ma brjod do //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang dbyibs dag ni srid pas ma brjod do //
translated: Since the collection and shape are possible, they are not mentioned.

original: de bzhin du gal te mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las tha dad na mtshan gzhi med par yang mtshan nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las tha dad na mtshan gzhi med par yang mtshan nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if the characteristic is different from the basis of the characteristic, it follows that the characteristic would exist without a basis of the characteristic.

original: gal te tha mi dad na ni mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad na ni mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not different, it follows that the characteristic and the basis of the characteristic do not exist.

original: ldan pa'i phyogs dang rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dag ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: ldan pa'i phyogs dang rten dang brten pa'i phyogs dag ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: The position of possession and the position of the support and the supported are as before.

original: phyogs gzhan mi srid pas ma brjod do //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan mi srid pas ma brjod do //
translated: Since another position is not possible, it is not mentioned.

original: de bzhin du me bud shing las tha dad na ni bud shing las kyang me yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du me bud shing las tha dad na ni bud shing las kyang me yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if fire is different from fuel, fire would exist without fuel.

original: gal te tha mi dad na ni byed pa po dang las dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad na ni byed pa po dang las dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not different, it follows that the agent and the object are the same.

original: phyogs gzhan dgag pa ni sngar bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan dgag pa ni sngar bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of another position should be understood as before.

original: des na yan lag la sogs pa rnam pa bdun gyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yan lag la sogs pa rnam pa bdun gyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in the seven ways, such as in terms of the parts.

original: gal te yan lag la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin na ci ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin na ci ltar grub ce na /
translated: If the parts and so on do not exist, how is it established?

original: de las gzhan du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de las gzhan du 'gyur ba /
translated: Otherwise,

original: 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
translated: they exist in terms of what is renowned in the world.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de las gzhan du gyur pa ni yan lag la sogs pa la ltos nas yan lag can la sogs pa grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur pa ni yan lag la sogs pa la ltos nas yan lag can la sogs pa grub pa yin la /
translated: Otherwise, in dependence on the parts and so on, the whole and so forth are established.

original: yan lag can la sogs pa grub pa las yan lag la sogs pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can la sogs pa grub pa las yan lag la sogs pa grub pa yin te /
translated: And in dependence on the establishment of the whole and so on, the parts and so on are established.

original: de yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i tha snyad kyis yin pas 'di la dpyad par mi gzhug ste /
analyzed: de yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i tha snyad kyis yin pas 'di la dpyad par mi gzhug ste /
translated: Moreover, since this is in terms of conventions that are delightful if not analyzed, one should not engage in analysis here.

original: de la zhugs nas 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nyams par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de la zhugs nas 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nyams par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If one does so, then the conventions of the world will be undermined.

original: des na sngar ci ltar tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: des na sngar ci ltar tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: If one asks, “How were conventions previously posited?”

original: gang smras pa de la lan ni /
analyzed: gang smras pa de la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is

original: 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
translated: they exist in terms of what is renowned in the world.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, it is said:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa @275b gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa @275b gsungs te /
translated: Just as a chariot is imputed in dependence on its parts🔽and a person is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: gyo mo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni rdul gnyis la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gyo mo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni rdul gnyis la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “such things as potsherds” includes such things as two atoms and so on.

original: sngo bsangs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dmar ba nyid la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngo bsangs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dmar ba nyid la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “such things as blueness” includes such things as redness and so on.

original: mgrin pa ring ba nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni kha dog la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa ring ba nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni kha dog la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “such things as long neck” includes such things as color and so on.

original: de bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni der yang snam bu ni yan lag can yin la snal ma ni yan lag nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni der yang snam bu ni yan lag can yin la snal ma ni yan lag nyid do //
translated: The same should be applied to cloth and so on. There, cloth is the whole, and the threads are the parts.

original: snam bu ni yon tan can yin la dkar ba nyid la sogs pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: snam bu ni yon tan can yin la dkar ba nyid la sogs pa ni yon tan no //
translated: Cloth is the quality possessor, and whiteness and so on are the qualities.

original: snam bu ni mtshan gzhi yin la ;
analyzed: snam bu ni mtshan gzhi yin la ;
translated: Cloth is the basis of characteristics,

original: chu ring ba dang zhing che ba nyid la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chu ring ba dang zhing che ba nyid la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: and long, short, and so on are the characteristics.

original: snam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni khang khyim la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni khang khyim la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “cloth, etc.” are to be understood as including houses, etc.

original: lhag par zhen pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: “Excessive attachment” means strong attachment.

original: 'dod chags kyi rten na zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rten na zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: “The basis of desire” refers to the person.

original: ji ltar de rnams grub pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar de rnams grub pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how these are established, he says:

original: de la yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “In this regard, the parts, etc.”

original: shing rta'i dpe dang mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar shing rta la ltos nas shing rta'i yan lag tu 'dogs pa dang / shing rta'i yan lag la ltos nas shing rta yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: shing rta'i dpe dang mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar shing rta la ltos nas shing rta'i yan lag tu 'dogs pa dang / shing rta'i yan lag la ltos nas shing rta yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya'o ;
translated: “Like the example of the chariot” means that just as the parts of a chariot are designated as such in dependence on the chariot, and the chariot is in dependence on its parts, so it is here as well.

original: / bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yon tan dang yon tan can la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: / bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yon tan dang yon tan can la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” is to be understood as including qualities and the possessor of qualities, etc.

original: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa yin na zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa yin na zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that causes and effects are also mutually dependent, he says:

original: yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The root text says, “The so-called parts,” and so on.

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te rgyus de byed pas bskyed par bya ste 'bras bu skyed par byed na de ltar na ste bskyed par bya ba skyed par byed pa de nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te rgyus de byed pas bskyed par bya ste 'bras bu skyed par byed na de ltar na ste bskyed par bya ba skyed par byed pa de nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The passage beginning “If the cause produces the effect” means that if the cause produces the effect that is to be produced, then the producer and the produced would be the same.

original: des na 'bras bu skyed pa de rgyur 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu skyed pa de rgyur 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Therefore, the reason for positing the cause is the production of the effect.

original: de ltar 'bras bu rgyu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du bstan nas 'bras bu mi skyed na rgyu nyid du mi rigs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gal te 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu rgyu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du bstan nas 'bras bu mi skyed na rgyu nyid du mi rigs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gal te 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus explained the reason for positing the cause as the effect, the root text says that if the effect is not produced, it is not tenable for it to be the cause.

original: gal te rgyus 'bras bu mi skyed na ni 'bras bu de med pas rgyu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras bu mi skyed na ni 'bras bu de med pas rgyu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: The passage beginning “If the cause does not produce the effect” means that if the cause does not produce the effect, then because the effect would not exist, the cause would be causeless.

original: rgyu de rgyur 'jog pa rgyu mtshan dang mi ldan par 'gyur la des na thams cad du rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de rgyur 'jog pa rgyu mtshan dang mi ldan par 'gyur la des na thams cad du rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause would be posited as a cause without a reason. Therefore, it follows that everything would be a cause.

original: 'dis ni rgyu rgyu nyid du 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan @276a * //🔽ni 'bras bu skyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu rgyu nyid du 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan @276a * // ni 'bras bu skyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the reason for positing a cause as a cause is that it generates an effect.

original: 'bras bur 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan yang rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bur 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan yang rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the reason for positing an effect is also a cause, he says,

original: 'bras bu yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The effect also is a cause.”

original: gang gi phyir rgyu yod par gyur na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'bras bu 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu yod par gyur na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'bras bu 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan yang rgyu yin no //
translated: Since when a cause exists, an effect arises, therefore the reason for positing an effect is also a cause.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, cause and effect are established in mutual dependence.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de las gzhan yod na zhes bya ba ni /🔽rgyu'am 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de las gzhan yod na zhes bya ba ni / rgyu'am 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Therefore, if the other exists,” and so on.🔽“The other” means a cause or an effect.

original: cig shos yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'am 'bras bu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: cig shos yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'am 'bras bu yod pa nyid do //
translated: “The existence of the one” means the existence of a cause or an effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gang yang rang bzhin gyis rgyu nyid du yod pa'am 'bras bu nyid du yod pa yin no zhes pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gang yang rang bzhin gyis rgyu nyid du yod pa'am 'bras bu nyid du yod pa yin no zhes pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of cause and effect does not exist, in the sense that anything exists essentially as a cause or exists essentially as an effect.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:🔽“If the effect were to exist in the assemblage,🔽then it would be apprehended in the assemblage.🔽But it is not apprehended.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in the assemblage.”

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: “The two” refers to cause and effect.

original: gang las gang zhig 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar rgyu yod par gyur na de'i tshe rgyu las 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang las gang zhig 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar rgyu yod par gyur na de'i tshe rgyu las 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: “From what would what arise?” means that if the cause existed earlier, then the effect would arise from the cause.

original: gal te 'bras bu sngar grub na 'bras bu las rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽gang zhig la sngar gang zhig 'gyur te smras zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu las rgyu sngar yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu sngar grub na 'bras bu las rgyur 'gyur ba'o // gang zhig la sngar gang zhig 'gyur te smras zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu las rgyu sngar yod pa yin nam /
translated: If the effect existed earlier, then the cause would arise from the effect.🔽“In what would what exist earlier?” means that the cause would exist earlier than the effect.

original: 'on te rgyu las 'bras bu sngar yod pa yin pa de smros shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu las 'bras bu sngar yod pa yin pa de smros shig ces pa'o //
translated: “Or in what would what exist earlier?” means that the effect would exist earlier than the cause.

original: gal te rgyu dang por yin la 'bras bu phyis yin na de'i tshe sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis rgyu la rgyu nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang por yin la 'bras bu phyis yin na de'i tshe sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis rgyu la rgyu nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cause is first and the effect is later, then, as previously explained, it follows that the cause would be without a cause.

original: gal te sngar 'bras bu yin la phyis rgyu yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu la rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sngar 'bras bu yin la phyis rgyu yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu la rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect is first and the cause is later, then it follows that the effect would be without a cause.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: ci rgyu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ci rgyu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Is it the cause or the effect that is first?”

original: de gnyis las zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'bras dag las so //
analyzed: de gnyis las zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'bras dag las so //
translated: “From those two” means from cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: “Therefore” and so on concludes.

original: gdags pa yang shing rta ltar rgyur byas nas yin par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni rgyu la brten nas 'bras bur gdags pa dang / 'bras bu la brten nas rgyur gdags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gdags pa yang shing rta ltar rgyur byas nas yin par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni rgyu la brten nas 'bras bur gdags pa dang / 'bras bu la brten nas rgyur gdags par rig par bya ste /
translated: “Designation should be understood as being like a chariot, in dependence on its cause” means that the effect should be understood as designated in dependence on the cause and the cause should be understood as designated in dependence on the effect.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma dpyad par grub pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma dpyad par grub pa yin pas so //
translated: This is because they are established in the conventions of the world without analysis.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang gi ngo bos yod par gyur na da skyon gzhan yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gzhan yang @276b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽phrad nas sam zhes bya ba ni chu bo dang rgya mtsho dag bzhin du gcig tu 'grel nas skyed par byed dam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang gi ngo bos yod par gyur na da skyon gzhan yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gzhan yang @276b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / phrad nas sam zhes bya ba ni chu bo dang rgya mtsho dag bzhin du gcig tu 'grel nas skyed par byed dam zhes pa'o //
translated: then the effect would have to be non-existent prior to its arising.

original: ma phrad par zhes bya ba ni so sor gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: ma phrad par zhes bya ba ni so sor gnas pa la'o //
translated: If it were to arise without meeting the cause,

original: de la phyogs dang po 'gegs pa ni /🔽de la re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po 'gegs pa ni / de la re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then there would be no point in the cause arising.🔽If the effect were to arise having met the cause, then the effect would have to be non-existent prior to its arising.

original: rgyu yis phrad nas 'bras bu skyed byed na //
analyzed: rgyu yis phrad nas 'bras bu skyed byed na //
translated: If it were to arise without meeting the cause, then there would be no point in the cause arising.🔽The first position is refuted by “In that case, the effect would have to be non-existent prior to its arising.”🔽The second position is refuted by “If it were to arise without meeting the cause, then there would be no point in the cause arising.”

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang po rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang po rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: The first position is restated by “If the cause gives rise to the effect having met it.”

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: The response is stated by “In that case, the effect would have to be non-existent prior to its arising.”

original: de dag nus pa gcig las zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag gcig yin pas skye bar bya ba'i nus pa'am mi skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yod pas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag tha dad du🔽mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag nus pa gcig las zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag gcig yin pas skye bar bya ba'i nus pa'am mi skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yod pas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag tha dad du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “They arise from a single potency” means that because that which is to be arisen and that which causes the arising are one, the potency to give rise to it or the potency not to give rise to it exists, so that that which is to be arisen and that which causes the arising are not different.

original: 'di'i don ni 'dir phrad pa ni mi rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'dir phrad pa ni mi rigs pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Contact is not tenable here.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag reg par 'gyur na de'i tshe de dag bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg pa yin nam phyogs gcig gis yin /
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag reg par 'gyur na de'i tshe de dag bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg pa yin nam phyogs gcig gis yin /
translated: Therefore, if the cause and effect come into contact, then do they come into contact through their whole essence or through a part?

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin na de'i tshe gnyis po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin na de'i tshe gnyis po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they come into contact through their whole essence, then it follows that the two would be one.

original: phan tshun bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma zhugs na bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg pa med pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma zhugs na bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg pa med pas so //
translated: If they do not mutually enter into contact through their whole essence, then they do not come into contact through their whole essence.

original: phyogs gcig gis reg par 'dod na ni de la gang phyogs gcig gis reg pa de'i nang du zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis reg par 'dod na ni de la gang phyogs gcig gis reg pa de'i nang du zhugs pa yin /
translated: If it is asserted that they come into contact through a part, then that which comes into contact through a part enters into it.

original: gang phyogs gcig gis ma reg na de la ma phrad pa'i phyogs la skyon brjod pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang phyogs gcig gis ma reg na de la ma phrad pa'i phyogs la skyon brjod pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not touch in one part, then the fault of not contacting would occur in the part that does not contact.

original: des na phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not generate an effect after contact.

original: ma phrad pa'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma phrad pa'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the fault of not contacting, it is said:

original: so sor na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If they are different,

original: gal te rgyu 'di 'bras bu las so sor gyur na de'i tshe rgyu ma yin pa rnams dang khyad par med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'di 'bras bu las so sor gyur na de'i tshe rgyu ma yin pa rnams dang khyad par med par 'gyur te /
translated: If this cause were different from the effect, then it would be no different from what is not a cause.

original: ci ltar du ba las rdza mkhan tha dad pa yin pas du ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar du ba las rdza mkhan tha dad pa yin pas du ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Just as a potter is different from smoke, he is not a cause of smoke.

original: de bzhin du me yang yin pas du ba la rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du me yang yin pas du ba la rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, since fire is also [different], smoke would be without a cause.

original: gal te rgyu ma yin pa dang khyad par med pa las skye bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma yin pa dang khyad par med pa las skye bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it were to arise without being different from what is not a cause,

original: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that everything would arise from everything.

original: 'on te phrad pa dang / ma phrad pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa'i phyogs kyis skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phrad pa dang / ma phrad pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa'i phyogs kyis skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is produced by a side other than the side of contact or non-contact,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: then in order to demonstrate that that also is not logical, he says,

original: gnyis po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “These two” and so on.

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pa dag go //
translated: “ These two” refers to contact and non-contact.

original: @277a * // rtog pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: @277a * // rtog pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: “ Another conception does not exist”

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka'am gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyogs gsum pa 'gal ba'i chos rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag la yod par 'gyur ba mi srid pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka'am gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyogs gsum pa 'gal ba'i chos rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag la yod par 'gyur ba mi srid pas so //
translated: means that a third side that has the nature of both or neither is impossible, because contradictory properties do not exist in the entities of cause and effect.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;🔽de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;🔽de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,🔽“If you think that it is produced by a side other than the side of contact or non-contact, then that also is not logical.”

original: gal te phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i phyogs la skyon brjod pa'i 'jigs pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa khas mi len na de la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i phyogs la skyon brjod pa'i 'jigs pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa khas mi len na de la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If you do not accept that a cause generates an effect because of the fear of the fault in the position of contact and non-contact, then the fault should be taught to you.

original: de'i phyir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, “why?” and so on is stated in order to teach the fault.

original: khyod kyi phyogs kyis rgyu'i 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pas 'bras bu med par khas len na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs kyis rgyu'i 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pas 'bras bu med par khas len na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: “If you accept that your position does not generate the effect of a cause” is the repetition of the opponent’s position.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs pa yin te /
translated: “When” and so on is the reply.

original: rgyu med can zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan med pas so //
analyzed: rgyu med can zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan med pas so //
translated: “Without a cause” means that the cause does not exist as a cause.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: rgyu rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The cause as a cause” and so on is stated.

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
translated: “The arising of an effect” is the generation of an effect.

original: da ni dbu ma'i phyogs la gzhan gyi dri ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma'i phyogs la gzhan gyi dri ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the opponent’s critique of the Madhyamaka position, it is said:

original: khyod kyis ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “How is it that you . . .”

original: gal te kho bo'i phyogs la phrad pa'am ma phrad pa'i sgo nas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed na khyod kyi phyogs kyis ji ltar skyed par byed ce na'o //
analyzed: gal te kho bo'i phyogs la phrad pa'am ma phrad pa'i sgo nas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed na khyod kyi phyogs kyis ji ltar skyed par byed ce na'o //
translated: If, in our system, a cause does not produce an effect by way of contact or without contact, how is it that you produce an effect?

original: de la dbu ma pas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dbu ma pas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The Madhyamaka response to this is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Because . . . ”

original: 'di dag gnyis char zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyis char zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin dag go //
translated: “These two” refers to the cause and effect.

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa med du zin kyang snang ba de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis med du zin kyang /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa med du zin kyang snang ba de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis med du zin kyang /
translated: “Like an illusion” means that just as an illusory elephant, for instance, does not exist, yet appears, likewise, the two, cause and effect, do not exist.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis snang ba yin la gang gi phyir gnyis char sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis yod par smra ba la skyon sngar brjod pa de kho na'i phyogs la ni yod par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis snang ba yin la gang gi phyir gnyis char sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis yod par smra ba la skyon sngar brjod pa de kho na'i phyogs la ni yod par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Because both are like illusions, therefore, only the position that advocates that cause and effect exist essentially is subject to the faults stated earlier.

original: / des na ma brtags par grags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / des na ma brtags par grags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, unexamined, commonly perceived cause and effect and so forth exist.

original: de 'grel pas bsten par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bsten par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this,

original: gang gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Candrakirti says,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: Those who say that own characteristic means substantial existence🔽and that the object of activity of a conceptual distinguisher is a generally characterized phenomenon🔽are refuted by this analysis.

original: rnam @277b par dpyad pa 'di 'gyur gyi //🔽zhes bya ba ni phrad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam @277b par dpyad pa 'di 'gyur gyi // zhes bya ba ni phrad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyad pa ste /
translated: This analysis is as follows:

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i yul ni rdzas su yod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i yul ni rdzas su yod pa yin pas so //
translated: The object of this analysis is a substantially existing object, because it is said that it is not tenable that a generally characterized phenomenon is the object of activity of a conceptual distinguisher.

original: log par kun du brtags pas zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa nas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa la goms pas kun nas bslangs pas so ;
analyzed: log par kun du brtags pas zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa nas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa la goms pas kun nas bslangs pas so ;
translated: “By false imagination” means that it is motivated by the habit of attachment to entities since beginningless time.

original: / de la bsam du med pa nyid de zhes bya ba'i phrad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa bsam du med pa'o //
analyzed: / de la bsam du med pa nyid de zhes bya ba'i phrad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa bsam du med pa'o //
translated: “Inconceivability” means the analysis of the terms “this” and so on.

original: thams cad 'grub po zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad 'grub po zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Everything is established” means cause and effect and so on.

original: yang dbu ma pa la gzhan dag gis skyon mtshungs pa nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: yang dbu ma pa la gzhan dag gis skyon mtshungs pa nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: Now, others show the Madhyamikas to be at fault:

original: 'dir kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, someone says,

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag sun 'byin pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag sun 'byin pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Here means in the context of refuting cause and effect.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Someone means someone who asserts that cause and effect exist substantially.

original: lan du zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'i lan du'o //
analyzed: lan du zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'i lan du'o //
translated: In response means in response to the refutation.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “as it is said” and so on.

original: khyod la yang zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la'o //
analyzed: khyod la yang zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la'o //
translated: “You” refers to the Mādhyamika.

original: brtag pa mtshungs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: brtag pa mtshungs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar zhe na /
translated: To show that the critique is equally applicable to you, Bhāviveka says, “How?”🔽The critique that you have presented

original: sun 'byin 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed dam /🔽'on te ma phrad par skyed par byed ces gang sun 'byin smras pa des rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sun dbyung bar bya ba phrad nas sun 'byin nam /🔽'on te ma phrad par yin /
analyzed: sun 'byin 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed dam / 'on te ma phrad par skyed par byed ces gang sun 'byin smras pa des rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sun dbyung bar bya ba phrad nas sun 'byin nam / 'on te ma phrad par yin /
translated: is similar to the critique of ours that you have presented.🔽Does the critique that you have presented refute the object of refutation through contact or without contact?🔽If you say that the critique refutes the object of refutation through contact, then the refutation and the object of refutation would be one thing, and by what and whom would one refute?

original: gal te phrad nas sun 'byin par byed na ni sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin par byed pa dag gcig tu gyur pas gang gis gang sun 'byin gal te ma phrad par sun 'byin na ni sun 'byin pa ma yin pa dang mtshungs pas sun 'byin
analyzed: gal te phrad nas sun 'byin par byed na ni sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin par byed pa dag gcig tu gyur pas gang gis gang sun 'byin gal te ma phrad par sun 'byin na ni sun 'byin pa ma yin pa dang mtshungs pas sun 'byin
translated: If you say that the critique refutes the object of refutation without contact, then it would be the same as not being a critique.

original: sun 'byin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad sun 'byin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sun 'byin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad sun 'byin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that it is not a refutation, and it follows that everything is a refutation.

original: nyes pa 'di ni khyod la'ang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar sun phyung ba de khyod la yang 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni khyod la'ang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar sun phyung ba de khyod la yang 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “This fault applies to you as well” means that the refutation of cause and effect applies to you as well.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sun dbyung bya sun 'byin pa'i nus pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sun dbyung bya sun 'byin pa'i nus pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed dam /
translated: If you say that the refutation🔽of the refutand is possible,🔽then the refutation of the refutand🔽is not possible.

original: 'on te ma phrad par skyed par byed ces bya ba'o //🔽khyod kyis sun 'byin pa nyid sun phyung ba yin pas zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung bar bya ba sun ni 'byin @278a * //
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad par skyed par byed ces bya ba'o // khyod kyis sun 'byin pa nyid sun phyung ba yin pas zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung bar bya ba sun ni 'byin @278a * //
translated: “The possibility of the refutation of the refutand” means that the refutation generates an effect either through contact or without contact.

original: par ma nus pas so //
analyzed: par ma nus pas so //
translated: “You have refuted refutation itself” means that since the refutand is not refuted, it is not possible to refute it.

original: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin par byed pa sun 'byin pa nus pa med pa nyid du bstan pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma khegs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin par byed pa sun 'byin pa nus pa med pa nyid du bstan pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma khegs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Implicitly” means that the refutation of the refutation is shown to be powerless, and so the fact of causality is not refuted, and so causality is established.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gang gi tshe phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang gi tshe phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed dam /
translated: When you say…

original: 'on te ma phrad par 'bras bu skyed par byed ces de skad smra zhing rang gi phyogs de sun dbyung bar bya ba dang / sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyogs de rnam par 'joms shing rlag par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad par 'bras bu skyed par byed ces de skad smra zhing rang gi phyogs de sun dbyung bar bya ba dang / sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyogs de rnam par 'joms shing rlag par byed de /
translated: When you say, “Does the cause produce an effect after the two have come into contact?” or “Does the cause produce an effect without the two having come into contact?” you are refuting your own position and destroying the position of your opponent.

original: de yang phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyod pa 'jug pas skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyod pa 'jug pas skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the error of the analysis of contact, etc., applies.

original: de tshe khyod kyis sun dbyung sun ni 'byin par nus ma yin //
analyzed: de tshe khyod kyis sun dbyung sun ni 'byin par nus ma yin //
translated: At that time, you will not be able to refute what is to be refuted.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang tshe rang gi phyogs la skyon mtshungs par 'gyur ba de sun 'byin la sun dbyung bar bya ba sun 'byin par byed pa'i nus pa med pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang tshe rang gi phyogs la skyon mtshungs par 'gyur ba de sun 'byin la sun dbyung bar bya ba sun 'byin par byed pa'i nus pa med pas /
translated: This is because when one’s own position is subject to the same fault, then the refutation lacks the ability to refute what is to be refuted.

original: de rgyu dang 'bras bu dang dngos po la sogs pa rnams sun 'byin par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de rgyu dang 'bras bu dang dngos po la sogs pa rnams sun 'byin par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Thus, one is unable to refute cause and effect, entities, and so on.

original: skyon gzhan yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate another fault, he says:🔽Moreover, your refutation🔽is not established,🔽and it is pointless.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, your refutation is pointless.

original: ltag chod kyis zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: ltag chod kyis zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'o //
translated: “ Refutation” means a fallacious refutation.

original: ji ltar sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a fallacious refutation?

original: lan ni rang gi tshig la'ang thal bar mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni rang gi tshig la'ang thal bar mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The answer is: “The consequence also applies to your words.”

original: phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyad pa dbu ma pa'i sun 'byin la yang 'jug pas so //
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyad pa dbu ma pa'i sun 'byin la yang 'jug pas so //
translated: The analysis of contact and so on also applies to the refutation of the Mādhyamika.

original: rigs pa med par dngos po mtha' dag la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rigs pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas dngos po mtha' dag la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa med par dngos po mtha' dag la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rigs pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas dngos po mtha' dag la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: “Denial of all things without reason” means that, in the manner to be explained, you deny all things by refuting cause and effect without reason.

original: de'i phyir / khyod ni skye bo dam pa bzhed mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyod ni skye bo dam pa bzhed mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “You are not accepted by holy beings,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rigs pa med par dngos po mtha' dag la skur pa 'debs par byed pa de'i phyir khyod ni skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bzhed par mi 'gyur ba de'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs pa med par dngos po mtha' dag la skur pa 'debs par byed pa de'i phyir khyod ni skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bzhed par mi 'gyur ba de'o //
translated: Because you deny all things without reason, therefore you are not accepted by holy beings.

original: sun ci phyin du rgol ba yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba tsam la zhugs pa'i rgol ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sun ci phyin du rgol ba yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba tsam la zhugs pa'i rgol ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “You are a mere fault-finder” means that you are a debater who is devoid of a position of your own and who engages in merely refuting the positions of others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: khyod la rang phyogs med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod la rang phyogs med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “You have no position of your own.”

original: dbu ma pas phyogs gang yang khas ma blangs pas so //
analyzed: dbu ma pas phyogs gang yang khas ma blangs pas so //
translated: because the Madhyamika does not accept any position.

original: de 'grel pas bstan @278b par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan @278b par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that regard, etc.

original: rang gi tshig las thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa nyid ni smras zin to zhes bya ba 'di sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig las thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa nyid ni smras zin to zhes bya ba 'di sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The equivalence of the reductio is stated in the words, “we have already stated . . .” The refutation is as follows: Does the refutation touch the refuted or not?

original: khab len gyis zhes bya ba ni lcags 'dren par byed pa'i rdo'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: khab len gyis zhes bya ba ni lcags 'dren par byed pa'i rdo'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Magnet” is a particular kind of stone that attracts iron.

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni yul thag nye ba na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni yul thag nye ba na gnas pa'o //
translated: “In the right place” means in a nearby place.

original: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thag rings na gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thag rings na gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not all” means not in a distant place.

original: 'bras bu rung ba kho na skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu rung ba kho na skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Only a suitable effect is produced” means

original: gang bya bar yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang bya bar yang rung ste /
translated: that which is suitable to be produced.

original: gang gi rgyud la skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yod pas so //
analyzed: gang gi rgyud la skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yod pas so //
translated: That is, that which has the potential to be produced in the continuum.

original: thams cad skyed par mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni byar mi rung ba ni skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad skyed par mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni byar mi rung ba ni skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: “It does not generate everything” means that what is not suitable to be generated is not generated.

original: sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the definition of a futile rejoinder,

original: rang gi phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “One’s own position is not undermined,” and so on.

original: de la dbu ma pas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dbu ma pas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: In response to that, the Mādhyamika says,

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Here one should say,” and so on.🔽One should definitely have a position, thinking, “By my assertion, does the refutation refute what is refuted without contact or does the refutation refute what is refuted through contact?”

original: gang gi 'dod pas sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba ma phrad par sun 'byin par byed dam phrad nas sun 'byin par byed ces bya ba nges par phyogs yod pa de'i 'dod pa la sun 'byin pa 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas sun 'byin nam ma
analyzed: gang gi 'dod pas sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba ma phrad par sun 'byin par byed dam phrad nas sun 'byin par byed ces bya ba nges par phyogs yod pa de'i 'dod pa la sun 'byin pa 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas sun 'byin nam ma
translated: Whatever is said, “Does the refutation refute what is refuted through contact or without contact?”

original: phrad par zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa de nyes par thal ba yin la /
analyzed: phrad par zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa de nyes par thal ba yin la /
translated: is a fault that ensues.

original: kho bos ni phyogs 'di khas ma blangs pas sngar bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kho bos ni phyogs 'di khas ma blangs pas sngar bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: But since I do not accept this position, the fault that ensues as explained earlier does not apply to me.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bar bya ba dag dngos por grub pa yin na de'i tshe phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyad ra 'jug pa yin gyi 'on kyang sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bar bya ba dag ma brtags na nyams dga'
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bar bya ba dag dngos por grub pa yin na de'i tshe phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyad ra 'jug pa yin gyi 'on kyang sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bar bya ba dag ma brtags na nyams dga'
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the refutation and the object of refutation were established as things, then an analysis of contact, etc. would be relevant. However, refutation and the object of refutation are delightful when not examined.

original: bar 'jig rten gyi grags pa tsam du 'dod pas ji ltar na phrad pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'jug par 'gyur te dngos po kho na phrad pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'jug pas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bar 'jig rten gyi grags pa tsam du 'dod pas ji ltar na phrad pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'jug par 'gyur te dngos po kho na phrad pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'jug pas so zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the refutation and that which is to be refuted were established as things, then an analysis of contact, etc. would be relevant. But since the refutation and that which is to be refuted are accepted as mere mundane conventions when not analyzed, how could an analysis of contact, etc. be relevant? For only things are relevant to an analysis of contact, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi tshig la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyis zhes gang brjod pa de yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi tshig la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyis zhes gang brjod pa de yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the statement “The same reductio would apply to your words” is not relevant.

original: nges par phyogs yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nges par phyogs yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “If you definitely have a position, etc.”

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: de la rang gi tshig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @279a * //
analyzed: de la rang gi tshig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @279a * //
translated: In response to that, he says, “In regard to one’s own words, etc.”

original: so ; / don de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: so ; / don de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source in the Perfection of Wisdom for that meaning,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said, etc.”

original: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: “What” is a question.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti” is a vocative.

original: skyes pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By the dharma of production” is

original: gang gis 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i dngos po des so //
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i dngos po des so //
translated: by the thing that causes the attainment of the fruit.

original: ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thob par bya ba thob par 'gyur ram zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thob par bya ba thob par 'gyur ram zhes pa'o //
translated: “Would the attainment of the non-produced be attained?” means: Would the attainment of the object to be attained, which has the characteristic of the fruit of stream-entry, etc., be attained, because of non-production?

original: 'on te ma skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa gnyis kyang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa gnyis kyang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because both that which is to be attained and that which attains it are non-arisen.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti said...

original: rab 'byor gyis sh'a ri'i bu la lan 'debs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis sh'a ri'i bu la lan 'debs so //
translated: This is Subhūti's reply to Śāriputra.

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The reply is:

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Venerable One... and so on.

original: thob pa thob par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: thob pa thob par mi 'dod do //
translated: Attainment is not desired.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag dang ; ma skyes pa dag la thob pa med pas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag dang ; ma skyes pa dag la thob pa med pas so zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because there is no attainment of the arisen and unarisen, and of the unarisen.

original: sh'a ri'i bus lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Śāriputra's reply is:

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Śāriputra said... and so on.

original: thob pa med cing zhes bya ba ni sbyar ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: thob pa med cing zhes bya ba ni sbyar ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: There is no attainment... is in the context of application.

original: mngon par rtogs pa med de zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa med de zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: There is no clear realization... is in the context of the actual practice.

original: de la rab 'byor gyis lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor gyis lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: There, Subhūti's reply is:

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa'i dngos po gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa'i dngos po gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Not by way of duality means not by way of the two things, the object to be attained and the agent of attainment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /
translated: the Lord said, “Venerable Śāriputra...” and so forth.

original: thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa dang rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa dang rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach attainment, realization, and expansion,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “Stream-enterer...” and so forth.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Stream-enterers and so forth have been explained previously.

original: don dam par ni thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa dag med pas /
analyzed: don dam par ni thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa dag med pas /
translated: Attainment and realization do not exist ultimately means that ultimately, since there is neither an object to be attained nor an agent of attainment,🔽there is no attainment and no realization.

original: so ; / gnyis su med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: so ; / gnyis su med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the consequence of nonduality.

original: zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa dag gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa dag gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: This is because there would be a twofold consequence: that which is to be attained and that which attains.

original: lung gi don skabs su bab pa la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung gi don skabs su bab pa la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to apply the meaning of the scripture to the present context,

original: de bzhin du sun dbyung bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sun dbyung bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Likewise, the object of refutation, etc.”

original: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par @279b bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par @279b bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that by way of an example,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Moreover, etc.”

original: gzas gzung la sogs rnams tshe zhes bya ba ni nyi ma sgra gcan gyis bzung ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gzas gzung la sogs rnams tshe zhes bya ba ni nyi ma sgra gcan gyis bzung ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “The time of the eclipse, etc.” is the occasion of the moon being seized by Rāhu.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ltas ngan pa'i dbang gis bu ga la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur gyi gnas skabs bsdu bar bya'o ;
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ltas ngan pa'i dbang gis bu ga la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur gyi gnas skabs bsdu bar bya'o ;
translated: The word “etc.” includes the occasion of the sun’s orb being affected by bad omens, such as the appearance of a hole, and so on.

original: / khyad par rnams zhes bya ba ni phyed gzung ba dang ril por gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / khyad par rnams zhes bya ba ni phyed gzung ba dang ril por gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The differences” are the apprehension of halves and wholes, and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan la yang zhes bya ba ni gzhong pa'i nang gi chu la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la yang zhes bya ba ni gzhong pa'i nang gi chu la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan la yang ngo //
translated: “Also in a reflection” means also in a reflection of water, etc. in a basin.

original: nyi ma dang ni gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa dang ma phrad par mi rigs mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhong pa'i nang gi yod pa'i chu dang phrad nas gzugs brnyan skyed pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang ni gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa dang ma phrad par mi rigs mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhong pa'i nang gi yod pa'i chu dang phrad nas gzugs brnyan skyed pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: “It is not tenable that the sun and its reflection are not in contact,” means that it is not tenable that a reflection is generated in the water in a basin through contact with the sun,

original: nam mkha' la yang yod pa'i nyi ma med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang yod pa'i nyi ma med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow that the sun in the sky would not exist.

original: ma phrad pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma phrad pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: “Nor is it not in contact,” means that it is not tenable that a reflection is generated in the water in a basin without contact with the sun,

original: gzhong pa kha bkab pa'i chu nang du gzugs brnyan mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med pas so ;
analyzed: gzhong pa kha bkab pa'i chu nang du gzugs brnyan mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med pas so ;
translated: because it would follow that a reflection would be seen in the water in a basin covered by a lid, and because there is not even the slightest thing called a reflection.

original: / de ltar rnam par dpyad na gzugs brnyan ma grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: / de ltar rnam par dpyad na gzugs brnyan ma grub par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that a reflection is not established when analyzed,

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' bar lo ka bar grags pas gzugs brnyan grub pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' bar lo ka bar grags pas gzugs brnyan grub pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that a reflection is established because it is renowned in the world as delightful when not analyzed, he says,

original: brten nas tha snyad tsam zhig 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: brten nas tha snyad tsam zhig 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: and arise merely conventionally in dependence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten nas gzugs brnyan gyi tha snyad tsam cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten nas gzugs brnyan gyi tha snyad tsam cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: A reflection arises merely conventionally in dependence on the orb of the sun or moon, etc.

original: des na lo ka phrad pa la sogs pa med par yang gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du sun 'byin par bya ba dang sun 'byin pa yang yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na lo ka phrad pa la sogs pa med par yang gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du sun 'byin par bya ba dang sun 'byin pa yang yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as a reflection arises even though there is no contact, etc., between the orb of the sun or moon and the water, etc., refutation and that which is to be refuted exist in the same way.

original: de ltar phrad pa dang ma phrad pa med du zin kyang sun 'byin pa 'thad pa nyid du bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar phrad pa dang ma phrad pa med du zin kyang sun 'byin pa 'thad pa nyid du bstan nas //
translated: Thus, even though contact and non-contact do not exist, refutation is tenable.

original: da ni rang bzhin med pa'i sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba sun 'byin par byed pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin med pa'i sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba sun 'byin par byed pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that a refutation devoid of intrinsic nature refutes that which is to be refuted,

original: mi bden pa nyid du 'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid du 'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Even though they are unreal, etc.”

original: ji ltar me long la sogs pa'i nang du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mi bden pa rang gi byad bzhin mdzas par rtogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ched du nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar me long la sogs pa'i nang du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mi bden pa rang gi byad bzhin mdzas par rtogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ched du nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ste /
translated: Just as an unreal reflection of a face in a mirror, etc. is capable of serving as the cause for realizing the beauty of one’s own face, so it is here as well.

original: sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin par byed pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin par byed pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: Even in the case of the refutation and the refutand,

original: 'thad pa dang bral ba las kyang bsgrub bya rtogs zhes @280a * //
analyzed: 'thad pa dang bral ba las kyang bsgrub bya rtogs zhes @280a * //
translated: one should understand that the probandum is realized even from what is devoid of a logical proof.

original: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan rang gi bzhin mdzes par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'i gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan rang gi bzhin mdzes par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'i gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o //
translated: “One should understand” means that just as the reflection of a face serves as the cause for realizing the beauty of one’s own face, so the reason of absence of intrinsic nature serves as the cause for realizing the probandum.

original: ji ltar rang gi gzugs brnyan rang gi byad bzhin mdzes par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi gzugs brnyan rang gi byad bzhin mdzes par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that just as a mirror is the cause for realizing the beauty of one's own face, so too is a logical reason, he says, Just so here, etc.

original: shes rab nyid gdong yin la de sbyang ba ste yongs su dag par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: shes rab nyid gdong yin la de sbyang ba ste yongs su dag par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: Wisdom itself is the face, and its purification is the cause for realizing it.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: ji ltar gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Just as a reflection, etc.

original: gzugs brnyan nye ba las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan nye ba las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the proximity of a reflection means

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor yod pa las so //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor yod pa las so //
translated: from the existence of the orb of the sun.

original: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don nges par byed pa na zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don nges par byed pa na zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par nges par byed pa'o //
translated: When one ascertains the object one wishes to understand means when one ascertains the special condition of the orb of the sun.

original: gnyis su thal bar yang mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bya dngos por thal bar mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gnyis su thal bar yang mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bya dngos por thal bar mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Since it does not follow that there are two, i.e., it does not follow that there is a real existent refutation and something to be refuted.

original: shes rab gdong yi pas zhes bya ba ni gtso bo yin pas so //
analyzed: shes rab gdong yi pas zhes bya ba ni gtso bo yin pas so //
translated: The face of wisdom is the chief.

original: nus pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim pas shes rab yongs su dag par rtogs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim pas shes rab yongs su dag par rtogs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The power is seen, i.e., the probandum is established by the reason. The realization of the purity of wisdom is by the process of reflection and meditation.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the conclusion, he says

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: because, etc.

original: btags par yod pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni de rnams ma btags na nyams dga' ba tsam du khas blangs pas dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir phrad nas sam ma phrad par zhes bya ba'i dpyad pa mi 'jug pas so //
analyzed: btags par yod pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni de rnams ma btags na nyams dga' ba tsam du khas blangs pas dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir phrad nas sam ma phrad par zhes bya ba'i dpyad pa mi 'jug pas so //
translated: As for the nominally existent, i.e., if they are not nominally existent, they are accepted as mere pleasantries, and so are not established as real things, and so the analysis of whether they come into contact or do not come into contact does not apply.

original: gnyis su smra ba zhes bya ba ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i dngos po gnyis yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su smra ba zhes bya ba ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i dngos po gnyis yod par smra ba'o //
translated: The two-fold assertion is the assertion that the two things, contact and non-contact, exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni btags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni btags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason means because of the nominal existence.

original: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya ba ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i dngos po gnyis la brten nas so //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya ba ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i dngos po gnyis la brten nas so //
translated: Based on the two means based on the two things, contact and non-contact.

original: sun 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par 'byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par 'byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The refutation is the refutation that says, Does this refutation refute by contacting what is to be refuted or by not contacting it?

original: lan zhes bya ba ni gang ma phrad par mtshungs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan zhes bya ba ni gang ma phrad par mtshungs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is the answer that says, Because of the similarity of non-contact, etc.

original: glags mi rnyed do zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung bar @280b bya ba dang sun 'byin par byed pa dag dngos po nyid du ma grub pa dang / khab len la yang rtsod pa mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: glags mi rnyed do zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung bar @280b bya ba dang sun 'byin par byed pa dag dngos po nyid du ma grub pa dang / khab len la yang rtsod pa mtshungs pas so //
translated: It is said, no opportunity is found, because the refutation and the one who refutes are not established as things, and because the same objection applies to the magnet.

original: de yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained later.

original: dbu ma pa'i phyogs la yang gzhan gyis glags mi rnyed pa la 'phags pa lta'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i phyogs la yang gzhan gyis glags mi rnyed pa la 'phags pa lta'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the noble Nagarjuna's position, which is not open to refutation by others, he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said...

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //
translated: As it is said refers to the Catuhfi śataka.

original: yod dang med dang zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'dzin yod na de dgag pa'i phyir dus de nyid du'am dus gzhan nyid du sun 'byin pa srid pa yin la /
analyzed: yod dang med dang zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'dzin yod na de dgag pa'i phyir dus de nyid du'am dus gzhan nyid du sun 'byin pa srid pa yin la /
translated: Existence, nonexistence, and both means that if one were to take a position, then refutation would be possible either at that time or at another time.

original: gang la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyis ka'i phyogs spangs pas phyogs 'dzin mi srid pa de de la yun ring po lon yang klan ka brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyis ka'i phyogs spangs pas phyogs 'dzin mi srid pa de de la yun ring po lon yang klan ka brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But when one has abandoned the positions of existence, nonexistence, and both, it is impossible to take a position, and so it is impossible to accuse one of error, even after a long time.

original: nam mkha' de gzugs can nam da ltar mi srid pa de bzhin du nam yang gzugs can nyid du rtogs par mi nus la /
analyzed: nam mkha' de gzugs can nam da ltar mi srid pa de bzhin du nam yang gzugs can nyid du rtogs par mi nus la /
translated: Just as space is not possible as a physical object, it is not possible to conceive of it as a physical object.
