original: de bzhin du rgol ba po rnams kyis kyang de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyogs gsum char med pas stong pa nyid smra ba la sun 'byin pa ni yun ring po lon yang brjod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgol ba po rnams kyis kyang de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyogs gsum char med pas stong pa nyid smra ba la sun 'byin pa ni yun ring po lon yang brjod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the disputants, since they do not have any of the three positions that could be the basis of their refutation, are unable to refute the proponent of emptiness, even though they try for a long time.

original: nam mkha'i ri mo la lcags bstan pa'i 'tshe ba bzhin du stong pa nyid smra ba la klan ka tshol ba yang de dang mtshungs par mkhas pas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ri mo la lcags bstan pa'i 'tshe ba bzhin du stong pa nyid smra ba la klan ka tshol ba yang de dang mtshungs par mkhas pas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The wise should understand that the search for error in the proponent of emptiness is like the search for the color of a sky-flower.

original: ji ltar na nam mkha' la mun nag gi tshogs nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis nye bar bsal zhing nyams pas nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs gsal ba la yun ring po lon yang dri ma can du byed mi nus la /
analyzed: ji ltar na nam mkha' la mun nag gi tshogs nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis nye bar bsal zhing nyams pas nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs gsal ba la yun ring po lon yang dri ma can du byed mi nus la /
translated: Just as the mass of darkness in the sky is dispelled and destroyed by the sun’s rays, and the mass of the sun’s rays is not made dark by the mass of darkness, even though it lasts a long time,

original: de bzhin du zab pa dang rgya che ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgom pas khong du chud pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer la rgol ba'i 'dod pa'i mun pa ma lus par bsal zin pas kyang zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zab pa dang rgya che ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgom pas khong du chud pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer la rgol ba'i 'dod pa'i mun pa ma lus par bsal zin pas kyang zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that the sun of realization of the profound and vast dependent origination, which is inconceivable, has already dispelled all the darkness of the desire of the opponent.

original: don de la dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de la dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the root text of the Middle Way,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the line “Likewise, when one is questioned” and so on is taught.

original: brtsad byas tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: brtsad byas tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i tshe'o //
translated: “ When one is questioned” means when one is refuting the position of the other.

original: gzugs rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba de ltar stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa la /
analyzed: gzugs rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba de ltar stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa la /
translated: “ Form is essenceless” is established as essencelessness through emptiness.

original: gal te gzhan dag na re tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa yin pas de bzhin du gzugs kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed pa'i lan thams cad ni lan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag na re tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa yin pas de bzhin du gzugs kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed pa'i lan thams cad ni lan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If others reply, “Since feeling and so on exist, form does not exist,” all of these replies will not be replies.

original: gang gi phyir tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyang @281a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyang @281a * //
translated: Because the existence of feeling, etc.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gzugs dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gzugs dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as similar to the probandum, form.

original: ji ltar gzugs rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dpyad na yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dpyad na yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang /
translated: Just as form, when analyzed as to whether it is the same as or different from its cause, does not exist, so also feeling, which has contact as its condition, and perception, which arises simultaneously with consciousness, and formations, which have ignorance as their condition,

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rang rang gi rgyu reg pa la sogs pa la dpyad na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du med pas thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rang rang gi rgyu reg pa la sogs pa la dpyad na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du med pas thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and consciousness, which has formations as its condition, when analyzed in terms of their own causes, contact, etc., do not exist as the same or different. Therefore, all are similar to the probandum.

original: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa rnams bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang 'bras bu rgyu dang yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs dang mtshungs pas gzhan
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa rnams bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang 'bras bu rgyu dang yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs dang mtshungs pas gzhan
translated: Just as feeling and so on are similar to the probandum, so too all things such as characteristics and the basis of characteristics, effects and causes, parts and wholes and so on are similar to the probandum form.

original: gyis lan 'debs pa ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: gyis lan 'debs pa ji ltar rigs te /
translated: How can the opponent respond?

original: 'dis smras pa thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur bas lan rnams la dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa nyid du brjod par gyis shig ces slob dpon gyis 'doms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis smras pa thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur bas lan rnams la dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa nyid du brjod par gyis shig ces slob dpon gyis 'doms par byed pa'o //
translated: Since all of his statements will be similar to the probandum, the master advises, “The Mādhyamika should say that all of the opponent’s responses are similar to the probandum.”

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni dbu ma pa la skyon med pa nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni dbu ma pa la skyon med pa nyid du bstan la /
translated: In this context, the first verse shows that the Mādhyamika is without fault.

original: gnyis pas lan 'debs mi nus pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas lan 'debs mi nus pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: The second verse shows that he is unable to respond.

original: sun 'byin pa 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig lan 'debs pa yin la /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig lan 'debs pa yin la /
translated: In response to this, some respond, “Is this refutation produced through contact with what is refuted or without contact?”🔽This is also not logical.

original: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,🔽“This is not a response.”

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la dngos por smra bas lan ma thebs par bstan pas so//
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la dngos por smra bas lan ma thebs par bstan pas so//
translated: “This” refers to the response of the essentialist to the Madhyamika.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yang rnam par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa'i rgyu lan nyid du smra ba de ni lan ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yang rnam par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa'i rgyu lan nyid du smra ba de ni lan ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: “The cause of production should be understood” means that the cause of production that is asserted by the other party is not a response.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,🔽“In this regard, some say…”

original: de la kha cig ces bya ba ni dbu ma rang rgyud pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig ces bya ba ni dbu ma rang rgyud pa'o //
translated: “Some” refers to the Svatantrika Madhyamikas.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'dir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu skabs su bab pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rgyus 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis skyed par byed na phrad nas sam ma phrad par byed grang zhes bya ba 'dir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dpyad par bya ba🔽nyid du skabs su bab bo //🔽gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na ni gsal bar byed pa @281b skabs su ma bab pas so //
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'dir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu skabs su bab pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rgyus 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis skyed par byed na phrad nas sam ma phrad par byed grang zhes bya ba 'dir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dpyad par bya ba nyid du skabs su bab bo // gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na ni gsal bar byed pa @281b skabs su ma bab pas so //
translated: The occasion is appropriate for the analysis of the productive cause, but not for the analysis of the revealing cause.🔽The occasion is not appropriate for the analysis of the revealing cause, because the occasion is not appropriate for the analysis of whether or not the revealing cause produces the effect by coming into contact with it.🔽The analysis of contact and noncontact applies to the revealing cause, but not to the productive cause.

original: phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba yang gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu la yin gyi zhes bya ba la 'dir gsal bar byed pa'i sgras ni shes par byed pa brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba yang gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu la yin gyi zhes bya ba la 'dir gsal bar byed pa'i sgras ni shes par byed pa brjod pa yin la /
translated: Here, the term “revealing” is used to refer to the cause that makes known.

original: des na gzhan gyi sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this refutation of the other is made clear by “Does the refutation touch the refuted?” and so on, and the argument of contact and noncontact is made with respect to the cause of making clear.

original: skyed par byed pa la ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyed par byed pa'i rgyu la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba ma byas pas so //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa la ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyed par byed pa'i rgyu la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba ma byas pas so //
translated: But not with respect to the cause of generation, because this refutation does not make the argument of contact and noncontact with respect to the cause of generation, as in “This refutation refutes that refuted.”🔽The words of us Mādhyamikas do not provide an occasion for such a reductio.

original: kho bo cag gi tshig rnams la ltag chod kyi skabs med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na phrad nas sam ma phrad par byed grang zhes bya ba kho bo cag gi tshig rnams la ltag chod kyi skabs yod pa ma yin🔽no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi tshig rnams la ltag chod kyi skabs med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na phrad nas sam ma phrad par byed grang zhes bya ba kho bo cag gi tshig rnams la ltag chod kyi skabs yod pa ma yin🔽no zhes pa'o //
translated: The reason is this: When a cause generates an effect, does it do so through contact or without contact? The words of us Mādhyamikas do not provide an occasion for such a reductio.

original: 'di'i don ni ji ltar khyod kyis skyed par byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs pa de la kho bos phrad pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba byas la de bzhin du gal te kho bo cag gis kyang skyed par byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ji ltar khyod kyis skyed par byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs pa de la kho bos phrad pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba byas la de bzhin du gal te kho bo cag gis kyang skyed par byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as you have accepted a productive cause, we have argued that it must contact its object, and so on.🔽In the same way, if we had accepted a productive cause, then it would follow that the argument of contact, and so on, would apply to us.

original: phrad pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi tshig rnams ltag chod yin par 'gyur gyi 'on kyang sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin pa'i gnas skabs na gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs pa'i phyir
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi tshig rnams ltag chod yin par 'gyur gyi 'on kyang sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin pa'i gnas skabs na gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs pa'i phyir
translated: But since we accept only a revealing cause in the context of the refutation and the refutand,

original: thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i sgo nas ci ltag chod du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i sgo nas ci ltag chod du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: how could our words be nonsense on the grounds that the argument would apply to us?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de'i 'di ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de'i 'di ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that, he says,🔽This is not an answer, and so on.

original: de'i 'di ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'di ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is not an answer.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rang rgyud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rang rgyud pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the Svatantrika Madhyamikas.

original: 'di ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'i sgo nas lan 'debs pa de ni lan ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'i sgo nas lan 'debs pa de ni lan ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “This is not an answer” means that the answer that is given by way of a clarifying cause is not an answer.

original: lan ma yin pa de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lan ma yin pa de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate in detail why that is not an answer,🔽he says “because . . .

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ” and so forth.

original: glags dang bcas pa'i dngos po brjod na zhes bya ba ni brtsad pa'i go skabs dang bcas pa'i gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po khas len pa'o //
analyzed: glags dang bcas pa'i dngos po brjod na zhes bya ba ni brtsad pa'i go skabs dang bcas pa'i gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po khas len pa'o //
translated: “If you state a thing that has an opportunity” means that if you accept a thing that has the characteristic of a clarifying cause that has an opportunity for dispute.

original: pha rol po zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'bras dngos por smra ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'bras dngos por smra ba'o //
translated: “The opponent” is the one who advocates that cause and effect are real things.

original: mi bzod pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni phrad pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni phrad pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: “It is just not being patient” means that it is engaging in a dispute about contact and so forth.

original: gsal byed @282a * //
analyzed: gsal byed @282a * //
translated: The clarifying cause

original: kyi rgyu khyod kyis khas blangs pas gzhan gyis rtsod pa'i glags yod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: kyi rgyu khyod kyis khas blangs pas gzhan gyis rtsod pa'i glags yod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: is accepted by you, and therefore the opponent has an opportunity to dispute.

original: skyed par byed pa ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ji ltar gzhan dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su skyed par byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs pas phrad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba 'jug pa de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang sun 'byin pa'i gnas skabs na gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu khas
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ji ltar gzhan dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su skyed par byed pa'i rgyu khas blangs pas phrad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba 'jug pa de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang sun 'byin pa'i gnas skabs na gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu khas
translated: “Just like a producer,” etc.

original: blangs pas phrad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba 'jug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: blangs pas phrad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba 'jug pa kho na yin no //
translated: Just as others, by accepting a cause that produces in the state of cause and effect, are implicated in the absurd consequence by way of contact, etc., so you also, by accepting a cause that illuminates in the state of refutation, are implicated in the absurd consequence by way of contact, etc.

original: des na khyod kyis lan btab pa de ni lan ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis lan btab pa de ni lan ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, your response is not a response.

original: yang rang rgyud pa la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rang rgyud pa la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate another fault of the autonomous argument, he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Moreover,” etc.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni rang rgyud pas so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni rang rgyud pas so //
translated: “By this” means by the autonomous argument.

original: bstan bcos su dam bcas pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos su rang bzhin med par dam bcas pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'i ched du'o //🔽yongs su gzung ba'i sgrub byed kyi sun 'byin pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa bsgrub pa'i ched du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs yongs su bzung ba de la sun 'byin pa ni ma grub pa la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyis brjod na'o
analyzed: bstan bcos su dam bcas pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos su rang bzhin med par dam bcas pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'i ched du'o // yongs su gzung ba'i sgrub byed kyi sun 'byin pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa bsgrub pa'i ched du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs yongs su bzung ba de la sun 'byin pa ni ma grub pa la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyis brjod na'o
translated: “In order to establish the meaning of the treatise” means in order to establish the meaning of the thesis of the absence of intrinsic existence in the treatise on the middle way.🔽“The refutations of the proof of the thesis” are the refutations of the reasons that the opponent uses to prove the absence of intrinsic existence.

original: // ltag chod 'gog par byed pa'i lan smra bar zhes bya ba ni lan gang gi ltag chod 'gog par byed pa de lta bu'i lan sun 'byin pa la smra bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: // ltag chod 'gog par byed pa'i lan smra bar zhes bya ba ni lan gang gi ltag chod 'gog par byed pa de lta bu'i lan sun 'byin pa la smra bar byed pa ste /
translated: “The response that refutes the countercriticisms” is the response that refutes the countercriticisms that the opponent makes to the reasons that the proponent uses to prove the absence of intrinsic existence.

original: ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon spangs nas gnyis ka la grub pa'i gtan tshigs khas blangs pa de'i sgo nas gzhan gyi phyogs kyang grub pa'i phyir lan de'i ltag chod 'gog par byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon spangs nas gnyis ka la grub pa'i gtan tshigs khas blangs pa de'i sgo nas gzhan gyi phyogs kyang grub pa'i phyir lan de'i ltag chod 'gog par byed pa yin no ;
translated: Having abandoned the faults of nonestablishment and so on, one accepts a reason that is established for both parties, and thereby one also establishes the position of the other party.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'di ni gzhan gyis sun dbyung ba kho na yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyis sun dbyung ba kho na yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “This is only a refutation by the other party,” and so on.

original: rang bzhin med par smra bas dngos po khas blangs na sun 'byin pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par smra bas dngos po khas blangs na sun 'byin pas so //
translated: If the proponent of nonintrinsic existence accepts things, he is refuted.

original: 'di'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'gegs pa'i gnas skabs na sa bon la sogs pa rnams myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'gegs pa'i gnas skabs na sa bon la sogs pa rnams myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: At the time of refuting the status of cause and effect, such things as seeds are not producers of such things as sprouts.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes sgrub par byed pa brjod pa na thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes gcer bu pa rnams kyis 'dod pas gzhan nyid grub pa ma yin no zhes skyon brjod na de'i tshe skyon de spang ba'i
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes sgrub par byed pa brjod pa na thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes gcer bu pa rnams kyis 'dod pas gzhan nyid grub pa ma yin no zhes skyon brjod na de'i tshe skyon de spang ba'i
translated: When you state the proof, “It is a different object because it is like a pot,” the Jains will say, “It is not established that they are different objects,” and they will state the fault, “Everything has the nature of everything else.”🔽At that time, in order to eliminate that fault,

original: ched du nges @282b par gzhan nyid sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: ched du nges @282b par gzhan nyid sgrub par byed la /
translated: you would prove that they are different objects.

original: gang gzhan nyid sgrub par byed pa de ltag chod 'gog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gzhan nyid sgrub par byed pa de ltag chod 'gog par byed pa yin te /
translated: But when you prove that they are different objects, you are refuting the Jains’ sophistry.

original: gzhan nyid sgrub na dngos por grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid sgrub na dngos por grub pa yin te /
translated: For if you prove that they are different objects, then you have established that they are things.

original: gzhan nyid dngos po la brten pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dngos po la brten pa yin pas so //
translated: And because difference is based on things,

original: des na khyod kyis rang bzhin med pa'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis rang bzhin med pa'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: you have undermined your own position that nothing has intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du gang dang gang du bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dang gang du bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in whatever context you refute a reason in order to prove something,

original: gtan tshigs 'gog cing skyon spong bar byed na de dang der gzhan dag gi skyon brjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gog cing skyon spong bar byed na de dang der gzhan dag gi skyon brjod par byed pa'o //
translated: and you eliminate the fault, in that context you will state the faults of others.

original: kho bo cag gis btab pa'i lan ches mdzes so zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya ma phrad sun ni 'byin byed dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan 'debs pa de ni ches mdzes pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis btab pa'i lan ches mdzes so zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya ma phrad sun ni 'byin byed dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan 'debs pa de ni ches mdzes pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The reply that we give is very beautiful indeed. That is to say, the reply that we give, Does the refutation occur without contact with what is refuted? and so on, is very beautiful indeed.

original: de la rang rgyud du smra ba rnams la sngar ni khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas skyon brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rang rgyud du smra ba rnams la sngar ni khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas skyon brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the fault was previously stated in terms of the distinction.

original: da ni dngos por smra ba rnams kyis dbu ma pa rnams la skyon gang brjod pa de dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa khong du ma chud par brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos por smra ba rnams kyis dbu ma pa rnams la skyon gang brjod pa de dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa khong du ma chud par brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that whatever fault the essentialists ascribe to the Madhyamikas is stated without understanding the Madhyamaka's assertions,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dngos grub dang zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dngos grub dang zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid du sgrub pa'o //
translated: Candrakirti says, moreover, etc.🔽Accomplishment means establishment as an entity.

original: dngos su bsgrub nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod na'o //
analyzed: dngos su bsgrub nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod na'o //
translated: If it were to exist as the nature of the object to be established, it would be established as an entity.

original: phrad pa la sogs pa rigs pa nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phrad nas sun 'byin par byed dam ma phrad nas sun 'byin par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs pa rigs pa nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phrad nas sun 'byin par byed dam ma phrad nas sun 'byin par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The application of reasonings such as contact” refers to such things as whether one refutes by coming into contact with what is to be refuted or by not coming into contact with it.

original: de yang yod min pas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag dngos po nyid du ma grub pas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: de yang yod min pas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag dngos po nyid du ma grub pas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du khas blangs pas so //
translated: “That is also not the case” means that since the probandum and the means of affirmation are not established as things, they are accepted as mere pleasantries that are not examined.

original: des na dngos por smra ba'i phyogs ma phrad pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'god par 'os pa gang yin pa de dngos po med par smra ba'i phyogs la 'god pa kho na khyod kyi yi chad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na dngos por smra ba'i phyogs ma phrad pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'god par 'os pa gang yin pa de dngos po med par smra ba'i phyogs la 'god pa kho na khyod kyi yi chad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, whatever is suitable to be the fault of the position of the proponents of things, such as not coming into contact, is only suitable to be the fault of the position of the proponents of nonthings.

original: sun dbyung bar bya ba sun 'byin pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sun dbyung bar bya ba sun 'byin pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable to be the fault of the proponents of emptiness.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach that, the root text says,

original: yongs su dag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Completely pure” and so on.

original: yongs su ma dag mthong ba'i skyon //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag mthong ba'i skyon //
translated: The fault of seeing what is not completely pure.

original: zhes bya ba ni phrad nas sun 'byin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon de ni dngos por smras pa'i phyogs la mthong ba'o //🔽yongs su dag pa'i phyogs kyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid du @283a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phrad nas sun 'byin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon de ni dngos por smras pa'i phyogs la mthong ba'o // yongs su dag pa'i phyogs kyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid du @283a * //
translated: This fault, such as “Does the refutation occur through contact or without contact? ” is seen in the position that advocates real entities.

original: khas mi len pa'i phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i phyogs kyi'o //
translated: “ In the position of complete purity” means in the position that does not accept real entities.

original: don med par zhes bya ba ni phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyad pa ni dngos por khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin la de med pas so //
analyzed: don med par zhes bya ba ni phrad pa la sogs pa'i dpyad pa ni dngos por khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin la de med pas so //
translated: “ Pointless” means that the analysis of contact, etc. is due to the reason of accepting real entities, and that is absent.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example in that regard, he says

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example, etc.

original: ci ltar rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa rnams kyi gcig nyid dam mang po nyid la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pas rab rib med pa rnams la gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa rnams kyi gcig nyid dam mang po nyid la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pas rab rib med pa rnams la gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the refutation of the singularity, multiplicity, etc. of the hairs, etc. perceived by one with myodesopsia is not harmful to those without myodesopsia,

original: des de rnams ma dmigs pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: des de rnams ma dmigs pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: because they do not perceive those hairs, etc.

original: gnyis yongs su bzung nas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag dngos po nyid du bzung nas so //
analyzed: gnyis yongs su bzung nas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag dngos po nyid du bzung nas so //
translated: Having fully grasped the two, i.e., the probandum and the probans, as real entities.

original: de ltar rang gi phyogs la nyes med pa nyid du bstan nas mig ma phrad pa mtshungs pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis lan btab pa de yang
analyzed: de ltar rang gi phyogs la nyes med pa nyid du bstan nas mig ma phrad pa mtshungs pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis lan btab pa de yang
translated: Having thus shown that he is not at fault in his own position, he says, “What is the logic in the opponent’s response that the eye does not generate because it is similar in not coming into contact?”

original: lan ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lan ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He says, “That is not a response,” in order to show that the opponent’s response is not a response.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To that end, he says, “For that very reason,” etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni ma phrad par rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni ma phrad par rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pas so //
translated: “For that very reason” means because of generating its effect without coming into contact.

original: rang gi bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang 'dren pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang 'dren pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Performing its own function” means seeing, leading, and so on.

original: bkag par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyus 'bras bu ma phrad pa skyed na ma phrad pa thams cad bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ma phrad pa mig gis gzugs mthong na thams cad mthong bar 'gyur
analyzed: bkag par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyus 'bras bu ma phrad pa skyed na ma phrad pa thams cad bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ma phrad pa mig gis gzugs mthong na thams cad mthong bar 'gyur
translated: “They should be understood to be refuted” means that just as it was said that if a cause generates an uncontacted effect, then it would generate all uncontacted objects, in the same way, if the eye sees form without contacting it, then it would see all uncontacted forms.

original: ba dang / khab len gyis ma phrad par lcags 'dren na thams cad 'dren par thal bar 'gyur bas de dag kyang bkag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ba dang / khab len gyis ma phrad par lcags 'dren na thams cad 'dren par thal bar 'gyur bas de dag kyang bkag par rig par bya ste /
translated: And if a magnet attracts an uncontacted piece of metal, then it would attract all uncontacted pieces of metal.

original: de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They should be understood to be refuted because they are similar to the thesis.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it says,

original: de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Because the same absurd consequence would apply to them.”

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: “To them” means to the eye and so on.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed cing spong ba'i sgo nas dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de don med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed cing spong ba'i sgo nas dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de don med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the establishment of things as having intrinsic reality through the process of affirmation and negation, which establishes cause and effect, is meaningless,

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “That which is called ‘cause’ and ‘effect’ is a path of bad logic,” and so on.

original: drang por zhes bya ba ni des myur du sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid can gyi go 'phang thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: drang por zhes bya ba ni des myur du sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid can gyi go 'phang thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: “ Straightforward” means that by it one quickly attains the state characterized by buddhahood.

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i lam @283b zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod na rnam par rtog pa yod pas rtog ge ngan pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i lam @283b zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod na rnam par rtog pa yod pas rtog ge ngan pa'i lam mo //
translated: “ Path of bad logic” means that if things exist, then conceptual thought exists, and so it is a path of bad logic.

original: shin tu 'khyog pa zhes bya ba ni lam des tshegs chen pos kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu 'khyog pa zhes bya ba ni lam des tshegs chen pos kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “ Very crooked” means that by that path one does not attain buddhahood even with great effort,

original: lam nyid nor bas so //🔽rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzod ngan pas sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa yang yin la ;
analyzed: lam nyid nor bas so // rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzod ngan pas sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa yang yin la ;
translated: because the path itself is mistaken.🔽“ Fabricated by the bad logic of one’s own conceptual thought” means that it is a fabrication of conceptual thought.

original: bzo yang yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i bzo ste /
analyzed: bzo yang yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i bzo ste /
translated: It is a fabrication because it is conceptual thought, and it is a fabrication because it is bad logic.

original: lam rtsom pa'i bya ba yin la des sbyar ba de don dam par yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: lam rtsom pa'i bya ba yin la des sbyar ba de don dam par yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: because the activity of beginning the path is not ultimately existent.

original: yang dag pa'i lam 'gegs par byed pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi lam 'gegs par byed pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam 'gegs par byed pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi lam 'gegs par byed pas so //
translated: It obstructs the right path means that it obstructs the path characterized by emptiness.

original: te por che ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can ni shin tu tshegs che sa che ba'o //
analyzed: te por che ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can ni shin tu tshegs che sa che ba'o //
translated: It is very difficult means that it is extremely difficult to establish that things have intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa sgrub par byed pa la skyon bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa sgrub par byed pa la skyon bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown the error in establishing that things have intrinsic reality,

original: da ni dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa bsgrub pa de dka' ba yin zhing dngos po rang bzhin med pa sgrub pa ni ches sla ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa bsgrub pa de dka' ba yin zhing dngos po rang bzhin med pa sgrub pa ni ches sla ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to show that the establishment of things as having intrinsic reality is difficult, and that the establishment of things as lacking intrinsic reality is very easy,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Moreover, etc.

original: dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang bral bar ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang bral bar ro //
translated: Without reality means without things.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gzhan dag la zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa rang bzhin dro ba nyid la sogs pa bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la mi ltos par khong du chud par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gzhan dag la zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa rang bzhin dro ba nyid la sogs pa bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la mi ltos par khong du chud par mi nus pas so //
translated: Thus, “in the case of other natures” means that one cannot understand the nature of fire, heat, etc., as non-fabricated and independent of others.

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i dra bas lo ka ci ste 'dir bcol byed ces bya ba ni rtog ge'i gzhung lugs las bstan pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pas lo ka ci'i phyir blo mi bde bar byed de /
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i dra bas lo ka ci ste 'dir bcol byed ces bya ba ni rtog ge'i gzhung lugs las bstan pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pas lo ka ci'i phyir blo mi bde bar byed de /
translated: “ Why is the world here entrusted to the net of bad reasoning?” means that since the nature of things is established by such means of valid knowledge as perception, etc., taught in the treatises of reasoning, why does the world become unhappy?

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po'i rang bzhin mi 'grub pas so //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po'i rang bzhin mi 'grub pas so //
translated: Because the nature of things is not established by such means of valid knowledge as perception, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as, etc.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o /
translated: The word “etc.” includes reflections, etc.

original: rang gi phyogs la grub pa'i dpe zhes bya ba ni de rnams lo ka pas brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas so ;
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la grub pa'i dpe zhes bya ba ni de rnams lo ka pas brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas so ;
translated: The so-called example that is established for one’s own position is that those who are worldly realize that it is false.

original: / gnyis ka la grags pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa dang rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba dag la grags pa'i dpes rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i dpe med pas so //
analyzed: / gnyis ka la grags pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa dang rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba dag la grags pa'i dpes rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i dpe med pas so //
translated: Because there is no example that is renowned to both parties, there is no example that is renowned to those who propound intrinsic nature and those who propound the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar yin dang kho bos rtsod pa thams cad bzlog pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po @284a * //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang kho bos rtsod pa thams cad bzlog pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po @284a * //
translated: Thus, we have refuted all objections.

original: med par grub pa ches sla ba de'i phyir kho bos rtsod pa thams cad bzlog pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: med par grub pa ches sla ba de'i phyir kho bos rtsod pa thams cad bzlog pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Because it is very easy to establish that things are not real, therefore we have refuted all objections.

original: lan yang sus kyang nus par brjod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir lan thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: lan yang sus kyang nus par brjod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir lan thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pas so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that no one can respond to this, it says, “Because all responses are equivalent to the probandum.”

original: da ni gzhan la snying rje med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan la snying rje med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that he has no compassion for others, it says:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med par rtogs su gzhug pa sla ba yin pas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med par rtogs su gzhug pa sla ba yin pas so //
translated: Why? means because it is easy to make them understand that there is no intrinsic reality.

original: lo ka la don ma yin pa bya ba'i phyir su zhig gis rbad cing zhes bya ba ni gang lo kas gnod pa byas pa des da la lo ka 'dis gnod pa byas pas da khyod kyis lo ka slus shig ces skul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lo ka la don ma yin pa bya ba'i phyir su zhig gis rbad cing zhes bya ba ni gang lo kas gnod pa byas pa des da la lo ka 'dis gnod pa byas pas da khyod kyis lo ka slus shig ces skul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Who has incited you to do harm to the world? means that since this world has harmed you, it is urging you, Now you deceive the world!

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod lo ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod lo ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It says you, world, etc.

original: gang gi phyir lo ka'i steng du rgya 'dzugs par byed ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lo ka'i steng du rgya 'dzugs par byed ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should supply who are setting out to deceive the world.

original: lo ka ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lo ka ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of world?

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It says afflicted, etc.

original: snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the object of compassion.

original: dar gyi srin bu ltar rang gi rtog pa'i sbubs kyis gtums pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu ltar rang gi rtog pa'i sbubs kyis gtums pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It says wrapped in the cocoon of their own thoughts, like silkworms, etc.

original: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu rang gi kha chu'i sbubs byas nas de nyid kyis gtums pa de bzhin du rang gi rtog pa nyid sbubs yin la des gtums pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu rang gi kha chu'i sbubs byas nas de nyid kyis gtums pa de bzhin du rang gi rtog pa nyid sbubs yin la des gtums pa'o //
translated: Just as a silkworm, having made its own cocoon out of silk, is enclosed by it, in the same way, one’s own conceptualization is the cocoon, and one is enclosed by it.

original: rgya ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rgya ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of net?

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i srad bus bres pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i srad bus bres pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “woven with the thread of bad logic.”

original: rtog ge ngan pa nyid srad bu yin la de byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa nyid srad bu yin la de byas pa'o //
translated: Bad logic itself is the thread, and it is woven.

original: 'di'i don ni 'jig rten rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'khor bar bcings pa de'i steng du rtog ge ngan pa'i gzhung lugs kyi mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po rnams rang bzhin nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir yang 'ching ba'i rgya byed pa ste
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'jig rten rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'khor bar bcings pa de'i steng du rtog ge ngan pa'i gzhung lugs kyi mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po rnams rang bzhin nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir yang 'ching ba'i rgya byed pa ste
translated: The meaning of this is that worldly people are bound in cyclic existence by the power of their own conceptualization. On top of that, because of the treatises of bad logic, by means of such valid cognitions as direct perception, they also are bound by the creation of the bonds of proving the intrinsic existence of things.

original: / rang bzhin yod par bsgrubs pas 'jig rten pa rnams 'khor bar shin tu dam por bcings pas grol bar mi 'gyur bas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / rang bzhin yod par bsgrubs pas 'jig rten pa rnams 'khor bar shin tu dam por bcings pas grol bar mi 'gyur bas so zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of proving the existence of intrinsic nature, worldly people are bound very tightly in cyclic existence and therefore do not become liberated.

original: des na rtog ge ngan pas bres pa'i srad bu'i rgya dor bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: des na rtog ge ngan pas bres pa'i srad bu'i rgya dor bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that this is a net spread by bad logicians,

original: rtsod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] states, “This dispute . . .” and so on.

original: rtsod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rtog ge ngan pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rtog ge ngan pas byas pa'o //
translated: “ This dispute” is one created by bad logicians.

original: rtog ge ngan pa ni tshad ma dang gzhal bya la ltos pa yin pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa ni tshad ma dang gzhal bya la ltos pa yin pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since bad logic depends on valid cognition and the object of comprehension, in order to refute that,

original: dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] states, “entity.”

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas @284b brdzun pa yin pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas @284b brdzun pa yin pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since all phenomena are false because they are like reflections, therefore, specific characteristics and so on do not exist.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med cing spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med la zhes bya ba gzhal bya bkag pa yin la /🔽mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa'ang ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni tshad mas bkag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med cing spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med la zhes bya ba gzhal bya bkag pa yin la /🔽mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa'ang ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni tshad mas bkag pa'o //
translated: Since there are no specific characteristics and there are no general characteristics, the object of comprehension is refuted.🔽Since there is neither direct perception nor inference, valid cognition is refuted.

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i gzhung lugs kyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma ma yin na gang zhig tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i gzhung lugs kyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma ma yin na gang zhig tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: If direct perception and inference are not valid cognitions because of the scriptural tradition of bad logic, then what is a valid cognition?

original: lan ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer is stated in the line “Here, the non-apprehension of all phenomena,” and so forth.

original: gang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas thugs su chud pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas thugs su chud pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te /
translated: That very non-apprehension of all phenomena is a valid direct perception,

original: de kho nas chos kyi rang bzhin ci lta ba bzhin rtogs pas so ;
analyzed: de kho nas chos kyi rang bzhin ci lta ba bzhin rtogs pas so ;
translated: because it is by that alone that the nature of phenomena is realized as it is.

original: / de yang lung gi rjes su 'brangs nas kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba'i dngos po nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / de yang lung gi rjes su 'brangs nas kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba'i dngos po nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is said to exist conventionally, following scripture. It is not that it exists as an entity.

original: de ltar rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa ni sla ba nyid du bstan nas dngos por smra ba rnams kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur bsgrub pa la sun 'byin pa la lan btab pa gang yin pa de la yang gdab pa'i ched du dang / sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i nyes pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa ni sla ba nyid du bstan nas dngos por smra ba rnams kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur bsgrub pa la sun 'byin pa la lan btab pa gang yin pa de la yang gdab pa'i ched du dang / sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i nyes pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught that the establishment of essencelessness is easy, in order to show that the response of the essentialists to the refutation of the establishment of cause and effect is also not a response and that the fault of contradiction does not exist,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sun 'byin lhag ma 'dir btang bya //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sun 'byin lhag ma 'dir btang bya //
translated: “Moreover…” and so forth is stated.

original: zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The remainder of the refutation should be applied here.

original: sun 'byin lhag ma /
analyzed: sun 'byin lhag ma /
translated: The remainder of the refutation

original: gong du bstan pa yang ni shes byas na //🔽zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pas gzhan gyi phyogs la skye ba dgag pa sun 'byin gang bshad pa de nyid las sun 'byin pa lhag ma ste /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa yang ni shes byas na // zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pas gzhan gyi phyogs la skye ba dgag pa sun 'byin gang bshad pa de nyid las sun 'byin pa lhag ma ste /
translated: Having understood the teaching above,

original: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par shes par byas nas so //
translated: The remainder of the refutation is that, having understood the refutation that was explained above, the refutation that refutes the arising in the system of the opponent through the presentation of dependent arising, one should understand the remainder of the refutation, such as “not from itself,” as appropriate.

original: ci'i phyir sun 'byin gtang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sun 'byin gtang bar bya zhe na /
translated: Why is refutation made?

original: phrad pa la sogs pa phyogs kyi lan gyi ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs pa phyogs kyi lan gyi ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to the position that refutes contact, etc.🔽The response to the position that refutes contact, etc.

original: phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed dam 'on te ma phrad par 'bras bu skyed par byed ces sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de'i lan te /
analyzed: phrad nas 'bras bu skyed par byed dam 'on te ma phrad par 'bras bu skyed par byed ces sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de'i lan te /
translated: is the response to the position that refutes by asking whether an effect is generated through contact or non-contact.

original: gang ma phrad par mtshungs par skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma phrad par mtshungs par skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What logic is there in the claim that non-contact is the same as non-generation?

original: de'i ched du ste /
analyzed: de'i ched du ste /
translated: For that purpose.

original: gang mig dang khab len gyi dpe'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bur smra bas skyon spong byas pa de slang bar bya ba'i don du sun 'byin lhag mar 'dir gtang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang mig dang khab len gyi dpe'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bur smra bas skyon spong byas pa de slang bar bya ba'i don du sun 'byin lhag mar 'dir gtang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The remaining refutations are made here in order to respond to the objection made by the proponents of causality through the examples of the eye and the magnet.

original: 'di ltar bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten cing 'brel par @285a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten cing 'brel par @285a * //
translated: As such, the refutation of self-arising, etc.

original: 'byung ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su skyon gang brjod pa de yang mig la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su skyon gang brjod pa de yang mig la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever faults are mentioned in the context of the elements, etc., should be applied to the eye, etc.

original: gal te ma phrad par rung ba kho na skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma phrad par rung ba kho na skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: If you say that only that which is suitable without contact is a cause,

original: zhes gang brjod pa de la rung ba zhes bya ba ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gang brjod pa de la rung ba zhes bya ba ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: then what is this “suitability”?

original: gang bya bar nus pa de gang gi rgyu la nus pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang bya bar nus pa de gang gi rgyu la nus pa yod pa'o //
translated: That which is able to perform a function is suitable, and that which is able to perform a function is a cause.

original: 'dir skyed zin pa la nus pa srid pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sa la sogs pa sku bas su sun 'byin pa gang brjod pa de 'dir yang gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir skyed zin pa la nus pa srid pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sa la sogs pa sku bas su sun 'byin pa gang brjod pa de 'dir yang gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, whatever refutation of the elements, etc., was mentioned in the context of dependent origination, such as “It is not possible for that which has already arisen to arise again,” should be applied here as well.

original: de bzhin du brten nas gdags pa'i ji ltar shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min zhes bya ba la sogs pas shing rta la sun 'byin pa brjod pa de bzhin du phang lo la sogs pa yang gtang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brten nas gdags pa'i ji ltar shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min zhes bya ba la sogs pas shing rta la sun 'byin pa brjod pa de bzhin du phang lo la sogs pa yang gtang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, whatever refutation of the chariot was mentioned, such as “Just as the chariot is imputed in dependence on its parts,” should be applied to the wheels, etc., as well.

original: sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ci ltar yod min pa de ltar sngar bshad ces bya ba ni gal te kho bos rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs par byed na de'i tshe kho bos sun ci phyin du rgol bar 'gyur ba
analyzed: sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ci ltar yod min pa de ltar sngar bshad ces bya ba ni gal te kho bos rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs par byed na de'i tshe kho bos sun ci phyin du rgol bar 'gyur ba
translated: If we were to posit our own position and refute the position of others, then we would be open to the charge of frivolous argument.

original: las phyogs gnyis ka yang yod pa ma yin pas kho bos sun 'byin ci phyin du rgol ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: las phyogs gnyis ka yang yod pa ma yin pas kho bos sun 'byin ci phyin du rgol ba ji ltar yin /
translated: But since we do not have either of the two positions, how can we be charged with frivolous argument?

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i dngos po bkag pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa ldog pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan pas rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang bral bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i dngos po bkag pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa ldog pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan pas rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang bral bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Since we have shown that the mere cessation of conceptualization is to be accomplished by means of the refutation of things accepted by others, how could we be said to be positing our own position?🔽As it has been said:

original: de yang / rtogs rnams dngos po yod na 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: de yang / rtogs rnams dngos po yod na 'byung ba ste //
translated: When there are things, conceptualization occurs.

original: dngos po ci ltar med pa yongs dpyad zin //
analyzed: dngos po ci ltar med pa yongs dpyad zin //
translated: We have already analyzed how things do not exist.

original: dngos po med par 'di rnams mi 'byung dper //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'di rnams mi 'byung dper //
translated: Without things, conceptualization does not occur.

original: bud shing med par me yod min de bzhin //
analyzed: bud shing med par me yod min de bzhin //
translated: For example, without fuel, fire does not exist.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams ni rtog pas bcings //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ni rtog pas bcings //
translated: Ordinary people are bound by conceptualization.

original: mi rtog rnal 'byor pa ni grol 'gyur bas //🔽rtog rnams log par gyur pa gang yin de //
analyzed: mi rtog rnal 'byor pa ni grol 'gyur bas // rtog rnams log par gyur pa gang yin de //
translated: The yogin who is free from conceptualization is liberated.🔽The wise have said that the cessation of conceptualization

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i 'bras bur mkhas rnams gsungs //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i 'bras bur mkhas rnams gsungs //
translated: is the fruit of analysis.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the rejection of the position of another,

original: gang gi phyir dgag par bya ba'i gzhan gyi phyogs dngos por grub pa med pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgag par bya ba'i gzhan gyi phyogs dngos por grub pa med pas so //
translated: because the position of another, the object of refutation, does not exist as a real entity.

original: de'i phyir kho bo sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ma yin no //🔽lhag ma phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya zhes bya ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba la skyon lhag ma brjod pa yang skyon sngar bstan pa 'di nyid kyis te sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ci ltar yin pa de skad du sngar bshad pa
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ma yin no // lhag ma phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya zhes bya ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba la skyon lhag ma brjod pa yang skyon sngar bstan pa 'di nyid kyis te sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ci ltar yin pa de skad du sngar bshad pa
translated: Therefore, we are not quibblers.🔽The remainder should be understood by this very method.🔽The remainder of the faults that should be stated in regard to quibblers should be understood by this very method that was previously taught, that is, by this very method that was previously explained in the statement,

original: zhes bya @285b ba'i phyogs 'dis rtogs par bya ste gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya @285b ba'i phyogs 'dis rtogs par bya ste gtang bar bya'o //
translated: “The quibblers are just like that.”

original: gal te bdag gis gzhan gyi phyogs bsal na sun ci phyin du rgol bar 'gyur ba dang / 'ga' zhig gis rang gi phyogs 'dzugs shing gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs na de'i tshe kho bo de las zlog par sun ci phyin du rgol bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang dngos por 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med par rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs med pas de dag
analyzed: gal te bdag gis gzhan gyi phyogs bsal na sun ci phyin du rgol bar 'gyur ba dang / 'ga' zhig gis rang gi phyogs 'dzugs shing gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs na de'i tshe kho bo de las zlog par sun ci phyin du rgol bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang dngos por 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med par rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs med pas de dag
translated: However, since there is no existent thing at all, and since there is no position of one’s own and no position of others,

original: la sgrub pa dang dgag pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la sgrub pa dang dgag pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: there is no establishment of proofs and refutations in regard to them.

original: de dag las bzlog pa'i bdag sun ci phyin du rgol ba ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon lhag ma rnams kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa'i bdag sun ci phyin du rgol ba ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon lhag ma rnams kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the remaining faults, such as “How could you be a debater who refutes without fault by reversing that?” should be stated.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:🔽That which arises dependently🔽we explain as emptiness.🔽That is dependent arising.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That is the middle way.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa ston pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa ston pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “The presentation of dependent origination” is in the context of teaching the selflessness of phenomena.

original: brten nas btags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag gis bdag med pa stong pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: brten nas btags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag gis bdag med pa stong pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “The presentation of dependent imputation” is in the context of teaching the selflessness of persons.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la'o //
translated: “The position of others” is the position of those who propound that things have essence.

original: sun 'byin pa gang bshad pa de nyid las zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gang bshad pa de nyid las zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The refutation that was explained” is “not from itself” and so on.

original: sun 'byin pa'i lan gyi don du zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang bcas par smra bas sun 'byin pa'i lan gdab pa'i don du gang ma phrad par mtshungs pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de nyid la sun 'byin gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i lan gyi don du zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang bcas par smra bas sun 'byin pa'i lan gdab pa'i don du gang ma phrad par mtshungs pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de nyid la sun 'byin gtang bar bya'o //
translated: “The response to the refutation” is the response to the refutation by the essentialist. “What is the logic behind the claim that because they are similar in not contacting each other, they do not cause the arising of each other?”🔽“The response to the refutation” is the response to the refutation by the essentialist.

original: sun ci phyin du rgol ba ma yin pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sun ci phyin du rgol ba ma yin pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is not a mere fault-finder,

original: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “In the treatise . . . ” and so on.

original: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos las so //
translated: “In the treatise” refers to the treatise of the Middle Way.

original: sun 'byin pa ltag ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ltag ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absurdity of the opponent’s position,

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “By what . . . ” and so on.

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs gzhag pa dang gzhan gyi phyogs bzlog pas so //
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs gzhag pa dang gzhan gyi phyogs bzlog pas so //
translated: “By what” refers to the positing of one’s own position and the refutation of the other’s position.

original: mtshan nyid byas pa 'di yang dag pa mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs 'jog pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba tsam la 'jug pa'i rgol ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid de
analyzed: mtshan nyid byas pa 'di yang dag pa mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs 'jog pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba tsam la 'jug pa'i rgol ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid de
translated: This definition is the correct definition. The definition is this: a debater who engages in positing his own position and in merely refuting the other’s position is a fault-finder.

original: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the correct definition.

original: mtshan @286a * //
analyzed: mtshan @286a * //
translated: The definition

original: nyid 'di ni zhes bya ba sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyid 'di ni zhes bya ba sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of quibble.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gnyis ka la grub pa'i chos can dang gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pas rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gnyis ka la grub pa'i chos can dang gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pas rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase such as these includes the other types of fallacious theses, such as the unestablished subject, the unestablished reason, and the unestablished example, which are not proper for one's own position.

original: phyogs 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ji ltar yod min pa de skad sngar bshad ces bya ba'i phyogs 'di nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phyogs 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba yang ji ltar yod min pa de skad sngar bshad ces bya ba'i phyogs 'di nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase for this very reason refers to the reason stated earlier, because the quibble itself does not exist.

original: da ni bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyi /
analyzed: da ni bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyi /
translated: Now, in order to teach the summary of the meaning, [Nāgārjuna] states the root text:

original: de la de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that [connection], the suchness of that is not the suchness of this.

original: 'di yan chad kyis ni zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngar bshad lhag ma phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis ni zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngar bshad lhag ma phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: The phrase up to this point refers to the explanation up to the point of the remaining reason, because the quibble itself does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di ston cing zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa ston cing ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ston cing zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa ston cing ngo //
translated: Therefore, “this” refers to the teaching of objective selflessness and the teaching of personal selflessness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa dang stong pa nyid ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa dang stong pa nyid ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: The analysis of emptiness is the analysis of selflessness and emptiness, which are synonymous.

original: bdag med 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos dang gang zag dbye bas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pas dbye bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag med 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos dang gang zag dbye bas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pas dbye bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “This selflessness” and so on. The analysis of the distinction between the objective selflessness and the personal selflessness is the analysis of the distinction between the objective selflessness and the personal selflessness.

original: de ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it taught?

original: 'gro ba rnam dgrol phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnam dgrol phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is taught for the sake of the complete liberation of the world and so on.

original: de las rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Complete liberation is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: the characteristic of the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the characteristic of the abandonment of the afflictive and the objective obstructions.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par grol ba ni gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la rnam gzhag bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par grol ba ni gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la rnam gzhag bya'o //
translated: The liberation that has the characteristic of abandoning the afflictive obstructions should be posited for the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, through their thorough knowledge of the selflessness of persons.

original: gnyis ka spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par grol ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas rnams la rnam gzhag bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par grol ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas rnams la rnam gzhag bya'o //
translated: The liberation that has the characteristic of abandoning both should be posited for the bodhisattvas and buddhas.

original: rnam par grol ba de yang bdag med pa gnyis yongs su rtogs pa pas gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de yang bdag med pa gnyis yongs su rtogs pa pas gyur pa yin la /
translated: And that liberation is brought about by the thorough realization of the two selflessnesses.

original: 'gro ba rnams dgrol pa'i phyir zhes bya bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams dgrol pa'i phyir zhes bya bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is “in order to liberate migrating beings.”

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: bdag med pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This selflessness,” and so on.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phyir bstan la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ni bdag tu 'dzin pa las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phyir bstan la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ni bdag tu 'dzin pa las byung ba yin la /
translated: “In order to liberate” means that all afflictions arise from the apprehension of a self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa log na nyon mongs pa thams cad ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa log na nyon mongs pa thams cad ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the self is refuted, all afflictions are refuted.

original: rnam pa thams @286b cad mkhyen pa thob pas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du thugs su chud pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams @286b cad mkhyen pa thob pas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du thugs su chud pas so //
translated: “Having attained omniscience” means that, through the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, he has realized the nature of all phenomena in all aspects.

original: rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag las grol bar bya ba'i phyir chos rnams ji ltar rang bzhin gnas pa bzhin du thugs su chud pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ldog pas so //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag las grol bar bya ba'i phyir chos rnams ji ltar rang bzhin gnas pa bzhin du thugs su chud pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ldog pas so //
translated: “In order to liberate” means that, in order to liberate from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, he has realized the nature of phenomena just as it is. By refuting the obstructions to omniscience, he has realized the nature of phenomena just as it is.

original: gal te ji srid du phung po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du bdag la mngon par zhen pa med na bdag la mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung bas de rnams la yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rkyen 'di btsam yongs su shes pa
analyzed: gal te ji srid du phung po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du bdag la mngon par zhen pa med na bdag la mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung bas de rnams la yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rkyen 'di btsam yongs su shes pa
translated: If there were no clinging to a self as long as there is clinging to the aggregates, then since clinging to a self would not occur, how could one posit that they know both forms of selflessness on the basis of their understanding of the selflessness of phenomena alone,

original: las chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa de rnams kyi bdag med pa gnyi ga yang shes pa'i rnam gzhag ji ltar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: las chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa de rnams kyi bdag med pa gnyi ga yang shes pa'i rnam gzhag ji ltar mi bya zhe na /
translated: since they have not understood the selflessness of phenomena?
