original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽nyan thos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam mthong mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / nyan thos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam mthong mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to teach the reply to that, he says:🔽Even though they see this mere conditionality of dependent origination,🔽they do not see the reality of dependent origination.🔽Even though they see this mere conditionality of dependent origination,

original: zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de tsam du mthong ba yin gyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de tsam du mthong ba yin gyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: they see dependent origination as “When this exists, that comes into existence.” They do not see the reality of dependent origination.

original: chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs pa bsgoms pa med de zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med cing rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs pa bsgoms pa med de zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med cing rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: There is no cultivation of the complete objective selflessness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob pa'i rten rgyur gyur pa de de rnams kyi la yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob pa'i rten rgyur gyur pa de de rnams kyi la yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The support for attaining the qualities of a Buddha is not in them, because it is characterized by the absence of signs and the absence of effort.

original: des na de rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs pa bsgom pa med pas de rnam gzhag ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs pa bsgom pa med pas de rnam gzhag ma byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no cultivation of the complete objective selflessness in them, they are not established as having it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, he says, “In the three realms,” etc.

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i thabs tsam gyis rang bzhin can de dag la yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i thabs tsam gyis rang bzhin can de dag la yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The individual who has the nature of being the mere means for abandoning the attachment to a self that is the cause of the afflictions of the three realms has it.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su ma rtogs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa mi spong bas so //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su ma rtogs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa mi spong bas so //
translated: “In them” and so on means that because the selflessness of persons is not fully understood, attachment and so on are not abandoned.

original: de ltar sngar bstan pa'i bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngar bstan pa'i bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the summary of the two kinds of selflessness taught above,

original: bdag med pa de dag rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa de dag rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach those selflessnesses in detail,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Thus, etc. ”

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: “ This itself” is selflessness.

original: rnam pa mang zhes @287a * //
analyzed: rnam pa mang zhes @287a * //
translated: “ In many ways”

original: bya ba ni rnam pa bcu drug dang bzhi'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: bya ba ni rnam pa bcu drug dang bzhi'i sgo nas so //
translated: is in terms of sixteen and four aspects.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis la ltos nas so //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis la ltos nas so //
translated: “ Again” is in terms of two aspects.

original: gdul ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgo nas gdul ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: gdul ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgo nas gdul ba rnams la'o //
translated: “ For the sake of those to be trained” is for the sake of those to be trained in terms of inner emptiness, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Selflessness, etc. ”

original: gdul ba'i bsam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa'i mos pa yod pa las so //
analyzed: gdul ba'i bsam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa'i mos pa yod pa las so //
translated: “ Due to the variety of the inclinations of those to be trained” is due to the existence of the inclinations of those to be trained to enter into emptiness, etc. in terms of emptiness, etc.

original: de la stong pa nyid nyi shu'i rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid nyi shu'i rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the presentation of the twenty kinds of emptiness,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text says:

original: spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu drug gi sgo nas rgyas par ro //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu drug gi sgo nas rgyas par ro //
translated: “Therein, the extensive explanation is in terms of sixteen aspects.

original: mdor bsdus te slar yang bzhir bshad ces bya ba ni mdor bsdus te stong pa nyid bzhi gsungs pas so //🔽theg chen du yang bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te slar yang bzhir bshad ces bya ba ni mdor bsdus te stong pa nyid bzhi gsungs pas so // theg chen du yang bzhed pa yin //
translated: The brief summary is the explanation of four.🔽The Great Vehicle also asserts twenty.”

original: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid nyi shu la theg pa chen por yang bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid nyi shu la theg pa chen por yang bzhed pa yin te /
translated: The Great Vehicle also asserts twenty kinds of emptiness.

original: de rnams lam gyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams lam gyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Because they are the nature of the path.

original: 'di'i don ni rgyas par phye na stong pa nyid bcu drug yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rgyas par phye na stong pa nyid bcu drug yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that if one elaborates, there are sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi yin la /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi yin la /
translated: If one summarizes, there are four, such as the emptiness of nature.

original: shin tu mdor bsdu na chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i dbye bas gnyis so //
analyzed: shin tu mdor bsdu na chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i dbye bas gnyis so //
translated: If one summarizes extremely, there are two, the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons.

original: stong pa nyid nyi shu mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyi shu mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the twenty kinds of emptiness by way of the sources of the sūtras,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “As it is said,” and so on.

original: 'di rnams ni gong du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni gong du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: These will be explained above.

original: 'di rnams kyi dbye ba yang kun rdzob tu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dbye ba yang kun rdzob tu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that their divisions are also conventional,

original: stong pa nyid dam stong pa nyid ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam stong pa nyid ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Emptiness or non-emptiness,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid ma yin pa ni phan tshun ltos nas 'jog pa'i phyir rang bzhin cung zad kyang yid pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid ma yin pa ni phan tshun ltos nas 'jog pa'i phyir rang bzhin cung zad kyang yid pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Emptiness and non-emptiness are posited in mutual dependence, and therefore they are not even slightly established by way of their own nature.

original: rnam pa de lta bus gdul ba'i skye bo'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis 'dul ba'i skye bo'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus gdul ba'i skye bo'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis 'dul ba'i skye bo'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: “From that point of view” means from the point of view of the disciples who are to be trained by emptiness.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “In the treatise” means in Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig stong pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig stong pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,

original: rang bzhin dang ldan par gyur na de'i tshe de la ltos nas stong pa nyid cung zad yod par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po cung zad @287b kyang med pas de'i tshe de la ltos nas btags pa'i stong pa nyid yod🔽par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ldan par gyur na de'i tshe de la ltos nas stong pa nyid cung zad yod par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po cung zad @287b kyang med pas de'i tshe de la ltos nas btags pa'i stong pa nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.🔽If things were not empty,🔽then emptiness would not exist.

original: stong po zhes kyang mi brjod de /🔽zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig gis dngos po rnams phyin ci ma log pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid dam mi stong pa 'am gnyis ka'am gnyis ka ma yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'i /
analyzed: stong po zhes kyang mi brjod de /🔽zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig gis dngos po rnams phyin ci ma log pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid dam mi stong pa 'am gnyis ka'am gnyis ka ma yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'i /
translated: If things were not empty,🔽then

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ma brjod na ni khong du chud par mi nus pas kho bo cag gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ma brjod na ni khong du chud par mi nus pas kho bo cag gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid la gnas te /
translated: However, if one does not speak in accordance with the way things really are, one will not be able to understand. Therefore, we, abiding in the truth of the conventional,

original: tha snyad kyi don du gdul bya'i skye bo rnams dang rjes su mthun par sgro btags nas stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par bya la /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi don du gdul bya'i skye bo rnams dang rjes su mthun par sgro btags nas stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par bya la /
translated: superimpose in accordance with the beings to be trained, and say, “It is empty.”

original: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / stong dang mi stong zhes bya ba dang / stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / stong dang mi stong zhes bya ba dang / stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: We also say, “It is not empty,” “It is both empty and not empty,” and “It is neither empty nor not empty.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “It is said to be expressible for the sake of designation.”

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin par rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin par rig par bya ba ste /
translated: The intended meaning here should be understood as follows.

original: 'di ltar dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las ;
analyzed: 'di ltar dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las ;
translated: Thus, in the Wisdom at the Root of the Middle Way,

original: thams cad bden zhing bden pa yin //🔽bden dang mi bden pa yang min //
analyzed: thams cad bden zhing bden pa yin // bden dang mi bden pa yang min //
translated: It is all true, and it is true as true.🔽It is neither true nor false.

original: bden min mi bden pa yang min //
analyzed: bden min mi bden pa yang min //
translated: It is neither not true nor not false.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gang dang gang la sngar gang dga' //
analyzed: gang dang gang la sngar gang dga' //
translated: Whatever is delightful to whomever,

original: de dang de ni de la spyad //
analyzed: de dang de ni de la spyad //
translated: that is what he will practice.

original: snang bar gyur na dam chos kyi //🔽snod du nam yang 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: snang bar gyur na dam chos kyi // snod du nam yang 'gyur ma yin //
translated: If he becomes a vessel for the pure teaching,

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: he will never be a vessel for the wrong teaching.

original: re zhig dang po nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis rang la grub pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po'i dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par thos pa'i don du mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la /🔽dper na kla klo skad gzhan gyis //
analyzed: re zhig dang po nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis rang la grub pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po'i dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par thos pa'i don du mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la / dper na kla klo skad gzhan gyis //
translated: First of all, the Lord wishes to hear about the nature of the categories of things that are established for himself, so that he may then teach them to his disciples.

original: go bar mi nus de bzhin du //
analyzed: go bar mi nus de bzhin du //
translated: For example, just as barbarians cannot understand a language other than their own,

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten pa med par //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten pa med par //
translated: so too, without worldly convention,

original: nam yang go bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: nam yang go bar nus ma yin //
translated: one cannot be understood in the world.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang lhan cig rtsod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang lhan cig rtsod kyi /
translated: And, one argues with the world on the basis of worldly convention, but not without it.

original: gang 'jig rten pas yod par 'dod pa de ngas kyang yod pa par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pas yod par 'dod pa de ngas kyang yod pa par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Whatever the world accepts as existent, I too accept as existent.

original: gang 'jig rten las yod par mi 'dod pa de ngas kyang yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i lung gis ma rig pa'i rab rib can gyis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par gang bden par btags pa de nyid re zhig bcom ldan 'das🔽kyis de mthong ba la ltos nas bden pa nyid du yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten las yod par mi 'dod pa de ngas kyang yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i lung gis ma rig pa'i rab rib can gyis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par gang bden par btags pa de nyid re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis de mthong ba la ltos nas bden pa nyid du yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha said in a sutra:🔽I do not assert that which is not asserted to exist in the world to exist.🔽This sutra states that the Lord said that the things imputed to be real by those whose eyes of ignorance are impaired, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, are real in the sense of being seen by those whose eyes of ignorance are impaired.

original: gang gis srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa @288a * //
analyzed: gang gis srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa @288a * //
translated: The Buddha said that the things imputed to be real by those whose eyes of ignorance are impaired, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, are real in the sense of being seen by those whose eyes of ignorance are impaired.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyis mthas klas pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams kyi chags pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i dbye ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa rgyu dang bcas pa dang / ro myong ba dang bcas pa dang / skyon dang bcas pa'i phyin ci ma log par nye bar ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa 'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnam pa ma lus pa mkhyen pa'o zhes bdag dang bdag la 'jig rten gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du'o
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyis mthas klas pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams kyi chags pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i dbye ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa rgyu dang bcas pa dang / ro myong ba dang bcas pa dang / skyon dang bcas pa'i phyin ci ma log par nye bar ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa 'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnam pa ma lus pa mkhyen pa'o zhes bdag dang bdag la 'jig rten gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du'o
translated: Thus, in order to generate respect for himself and for the world, he says, “The Bhagavān, omniscient, all-seeing, knows all the worldly activities without exception.”

original: // de ltar bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes blos gus pa skyes pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la phyis kyi dus su thams cad bden pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: // de ltar bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes blos gus pa skyes pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la phyis kyi dus su thams cad bden pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, later on, he says to the disciples who have generated respect for the Bhagavān by thinking, “The Bhagavān is omniscient,” “All of that is not true.”

original: de la bden pa ni gang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de la bden pa ni gang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Here, truth is that which does not change into something else.

original: 'du byed rnams ni skad cig so so la 'jig pa yin pas gzhan nyid du 'gyur bar mthong bas thams cad bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni skad cig so so la 'jig pa yin pas gzhan nyid du 'gyur bar mthong bas thams cad bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Since compounded phenomena are destroyed in each instant, they are seen to become other. Therefore, nothing is true.

original: la lar thams cad bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la lar thams cad bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa gsungs te /
translated: In some cases, the Buddha said that everything is true and in some cases, he said that everything is not true.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams la ltos nas thams cad bden pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams la ltos nas thams cad bden pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: From the perspective of ordinary beings, he said that everything is true.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams la ltos nas thams cad brdzun pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams la ltos nas thams cad brdzun pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: From the perspective of āryas, he said that everything is false.

original: de rnams kyis de ltar dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis de ltar dmigs pas so //
translated: This is because they perceive things in that way.

original: la lang dus shin tu yun ring bar de kho na nyid mthong ba la goms pa sgrib pa cung zad drungs ma phyung ba rnams la bden pa yang ma yin la mi bden pa yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: la lang dus shin tu yun ring bar de kho na nyid mthong ba la goms pa sgrib pa cung zad drungs ma phyung ba rnams la bden pa yang ma yin la mi bden pa yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In some cases, he said that things are neither true nor false for those who have cultivated the vision of suchness for a very long time, but have not completely eliminated the obscurations.

original: sgrib pa cung zad yod pa de spang ba'i ched du mo gsham bu'i sngo bsangs dang / sngo bsangs ma yin pa 'gegs pa bzhin du gnyi ga bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa cung zad yod pa de spang ba'i ched du mo gsham bu'i sngo bsangs dang / sngo bsangs ma yin pa 'gegs pa bzhin du gnyi ga bkag pa yin no //
translated: In order to eliminate the slight obscuration that remains, both are refuted, like the blueness and non-blueness of the son of a barren woman.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the Lord Buddha.

original: lam log pa las blan nas lam yang dag pa la 'god pa ni bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam log pa las blan nas lam yang dag pa la 'god pa ni bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The teaching is the establishment of those who have gone astray on false paths on the true path.

original: de ltar gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su bstan pa'o ;
translated: That which is the teaching for those to be trained is the instruction.

original: / da ni stong pa nyid rnams kyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / da ni stong pa nyid rnams kyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of emptiness,🔽he says,

original: de la nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The emptiness of the internal, etc.

original: mig gis stong zhes bya ba ni mig ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: mig gis stong zhes bya ba ni mig ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the eye is the eye's emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mig gi'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mig gi'o //
translated: The its refers to the eye.

original: rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The intrinsic nature refers to the characteristic of emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: @288b de bzhin zhes bya ba la sos pa ni rna ba la sogs pa yang rna ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos stong pa yin te /
analyzed: @288b de bzhin zhes bya ba la sos pa ni rna ba la sogs pa yang rna ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos stong pa yin te /
translated: “Just so” means that the ear, etc. are also empty of the entity of the ear, etc.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin yang stong pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin yang stong pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because their nature is also emptiness.

original: rang bzhin gang gis de rnams stong pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis de rnams stong pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “By what nature are they empty?”

original: de la lan ni /🔽ther thug gnas pa nyid dang ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni / ther thug gnas pa nyid dang ni /
translated: The answer is:🔽Because they do not endure eternally,

original: mi 'jig ma yin nyid kyi phyir ;🔽/ zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi 'jig ma yin nyid kyi phyir ; / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And because they do not disintegrate.

original: rnam 'gyur med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i rang bzhin la ltos nas de rnams la rang bzhin med pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam 'gyur med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i rang bzhin la ltos nas de rnams la rang bzhin med pa yin te /
translated: In terms of the nature that is without transformation and without disintegration, they are without intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar gal te mig la sogs pa la rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te mig la sogs pa la rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
translated: In this way, if the eye, etc. had intrinsic nature,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin la rnam 'gyur med pa dang 'jig pa med pas de rnams rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa med par 'gyur ba las de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin la rnam 'gyur med pa dang 'jig pa med pas de rnams rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa med par 'gyur ba las de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: then, because intrinsic nature is without transformation and without disintegration, they would be without transformation and without disintegration. But that does not exist, and therefore they are without intrinsic nature.

original: nang stong pa nyid du 'dod ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams sems can nyid du rtogs pas so //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid du 'dod ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams sems can nyid du rtogs pas so //
translated: The statement are asserted as inner emptiness is because the eyes and so on are realized as sentient beings.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the scriptural source of the sūtra,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the text] says as it is said... and so on.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa nyid dang / mi 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa nyid dang / mi 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain non-enduring and non-destruction,

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the text] says in that regard, those... and so on.

original: rang bzhin mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes pa'o //
translated: Not abandoning its nature means having an unchanging nature.

original: 'dir slob dpon gyi bzhed pa'i dbang du byas na ni mdo'i tshig dang de'i bshad pa yang 'dir gsungs pa bzhin du yin no //
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyi bzhed pa'i dbang du byas na ni mdo'i tshig dang de'i bshad pa yang 'dir gsungs pa bzhin du yin no //
translated: Here, from the perspective of the master's intention, the words of the sūtra and its explanation are as stated here.

original: 'phags pa rnam grol sde'i dbang du byas na ni /🔽mdo'i tshig zer zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam grol sde'i dbang du byas na ni / mdo'i tshig zer zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: From the perspective of Ārya Vimuktisena,🔽the words of the sūtra would be not enduring and not being destroyed,

original: de'i bshad pa ni ther zug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni ther zug pa ste /
translated: and its explanation would be enduring and not being destroyed.

original: 'tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'tshogs pa yin la /
translated: It is a collection.

original: der dngos po'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pas dngos po ther zug ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: der dngos po'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pas dngos po ther zug ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since the nature of entities is not observed there, entities are not permanent.

original: de lta bu la 'jig pa med pas 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu la 'jig pa med pas 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since there is no destruction in that way, they are not destroyed.

original: de lta bu'i skye ba med pa nyid dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na mig la sogs pa rnams la nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i skye ba med pa nyid dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na mig la sogs pa rnams la nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bzhed do //
translated: Since this nature of the reality of non-production and non-cessation exists in those eyes, etc., they are called “inner emptiness.”

original: de la bstan bcos kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the treatise,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said,” and so on.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //🔽rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so // rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
translated: “ As it is said” means in the wisdom of the fundamental Middle Way.

original: 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: “ It is not logical for a nature to arise from causes and conditions.”

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa @289a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa @289a * //
translated: If sprouts, formations, and so on

original: rnams la rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
analyzed: rnams la rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
translated: had a nature,

original: de'i tshe yod pa rnams la rgyu dang rkyen ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa rnams la rgyu dang rkyen ci zhig dgos /
translated: then what need would there be for causes and conditions for those that exist?

original: ji ltar da lta'i 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa yang bsgrub pa'i don du ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang de skye ba'i don du byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar da lta'i 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa yang bsgrub pa'i don du ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang de skye ba'i don du byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the present formations and sprouts do not appropriate ignorance and seeds in order to establish themselves, so also they would not act for the sake of the arising of another.

original: de'i rang bzhin yod pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod pas so //
translated: Because their nature exists.

original: gal te ma skyes pa'i snga rol du dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa'i snga rol du dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If a thing has no intrinsic reality prior to its arising,🔽then if it existed, arising would be pointless.

original: gal te yod par gyur na skye ba don med par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang skye ba'i sngon rol na rang bzhin de rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas phyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no /
analyzed: gal te yod par gyur na skye ba don med par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang skye ba'i sngon rol na rang bzhin de rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas phyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no /
translated: But if intrinsic reality existed prior to arising, then later it would arise in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: zhe na ; de ltar 'dod na /
analyzed: zhe na ; de ltar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that,🔽then it would be produced from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung na ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung na ni //
translated: If it is produced from causes and conditions,

original: rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: then intrinsic reality would be fabricated.

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yin pas rang bzhin byas pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yin pas rang bzhin byas pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If it is produced from causes and conditions, then intrinsic reality would be fabricated.

original: des na rang bzhin byas pa nyid du khas len pas byas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba des kho bo cag la gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin byas pa nyid du khas len pas byas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba des kho bo cag la gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since we accept that nature is produced, the consequence that it is produced does not harm us.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rang bzhin byas pa yin no zhes //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / rang bzhin byas pa yin no zhes //
translated: To demonstrate that this is also illogical, he says:

original: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be tenable

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: to say that nature is produced?

original: byas pa dang rang bzhin dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir mi rigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: byas pa dang rang bzhin dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir mi rigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since nature is the opposite of produced, it is illogical.

original: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo yin pas na rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nges tshig yin pas gang byas pa'i dngos po zhes mi brjod pa de dper na chu'i dro ba nyid de me lce las 'brel pa las 'byung ba dang / chu shel la sogs pa la padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo yin pas na rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nges tshig yin pas gang byas pa'i dngos po zhes mi brjod pa de dper na chu'i dro ba nyid de me lce las 'brel pa las 'byung ba dang / chu shel la sogs pa la padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: Since it is one’s own nature, it is called “nature.” Since this is the definition, it is not called “the state of being produced.” For example, the heat of water is not called “the state of being produced” from the connection with fire, or the nature of a ruby, etc., is not called “the state of being produced” from water crystal, etc.

original: gdam byas pa de la rang bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gdam byas pa de la rang bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is produced is called “nature.”

original: dper na me'i dro ba nyid dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i padma r'a ga la sogs pa la yod pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: dper na me'i dro ba nyid dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i padma r'a ga la sogs pa la yod pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: For example, the heat of fire and the nature of a genuine ruby and so on

original: de rnams kyi dngos po gzhan dang phrad pa las ma byung bas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dngos po gzhan dang phrad pa las ma byung bas so //
translated: are not produced from contact with other things.🔽In the same way, we also accept that the nature of fire is not heat, because it is produced.

original: de ltar ma byas pa ni rang bzhin yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gnas pa la kho bo cag kyang dag me'i dro ba nyid gang yin pa de rang bzhin ma yin no zhes smras te /🔽byas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas pa ni rang bzhin yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gnas pa la kho bo cag kyang dag me'i dro ba nyid gang yin pa de rang bzhin ma yin no zhes smras te / byas pa yin pas so //
translated: The heat of fire is not its nature, because it is produced.

original: nor bu dang bud shing dang nyi ma rnams phrad pa dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa la sogs pa las me rgyu dang rkyen la ltos par dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: nor bu dang bud shing dang nyi ma rnams phrad pa dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa la sogs pa las me rgyu dang rkyen la ltos par dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Fire is observed to depend on causes and conditions, such as the conjunction of the gem, the sun, and water, or the rubbing of kindling sticks.

original: me las tha dad du gyur ba'i dro ba nyid kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: me las tha dad du gyur ba'i dro ba nyid kyang mi srid do //
translated: It is also impossible that heat is different from fire.

original: des na dro ba nyid dang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin pas byas pa'i phyir chu'i dro ba @289b nyid bzhin rang bzhin nyid du 'ang mi 'gyur ro gsal bar khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dro ba nyid dang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin pas byas pa'i phyir chu'i dro ba @289b nyid bzhin rang bzhin nyid du 'ang mi 'gyur ro gsal bar khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since heat is generated by causes and conditions, it is a product, and like the heat of water, it is not a nature.

original: gal te ba lang rdzi dang bud med la sogs pa rnams la tsha ba nyid me'i rang bzhin yin par grags pas rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te ba lang rdzi dang bud med la sogs pa rnams la tsha ba nyid me'i rang bzhin yin par grags pas rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If you ask, “Since it is well known that heat is the nature of fire to cowherds, women, and so on, why do you say it is not a nature?”

original: kho bo cag gis ma grags pa yin no zhes mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ma grags pa yin no zhes mi brjod kyi /
translated: We do not say that it is not well known.

original: 'on kyang kho bo cag gis 'di rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni 'os pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang kho bo cag gis 'di rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni 'os pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: However, we say that it is not suitable to be a nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pas so //
translated: Because it does not have the characteristics of a nature.

original: ma rig pa'i phyin ci log gi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po'i tshogs la rang bzhin dang bcas par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phyin ci log gi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po'i tshogs la rang bzhin dang bcas par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Following the errors of ignorance, the world understands that a collection of things that lack a nature possess a nature.

original: ji ltar rab rib can rab rib kyi skyon gyis skra shad la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid rang bzhin dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bcom pa'i blo gros kyi mig nyid kyis byis pa rnams dngos po'i
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can rab rib kyi skyon gyis skra shad la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid rang bzhin dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bcom pa'i blo gros kyi mig nyid kyis byis pa rnams dngos po'i
translated: Just as those with eye disease, due to the fault of eye disease, conceive of nonexistent hairs and so on as having an intrinsic nature, in the same way, fools, whose eyes of intelligence are destroyed by the disease of ignorance, conceive of the collection of things

original: tshogs rang bzhin med pa rnams la rang bzhin dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs rang bzhin med pa rnams la rang bzhin dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: that lack intrinsic nature as having intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa bzhin du mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa bzhin du mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: They express the characteristics in accordance with their conception.

original: me'i mtshan nyid dro ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: me'i mtshan nyid dro ba nyid yin te /
translated: The characteristic of fire is heat.

original: de las gzhan du ma dmigs pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis rang nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes brjod pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan du ma dmigs pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis rang nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes brjod pas so //
translated: Since it is not observed to be other than that, it is not shared, and since it is its own characteristic, it is said to be its own characteristic.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang byis pa'i skye bo rnams la rab tu grags pas 'di rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid chos mngon par rnam gzhag mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang byis pa'i skye bo rnams la rab tu grags pas 'di rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid chos mngon par rnam gzhag mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Lord has also set forth the specific characteristics of these things in terms of what is well known to ordinary beings.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams thun mong ba yin pas spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams thun mong ba yin pas spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since impermanence and so on are common to many things, they are general characteristics.

original: gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i rab rib med pas dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba la ltos nas de'i tshe rab rib med pa rnams kyis rab rib kyi rkyen gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad mi mthong ba bzhin du byis pa'i skye bo'i blo
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i rab rib med pas dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba la ltos nas de'i tshe rab rib med pa rnams kyis rab rib kyi rkyen gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad mi mthong ba bzhin du byis pa'i skye bo'i blo
translated: When the eye of stainless wisdom, free from the cataracts of ignorance, sees, then, just as those without cataracts do not see the hairs that are perceived due to the condition of cataracts, the nature of things that is not perceived by the minds of ordinary beings

original: gros kyis yongs su brtags pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni 'di ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gros kyis yongs su brtags pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni 'di ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is said by the noble ones to be the nature of things.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te me'i dro ba nyid la sogs pa 'di rgyu dang rkyen dag las byung ba'i phyir byas pa nyid yin pas rang bzhin med par brjod na 'o na rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te me'i dro ba nyid la sogs pa 'di rgyu dang rkyen dag las byung ba'i phyir byas pa nyid yin pas rang bzhin med par brjod na 'o na rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ci zhig yin /
translated: If you say that heat and so on of fire are not intrinsic nature because they are produced from causes and conditions, then you must explain what the characteristics of intrinsic nature are.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyang ci zhig yin pa de brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyang ci zhig yin pa de brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: You must explain what intrinsic nature is.

original: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply to that as follows.

original: rang bzhin nyid @290a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid @290a * //
translated: Intrinsic nature

original: ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: zhes gsungs te 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: 'di'i don ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis dmigs pa'i dngos po'i tshogs rnams ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba 'phags pa rnams la rang bzhin gang gis ma dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod yul du gyur pa de la rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis dmigs pa'i dngos po'i tshogs rnams ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba 'phags pa rnams la rang bzhin gang gis ma dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod yul du gyur pa de la rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The collection of things that are perceived by those whose eyes are infected by the cataracts of ignorance are not perceived by noble beings, who are free from the cataracts of ignorance. That by virtue of which they are not perceived is called intrinsic nature.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of that are

original: rang bzhin nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: Intrinsic nature is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: zhes slob dpon klu sgrub la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam gzhag mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon klu sgrub la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam gzhag mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the masters Nagarjuna and so on have presented this doctrine.

original: bcos ma ma yin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de yang cung zad kyang ma yin pa de nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de yang cung zad kyang ma yin pa de nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, that nature which is not fabricated and so on is not even slightly existent, and thus it is devoid of nature because it is nonexistent.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the nature of entities does not exist.

original: yang ci gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa de gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang ci gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa de gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, what is called “nature” in the statement “that which is called ‘nature’ is not fabricated” is not fabricated and is not dependent on another.

original: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis so //
translated: The master means the venerable Nagarjuna.

original: bstan bcos las khyad par du mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las khyad par du mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The treatise makes a distinction means that it makes the distinction “that which is not fabricated and is not dependent on another.”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says:

original: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “In consideration of what?” and so on.

original: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba ni chos nyid do //
translated: “In consideration of what” means in consideration of reality.

original: byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba ni gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos nyid de mdzad par gyur na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ba dang ma byung ba dag las de yod pa dang med pa dag las 'gyur ba
analyzed: byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba ni gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos nyid de mdzad par gyur na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ba dang ma byung ba dag las de yod pa dang med pa dag las 'gyur ba
translated: “Whether the Tathāgatas arise or not” means that whether the Tathāgatas perform that reality or not, then at that time, in consideration of the existence and nonexistence of the Tathāgatas, it would be arisen and not arisen, it would be existent and nonexistent.

original: yin gyi / gang gi phyir de dag gis mdzad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: yin gyi / gang gi phyir de dag gis mdzad pa de'i phyir /
translated: But because they perform that,

original: de rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid ni gnas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid ni gnas pa kho na yin no //
translated: whether the Tathāgatas arise or not, reality just remains.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni yod ces bya ba ni gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin de yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni yod ces bya ba ni gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin de yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Reality” means the nature of phenomena. “Exists” means that the nature of phenomena exists.

original: de la chos nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du ma chud nas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de la chos nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du ma chud nas 'dri ba ni /
translated: Here, one who has not understood the nature of reality asks:

original: chos nyid ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: What is this so-called reality?

original: chos nyid kyi rang bzhin bshad pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang bzhin bshad pa ni /
translated: The nature of reality is explained:

original: mig la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the nature of these eyes, etc.

original: rang bzhin yang khong du ma chud pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang khong du ma chud pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since the nature is not understood, the question is asked:

original: de dag gi rang bzhin yang gang zhig yin zhe na @290b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin yang gang zhig yin zhe na @290b zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is their nature?

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: There, “their” refers to the eyes, etc.

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: These are not fabricated, etc.

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: “These” refers to the eyes, etc.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni chu'i dro ba nyid bzhin du bcos ma ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni chu'i dro ba nyid bzhin du bcos ma ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Not fabricated” means not fabricated like the heat of water.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rgyan g-yar ba bzhin du gzhan ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rang dbang can ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rgyan g-yar ba bzhin du gzhan ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rang dbang can ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: “Not dependent on another” means not dependent on another like a borrowed ornament, and therefore not under the control of another.

original: de na 'phags pa'i skye bo kho nas thugs su chud pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de na 'phags pa'i skye bo kho nas thugs su chud pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is only the noble beings who understand it,

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so//🔽rang bzhin de yod dam med ces dri ba ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so// rang bzhin de yod dam med ces dri ba ni /
translated: he says, “ignorance,” etc.🔽The question, “Does that intrinsic reality exist or not?”

original: ci de yod dam zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ci de yod dam zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is stated in the line, “If it exists,” etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i shes pas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i shes pas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The “it” refers to what is to be understood by the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that,

original: med do zhes de skad du smra ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: med do zhes de skad du smra ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, “One who says ‘it does not exist,’” etc.

original: yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that it does exist,

original: gal te med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If it does not exist,” etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam bsgom par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam bsgom par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: “One would cultivate the path of the perfections” refers to the cultivation of the path characterized by generosity, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sgo nas so //
translated: “In that way” refers to the perfections of generosity, etc.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the sūtra,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “as it is said” and so on.

original: 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs can pas gtso bo'i khug ma'i nang du thim par 'gyur bar 'dod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs can pas gtso bo'i khug ma'i nang du thim par 'gyur bar 'dod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: “ Unceasing” does not mean that it dissolves into the crevice of the primal substance, as the Sāṃkhyas assert.

original: 'jig pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ma lus par 'jig pas so //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ma lus par 'jig pas so //
translated: “ Undestroyed” means that it is not destroyed without remainder.

original: yi ge rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi tshogs kyis so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi tshogs kyis so //
translated: “ The object of expression of the syllables” means the collection of words.

original: yi ge rnams kyis rab tu bsnyad du med cing zhes bya ba ni ngag gi tshogs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis rab tu bsnyad du med cing zhes bya ba ni ngag gi tshogs rnams kyis so //
translated: “ The syllables cannot express it” means the collection of speech.

original: spros pas rtog pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: spros pas rtog pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas so //
translated: “ It is not a conceptual elaboration” means that it is not the domain of conceptual thought.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary,

original: rigs kyi bu don dam bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don dam bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Son of noble family, the ultimate” and so on.

original: brjod du med cing zhes bya ba ni tshig dang ngag gi yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: brjod du med cing zhes bya ba ni tshig dang ngag gi yul ma yin pas so //
translated: “inexpressible” means that it is not the domain of words and speech.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i yul ma yin pas so //
translated: “peaceful” means that it is not the domain of conceptual proliferation.

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gang gi ched du'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gang gi ched du'o //
translated: “for the sake of which” means for the sake of the ultimate.

original: yang dag par dad pa zhes bya ba ni mtho ris thob par bya ba'i ched @291a * //
analyzed: yang dag par dad pa zhes bya ba ni mtho ris thob par bya ba'i ched @291a * //
translated: “perfect faith” means not for the sake of attaining heaven,

original: du ma yin gyi /
analyzed: du ma yin gyi /
translated: but

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: for the sake of attaining buddhahood.

original: khyim med pa zhes bya ba ni shing drung la sogs pa dgon pa'i gnas su 'dug pas so //🔽skra'am mgo la me shor ba ltar brtson 'grus rtsom zhing gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skra'am mgo la me shor na shin tu myur bar me gsad pa'i don du skyes bu rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa de bzhin du don dam pa thob par bya ba'i
analyzed: khyim med pa zhes bya ba ni shing drung la sogs pa dgon pa'i gnas su 'dug pas so // skra'am mgo la me shor ba ltar brtson 'grus rtsom zhing gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skra'am mgo la me shor na shin tu myur bar me gsad pa'i don du skyes bu rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa de bzhin du don dam pa thob par bya ba'i
translated: “without a home” means living in a forest dwelling at the foot of a tree, and so on.

original: ched du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: ched du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: “striving with a sense of urgency, as though one’s hair or clothes were on fire” means that just as people strive with a sense of urgency to put out a fire if their hair or clothes should catch fire, so too they strive with a sense of urgency for the sake of attaining the ultimate.

original: rnam par 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: “Not subject to destruction” means that whether or not the Tathagatas arise,

original: de bzhin du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it remains just as it is.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la zhes bya ba la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa de gang gis spyod pa de tshangs par spyod pa de tshangs par spyod pa ste thar pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la zhes bya ba la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa de gang gis spyod pa de tshangs par spyod pa de tshangs par spyod pa ste thar pa'i lam mo //
translated: “The practice of pure action” means that nirvana is purity, and that which is practiced by that is the practice of pure action, which is the path of liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ston pa'i ched du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ston pa'i ched du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba yin pas so //
translated: “The arising of the Tathagatas would be meaningless” means that the Tathagatas arise for the purpose of teaching the ultimate.

original: don dam pa yod par khas blangs pa la skyon med brjod pa ni /🔽'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
analyzed: don dam pa yod par khas blangs pa la skyon med brjod pa ni / 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
translated: The statement of the non-existence of the error in accepting the existence of the ultimate is🔽as follows.

original: kye ma ma la zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar zhing yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: kye ma ma la zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar zhing yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Here, it is said, “Alas! Alas!” which is a sense of wonder and mental unease.

original: gang zhig dngos po cung zad kyang mi 'dod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma gang dngos po cung zad kyang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po cung zad kyang mi 'dod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma gang dngos po cung zad kyang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The statement He who has no position at all🔽is not to be disputed with🔽is a response to the following: If you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.🔽 The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us

original: yod dang med dang yod med dang // gang la phyogs ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: yod dang med dang yod med dang // gang la phyogs ni yod ma yin //
translated: is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us🔽is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us🔽is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.🔽 The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us🔽is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.🔽 The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us

original: bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ma rig pa zhig ste zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa khong du ma chud pas so //🔽bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ma rig pa zhig ste zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa khong du ma chud pas so // bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.🔽 The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us🔽is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement But if you do not accept even that, then you cannot argue with us🔽is a response to the following: If you accept nothing at all, then you have no position, and if you have no position, then you cannot argue with us.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi'o //🔽byis pa'i skye bos gzung bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang sa'i rang bzhin can rnams so //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi'o //🔽byis pa'i skye bos gzung bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang sa'i rang bzhin can rnams so //
translated: The statement But if you do not accept

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Those” refers to the eye, etc.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pas kyang zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i phyin ci log tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pas kyang zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i phyin ci log tu gyur pas so //
translated: “Even though they are erroneous” means that they are erroneous by the power of nescience.

original: rang bzhin du de zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin du de zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Their nature” is the nature of the eye, etc.

original: 'di nyid rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang sa'i mtshan @291b nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: 'di nyid rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang sa'i mtshan @291b nyid can rnams so //
translated: “This is their essencelessness” refers to the atoms and the earth, etc.

original: de lta ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa de don gnyer ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de lta ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa de don gnyer ba'i ched du'o //
translated: “For the sake of that” means for the sake of the ultimate.

original: de zhes bya ba don dam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba don dam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “That” is the ultimate nature.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni don gsal bar byed pa'i kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni don gsal bar byed pa'i kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: “In dependence on the conventional truth” means by the conventional which illuminates the object.

original: don dam par ni de brjod du med pas brjod par bya ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: don dam par ni de brjod du med pas brjod par bya ba ma yin no ;
translated: But ultimately, since it is inexpressible, it is not an object of expression.

original: / byis pa'i skye bos blta bar bya ba ma yin pa de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na so so'i skye bo rnams kyang 'phags par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: / byis pa'i skye bos blta bar bya ba ma yin pa de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na so so'i skye bo rnams kyang 'phags par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: That itself is not to be seen by the childish, because otherwise it would follow that ordinary people would be āryas.

original: de nyid ni rang bzhin du rigs la zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni rang bzhin du rigs la zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is the natural lineage, because it is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa bstan pas so //
translated: By that alone, because it is taught to be not fabricated, etc.

original: dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin pas so //
translated: It is neither a thing nor a non-thing, because it is not the ultimate, since things and non-things are mutually dependent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “because it is naturally peaceful.”

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: The ultimate nature transcends all conceptualization.

original: 'di'i don ni gang mig la sogs pa rnams kyis rdul phra rab dang sa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de yod pa nyid du kho bos brjod na de'i tshe rang bzhin de sngar kho bos bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gang mig la sogs pa rnams kyis rdul phra rab dang sa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de yod pa nyid du kho bos brjod na de'i tshe rang bzhin de sngar kho bos bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If I were to say that the nature of the eye and so on, which is characterized by subtle atoms and earth, exists, then at that time, since I previously refuted intrinsic nature,

original: kye ma ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i skyon brjod pa de kho bo la 'byung bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid khas blangs pas bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rang bzhin du khas blangs pas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ji ltar brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: kye ma ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i skyon brjod pa de kho bo la 'byung bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid khas blangs pas bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rang bzhin du khas blangs pas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ji ltar brjod par 'gyur /
translated: the fault of mutual contradiction, “Alas, alas!” and so on, would occur to me. However, since I accept that it is not fabricated and does not rely on another, how could I state the meaning of mutual contradiction, since I accept that it is not fabricated and does not rely on another?

original: 'o na rang bzhin de yang ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin de yang ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Well, how could that intrinsic nature exist?

original: yod pa nyid ni med pa nyid la ltos pa yin pas so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni med pa nyid la ltos pa yin pas so //
translated: Because existence relies on nonexistence.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i kun rdzob la ltos nas de yod pa nyid du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i kun rdzob la ltos nas de yod pa nyid du brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is said to exist in reliance upon the superficial, which is pleasing if not investigated.

original: nyan pa po'i skye bo rnams la dpe'i sgo nas khong du chud par bya ba'i ched du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan pa po'i skye bo rnams la dpe'i sgo nas khong du chud par bya ba'i ched du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: It is for the sake of causing the listener to understand by means of an example, not in the ultimate sense,

original: de brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that cannot be expressed.

original: de bzhin du de la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de la /
translated: Similarly,

original: bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa yin na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa yin na zhes pa'o //
translated: in regard to that, the non-artificiality, etc. are also said to be superficial.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de gnyi ga la yang grub pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de gnyi ga la yang grub pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that such a nature is established in both,

original: rang bzhin 'di ni zhes bya @292a * //🔽ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di ni zhes bya @292a * // ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This nature,” etc.

original: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis so //
translated: “The Master” is the venerable Nagarjuna.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dngos por smra ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dngos por smra ba la yang ngo //
translated: “Moreover” refers to the substantialists.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “This meaning” is the nature having the characteristic of non-artificiality, etc.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
analyzed: rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
translated: It is not tenable that an intrinsic nature

original: 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: arises from causes and conditions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang dag me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsha ba la sogs pa yin par smra ba de dag mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsha ba la sogs pa yin par smra ba de dag mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is illogical for those who assert that the intrinsic nature of fire and so on is heat and so forth,

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Whatever . . .” and so on.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni dngos por smra ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni dngos por smra ba'o //
translated: “ Whatever” refers to the proponents of entities.

original: de la gzhan dag na re gang gi phyir me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsha ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir bcos ma nyid dang gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re gang gi phyir me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsha ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir bcos ma nyid dang gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In response to that, some may say, “Because the intrinsic nature of fire and so on is heat and so forth, it is not fabricated and does not depend on another.”

original: lan ni / yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni / yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is “Because it exists . . . ” and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tsha ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tsha ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In that . . . ” refers to the intrinsic nature of heat and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba 'dis rang bzhin brjod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang bzhin yod par brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba 'dis rang bzhin brjod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang bzhin yod par brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: “In that case” means “in that case, the word ‘in that’ is not able to express existence by way of intrinsic nature.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “because of the non-existence of things.”

original: tsha ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med pas so //
analyzed: tsha ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med pas so //
translated: Because things characterized by heat and so on do not exist.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te tsha ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te tsha ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If things characterized by heat and so on existed by way of intrinsic nature,

original: de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then because they would exist,

original: bcos ma nyid la sogs pa ma yin par gyur pa las 'on kyang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas de la bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa ci ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcos ma nyid la sogs pa ma yin par gyur pa las 'on kyang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas de la bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa ci ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: they would not be fabricated and so on. But because they do not exist, how could they be non-fabricated and so on?

original: gal te yod pa ma yin na de'i tshe tsha ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yod do zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa ma yin na de'i tshe tsha ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yod do zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: If they do not exist, then how could one make the conventional statement, “The intrinsic nature of heat and so on exists”?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is as follows.

original: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement conventionally, etc. is made.

original: rgya chen pos chog go zhes bya ba ni zhar la 'ongs pa rgya chen por 'gyur bas chog pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen pos chog go zhes bya ba ni zhar la 'ongs pa rgya chen por 'gyur bas chog pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The statement enough with the extensive means that the extensive digression is sufficient.

original: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi dbye ba dag go //
