analyzed: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi dbye ba dag go //
translated: The statement the main point should be explained refers to the divisions of emptiness.

original: de la mig la sogs pa rnams la stong pa nyid gang smras pa de phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dang / sems tsam du smra bas 'dod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa rnams la stong pa nyid gang smras pa de phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dang / sems tsam du smra bas 'dod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the emptiness of the eyes, etc., is not as it is accepted by the proponents of external objects and by the proponents of mind only, he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba ni @292b mig la sogs pa rnams stong pa nyid du brjod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni @292b mig la sogs pa rnams stong pa nyid du brjod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: therein refers to the context of the statement that the eyes, etc., are empty.

original: mig la sogs pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyi /
translated: The statement the emptiness of the eyes, etc. means that the eyes, etc., are empty of the nature of the eyes, etc.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not mean that they are empty of an internal agent, such as a self.

original: gcig la gcig med pa stong pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa stong pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not the emptiness of one thing in another.

original: gcig la ste mig la sogs pa rnams la gcig med pa ste /
analyzed: gcig la ste mig la sogs pa rnams la gcig med pa ste /
translated: In one, i.e., in the eye, etc., there is the emptiness of one thing,

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of an inner agent, a person, etc.

original: yang na gcig la ste mig la sogs pa rnams la gcig med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gcig la ste mig la sogs pa rnams la gcig med pa ste /
translated: Or, in one, i.e., in the eye, etc., there is the emptiness of one thing,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos stong pa nyid de phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dang / sems tsam du smra ba bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos stong pa nyid de phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dang / sems tsam du smra ba bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: the emptiness of the nature of object apprehended and subject apprehendor, not like the existence of external objects and the doctrine of Mind Only.

original: de ltar nang stong pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang stong pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach external emptiness,🔽he says,

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therein, external emptiness, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi nang nas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi nang nas so //
translated: Therein means from among the emptinesses.

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni phyi stong pa nyid du bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni phyi stong pa nyid du bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: External emptiness should be explained.

original: de bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,🔽he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with “because” indicates

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyi /
translated: that form is empty of form means that form is empty of the nature of form.

original: gcig la gcig med pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not that they are empty in the sense that one does not exist in the other.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa de'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa de'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the nature of form. “ That” means that it is empty of the nature of form.

original: ji ltar gzugs phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can du gtogs pa ma yin pas phyi stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can du gtogs pa ma yin pas phyi stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Just as form is included in the external sense-spheres and is not included in sentient beings, it is the emptiness of the external.🔽In the same way, sound and so on are also the emptiness of the external.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang phyi stong pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang phyi stong pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says “sound” and so on.

original: sgra la sogs pa rnams sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa rnams sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Sound and so on are empty of the nature of sound and so on.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin de yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin de yin pas so //
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid gang yin pa de phyi stong pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid gang yin pa de phyi stong pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: Because the lack of entityness of forms and so on is their nature, therefore, the lack of entityness of forms and so on is asserted to be external emptiness.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source in the sūtras,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa yin gyi @293a * //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa yin gyi @293a * //
translated: he says “as it has been said” and so on, and “as before” means that, as explained above, forms and so on are without entityness in dependence on not being permanent and not being annihilated.

original: gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not emptiness in the sense of one thing being absent in another.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for the following [emptinesses].

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach external and internal emptiness,

original: gnyis char zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis char zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “both” and so on.

original: gnyis char zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po ste /
analyzed: gnyis char zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po ste /
translated: Both” refers to external and internal things.

original: de yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rten rnams yin la /
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rten rnams yin la /
translated: They are the supports of the sense faculties such as the eye,

original: de rnams sems can du gtogs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pas phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams sems can du gtogs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pas phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included among sentient beings and because they are the objects of the visual consciousness of others.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for this, he says,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “As it is said.”

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the emptiness of emptiness, he says, “All phenomena,” and so on.

original: chos rnams ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad yin la /🔽de rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid ces bya la /
analyzed: chos rnams ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad yin la / de rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid ces bya la /
translated: “ Phenomena” refers to all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.🔽The absence of intrinsic nature of those is called “emptiness.”

original: stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos stong pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos stong pa yin te /
translated: That emptiness is empty of the entity of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po la ltos nas rnam par 'jog pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po la ltos nas rnam par 'jog pas so //
translated: Because it is posited in dependence upon a thing that is not emptiness.

original: des na rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar bsnyad par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar bsnyad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is the emptiness having the characteristic of essencelessness is to be called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: There is no essence of emptiness at all.

original: de la dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purpose of that,

original: stong nyid dngos po blo can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong nyid dngos po blo can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “For the sake of those who think that emptiness is a thing. . . . ”

original: gang stong pa nyid la dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi dngos por zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid la dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi dngos por zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is taught in order to stop the adherence to a thing on the part of those who adhere to emptiness as a thing.

original: de mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that by means of a citation from sūtra,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “As it is said. . . . ”

original: gal te stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the emptiness of emptiness has the characteristic of emptiness, then all phenomena are the emptiness of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the emptiness of emptiness and the characteristic of the emptiness of all phenomena?

original: lan ni / stong pa nyid des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lan ni / stong pa nyid des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The answer is given by “That emptiness of that emptiness. . . .”

original: don de nyid la 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis bstod pa'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid la 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis bstod pa'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the praise by the noble Nāgārjuna,

original: ji skad du kun rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽kun rtog thams cad @293b gzhom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji skad du kun rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / kun rtog thams cad @293b gzhom pa'i phyir //
translated: it is said, “Whatever is imagined. . . .”

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i ched du'o //🔽stong nyid bdud rtsi bstan par mdzad //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i ched du'o // stong nyid bdud rtsi bstan par mdzad //
translated: “In order to destroy all imagination” is for the sake of abandoning all conceptual thought.

original: ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid bdud rtsi yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid bdud rtsi yin te /
translated: “The nectar of emptiness is taught” means that emptiness is nectar,

original: 'khor ba'i rga shi sel bar byed pa yin la de bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rga shi sel bar byed pa yin la de bstan pa'o //
translated: which is what removes the aging and death of cyclic existence, and that is taught.

original: gang la de la'ang 'dzin yod pa //
analyzed: gang la de la'ang 'dzin yod pa //
translated: “Whatever is grasped even in that”

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang la stong pa nyid la yang dngos por mngon par zhen pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang la stong pa nyid la yang dngos por mngon par zhen pa yod pa'o //
translated: This is the person who has a reifying misconception even in regard to emptiness.

original: de ni khyod kyis smad par mdzad //
analyzed: de ni khyod kyis smad par mdzad //
translated: You have condemned him.

original: ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa bzlog par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa bzlog par mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is the person who has a reifying misconception even in regard to emptiness.🔽You have condemned him.

original: chen po stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the emptiness of the great, he says:🔽The great emptiness is in the ten directions.

original: 'dir phyogs rnams stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid ces brjod la /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs rnams stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid ces brjod la /
translated: Here, the emptiness of the directions is called the emptiness of the great.

original: 'dir phyogs rnams chen po nyid yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs rnams chen po nyid yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are the directions themselves the great?

original: mu mtha' ni med phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mu mtha' ni med phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because they are limitless.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why are they limitless?

original: sems can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because of the limitless sentient beings.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten ma lus pa la phyogs kyis khyab pas phyogs rnams la mu mtha' med pa'i phyir chen po nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten ma lus pa la phyogs kyis khyab pas phyogs rnams la mu mtha' med pa'i phyir chen po nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Since it pervades all sentient beings and the entire world, it is called “greatness” because the directions are limitless.

original: chen po nyid la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chen po nyid la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example of greatness,

original: tshad med dpe yis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshad med dpe yis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “with limitless examples.”

original: ji ltar byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sems can rnams la khyab pa nyid kyis chen po yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sems can rnams la khyab pa nyid kyis chen po yin la /
translated: Just as love and so on are great because they pervade sentient beings,

original: de bzhin du phyogs kyang yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs kyang yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: in the same way, the directions are also great.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that with a commentary,

original: phyogs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “from the directions,” and so on.

original: phyogs rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi rang gzhan gyis so ;
analyzed: phyogs rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi rang gzhan gyis so ;
translated: “From the directions” means from the directions, from oneself and others.

original: / chen po stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽chen por 'dzin pa bzlog phyir gsungs //
analyzed: / chen po stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / chen por 'dzin pa bzlog phyir gsungs //
translated: In order to teach the purpose of the emptiness of greatness,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “in order to reverse the conception of greatness,” and so on.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to teach the source of the sūtra,🔽he says, “in the Perfection of Wisdom,” and so on.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: gal te gang la phyogs rnams la chen por mngon par zhen pa yod na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te gang la phyogs rnams la chen por mngon par zhen pa yod na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If one is attached to the great in terms of the directions, how, etc.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the emptiness of the ultimate,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, That, etc.

original: don dam mya ngan 'das pa yin //
analyzed: don dam mya ngan 'das pa yin //
translated: The ultimate is nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la don dam pa zhes brjod pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la don dam pa zhes brjod pas so //
translated: Because nirvana is called the ultimate.

original: @294a * // ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la don dam pa zhes brjod ce na /🔽lan ni / de ni dgos pa mchog yin pas //
analyzed: @294a * // ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la don dam pa zhes brjod ce na / lan ni / de ni dgos pa mchog yin pas //
translated: Why is nirvana called the ultimate?🔽The answer is,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is the highest goal.

original: 'dis ni don gyi sgras dgos pa 'ang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don gyi sgras dgos pa 'ang bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the word “goal” also teaches the purpose.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las dgos pa mchog tu gyur ba gzhan med pas mya ngan las 'das pa la don dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las dgos pa mchog tu gyur ba gzhan med pas mya ngan las 'das pa la don dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Nirvana is called the ultimate because there is no other purpose higher than nirvana.

original: de ni de'i stong pa nyid gang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o /🔽dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de'i stong pa nyid gang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o / dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: mya ngan las 'das dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽don dam mkhyen pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / don dam mkhyen pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis so //
translated: The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: don gyi sgra ni dgos pa'i tshig gam zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du'o /🔽shes bya'i tshig go zhes bya ba ni don dam pa zhes bya ba 'dir don gyi sgra ni shes bya brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: don gyi sgra ni dgos pa'i tshig gam zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du'o / shes bya'i tshig go zhes bya ba ni don dam pa zhes bya ba 'dir don gyi sgra ni shes bya brjod pa yin la /
translated: The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: des na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya mchog tu gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: des na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya mchog tu gyur ba yin la /
translated: The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of that nirvana is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since there is nothing other than nirvana, nirvana is so-called.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the emptiness of the conditioned,

original: rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Because they arise from conditions,” and so on.

original: rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni las la sogs pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis bskyed pa 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khams gsum la 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni las la sogs pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis bskyed pa 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khams gsum la 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they arise from conditions, that is, because they are produced by the power of causes such as karma, the three realms characterized by the desire, form, and formless realms are called “conditioned.”

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni khams gsum mo //
translated: Now, here means in the three realms.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: By that means by the nature of the three realms.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the sūtra,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “As it is said,” and so on.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the emptiness of the unconditioned,

original: gang las skye gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang las skye gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “From what would birth, aging, and death arise?” and so on.

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgas pa med pa'o //
translated: “It does not change into something else while abiding” means that it is without aging.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the emptiness of transcendence,

original: gang la mtha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la mtha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “That which has no end,” and so on.

original: gang la rtag pa dang chad pa med pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang la rtag pa dang chad pa med pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
translated: That which has no permanence and no annihilation is transcendent.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la /
translated: It is the Enjoyment Body.

original: de skad cig ma brgyud pas gnas pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin @294b la ;
analyzed: de skad cig ma brgyud pas gnas pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin @294b la ;
translated: Because it abides through a succession of moments, it is not permanent.

original: chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir chad pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir chad pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: Because it is not annihilated, it is beyond the extreme of annihilation.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mtha' las 'das pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mtha' las 'das pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: “That” refers to the transcendent Enjoyment Body.

original: de kho na zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “Just that” refers to the nature of the Enjoyment Body.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of this in the scriptures,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, “As it is said,” and so on.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach emptiness of no beginning or end,

original: thog ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thog ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “No beginning,” and so on.

original: de la thog ma'i sgras ni dang po brjod la /
analyzed: de la thog ma'i sgras ni dang po brjod la /
translated: There, the word “beginning” refers to the first,

original: tha ma'i sgras ni mtha' brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha ma'i sgras ni mtha' brjod pa yin no //
translated: and the word “end” refers to the last.

original: de dag med pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i sgras 'khor ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag med pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i sgras 'khor ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: “ Their nonexistence” means that because there is no beginning or end, the word “beginningless and endless” refers to cyclic existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba ni thog ma med par brjod ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba ni thog ma med par brjod ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That is why he says, “Cyclic existence is said to be beginningless.”

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa de yang don dam pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa de yang don dam pa ste /
translated: That beginninglessness and endlessness is also ultimate,

original: 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pas so //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pas so //
translated: because there is no entity whatsoever that cycles in cyclic existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽'gro 'ong bral phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / 'gro 'ong bral phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That is why he says,🔽“Because of the absence of coming and going.”

original: don dam par 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ultimately, there is no going from one cyclic existence to another.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod na 'khor ba yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod na 'khor ba yod pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If going and coming existed, then cyclic existence would exist.🔽If cyclic existence existed, then a beginning and end would exist. But since going and coming do not exist, cyclic existence does not exist. Therefore, since cyclic existence does not exist, a beginning and end do not exist.

original: gal te 'khor ba yod na thog ma dang tha ma yod par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pas 'khor ba med pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma yang med pa de nyid kyi phyir thog ma dang tha ma rnams kyi stong pa
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba yod na thog ma dang tha ma yod par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pas 'khor ba med pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma yang med pa de nyid kyi phyir thog ma dang tha ma rnams kyi stong pa
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of a beginning and end

original: nyid gang yin pa de ni 'khor ba stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: nyid gang yin pa de ni 'khor ba stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: is the emptiness of cyclic existence.

original: de rnams las tha dad pa'i 'khor ba med pas so //
analyzed: de rnams las tha dad pa'i 'khor ba med pas so //
translated: Since cyclic existence does not exist separately from a beginning and end.🔽Therefore, it is said that cyclic existence is empty of a beginning and end.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle

original: de nyid kyi phyir thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams kyis stong ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de yis dben nyid ces bya ba ni srid pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams kyis stong ste zhes gsungs pa yin no // de yis dben nyid ces bya ba ni srid pa nyid kyis so //
translated: is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle🔽is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the middle

original: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di las so //🔽de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di las so //🔽de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is the emptiness of the middle.🔽The emptiness of the

original: de la dbus med cing zhes bya ba ni gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la de dag la ltos pa'i dbus kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbus med cing zhes bya ba ni gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la de dag la ltos pa'i dbus kyang med pa'o //
translated: As for it has no middle, since it has no beginning or end, it also has no middle that depends on those.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid 'chad pa ni /
translated: As for explaining it has no beginning or end,

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is stated where there is no beginning.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽dor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / dor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach emptiness of non-rejection,🔽it is stated non-rejection.

original: de la dor ba'i rnam grangs ni 'thor ba dang 'bor ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dor ba'i rnam grangs ni 'thor ba dang 'bor ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: As for non-rejection, it is stated throwing away and discarding.🔽The term rejection is emptiness.

original: dor ba'i sgra ni stong pa'o //🔽dor @295a * //
analyzed: dor ba'i sgra ni stong pa'o // dor @295a * //
translated: Rejection is non-rejection.🔽It is stated non-rejection because it is free from emptiness.

original: ba med ces bya ba ni stong pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ba med ces bya ba ni stong pa spangs pa'o //
translated: It is stated nothing is discarded

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.

original: 'ga' yang 'bor med gang yin pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'bor med gang yin pa'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.

original: gang du chos gang yang dor ba med pa ste /🔽dge ba'i chos theg pa chen po yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang du chos gang yang dor ba med pa ste /🔽dge ba'i chos theg pa chen po yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.🔽It is stated nothing is discarded because there is nothing to discard.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin can theg pa chen pos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin can theg pa chen pos so //
translated: The phrase by that very thing refers to the nature of the wholesome dharmas, i.e. the universal vehicle.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The phrase that very thing refers to the universal vehicle.

original: des na theg pa chen po'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that emptiness which is of the universal vehicle is described as the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source in the sutra for that, he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽dor ba med pa'i don ston pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // dor ba med pa'i don ston pa ni /
translated: As it is said...🔽The meaning of nonrejection is demonstrated by the words:

original: dor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rang bzhin stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Rejection is...🔽In order to demonstrate the emptiness of essential nature, he says:

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The conditioned...

original: slob ma zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams te /
analyzed: slob ma zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams te /
translated: The disciples are the sravakas.

original: de rnams kyi ye shes ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la rag lus pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ye shes ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la rag lus pas so //
translated: Their knowledge is dependent on the teachings of another.

original: 'dus byas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dus ma byas bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dus ma byas bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words the conditioned... and so on refer to the unconditioned.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin te chos nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin te chos nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can chos nyid kyis so //
translated: Their intrinsic reality is their nature, which is to say, their reality.🔽“By that very thing” means by the reality that has the nature of intrinsic reality.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni chos nyid do //
translated: “That” refers to reality.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the sūtra, he says,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “As it is said,” and so on.

original: ma byas shing zhes bya ba ni sngar ma byung ba byung ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ma byas shing zhes bya ba ni sngar ma byung ba byung ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: “Not made” means not arisen through a prior non-existence.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i sgo nas ma byas pas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i sgo nas ma byas pas so //
translated: “Not brought into existence” means not made through a transformation of an existent state.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the emptiness of all phenomena, he says,

original: khams bco brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The eighteen constituents,” and so on.

original: khams bco brgyad ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The eighteen constituents have already been explained.

original: rig drug dang zhes bya ba la reg pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rig drug dang zhes bya ba la reg pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The six forms of contact have already been explained.

original: de las byung ba'i tshor drug dang // zhes bya ba ni rig pa las byung ba'i tshor ba drug go //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshor drug dang // zhes bya ba ni rig pa las byung ba'i tshor ba drug go //
translated: The six elements, earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.🔽The six internal sense bases, eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: gzugs can zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six external sense bases, form, sound, smell, taste, tangible, and entity.

original: gzugs can min zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can min zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six groups of consciousness, eye consciousness, etc.🔽The six groups of contact, eye contact, etc.🔽The six groups of feeling, feeling born of eye contact, etc.🔽The six groups of craving, craving born of feeling, etc.🔽The five aggregates, form, etc.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ste phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ste phung po lnga'o //
translated: The four truths, the truth of suffering, etc.🔽The four meditations, etc.🔽The four formless states, etc.🔽The four noble lineages, etc.🔽The four exertions, etc.🔽The four bases of magic power, etc.🔽The five faculties, faith, etc.🔽The five powers, faith, etc.🔽The seven factors of enlightenment, mindfulness, etc.🔽The eight members of the path, right view, etc.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three liberations, emptiness, etc.🔽The four summaries of the Dharma, all conditioned things are impermanent, etc.

original: de rnams la chos thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la chos thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: The four truths, the truth of suffering, etc.🔽The four concentrations, etc.🔽The four formless states, etc.🔽The four noble lineages, etc.🔽The four exertions, etc.🔽The four bases of magic power, etc.🔽The five faculties, faith, etc.🔽The five powers, faith, etc.🔽The seven factors of enlightenment, mindfulness, etc.🔽The eight members of the path, right view, etc.🔽The three liberations, emptiness, etc.🔽The four summaries of the Dharma, all conditioned things are impermanent, etc.

original: khams bco brgyad kyi chos kyi khams kyi nang du reg pa dang tshor ba dag ni @295b 'dod chags pa'i dngos kyi rgyu yin pas gtso bo nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir logs su smos pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi chos kyi khams kyi nang du reg pa dang tshor ba dag ni @295b 'dod chags pa'i dngos kyi rgyu yin pas gtso bo nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir logs su smos pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The four truths, the truth of suffering, etc.🔽The four concentrations, etc.🔽The four formless states, etc.🔽The four noble lineages, etc.🔽The four exertions, etc.🔽The four bases of magic power, etc.🔽The five faculties, faith, etc.🔽The five powers, faith, etc.🔽The seven factors of enlightenment, mindfulness, etc.🔽The eight members of the path, right view, etc.🔽The three liberations, emptiness, etc.🔽The four summaries of the

original: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag kyang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams bco brgyad kyis chos thams cad bsdus par khong du chud pa rnams la gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag logs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag kyang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams bco brgyad kyis chos thams cad bsdus par khong du chud pa rnams la gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag logs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The form and formless realms are taught separately for those who understand that all phenomena are included in the eighteen elements of form and the formless.

original: gzugs dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag tu chos thams cad 'dus su zin kyang de dag tu chos thams cad 'dus par khong du ma chud pa rnams la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag logs su bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag tu chos thams cad 'dus su zin kyang de dag tu chos thams cad 'dus par khong du ma chud pa rnams la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag logs su bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Although all phenomena are included in form and the formless, for those who do not understand that they are included there, the compounded and uncompounded are taught separately.

original: 'di rnams la don gyi sgo nas tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la don gyi sgo nas tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But in terms of meaning, they are not separate.

original: de dag gis dben zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis dben zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are devoid of that means that all phenomena are naturally devoid.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of that in the sutras,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, as it is said... and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the emptiness of intrinsic identity,

original: gzugs su rung ba nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The identity of form is not found in the condition of being suitable as form,” and so on.

original: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs nyams su myong bas na tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas de la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs nyams su myong bas na tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas de la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since the identity of form is not found in the condition of being suitable as form, the identity of feeling is not found in the experience of feeling, and so on, this is called “the emptiness of intrinsic identity.”

original: gzugs ni gzugs rung mtshan nyid can//
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs rung mtshan nyid can//
translated: Form has the identity of being suitable as form.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par bsgyur bas bya ba yin pas na gzugs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par bsgyur bas bya ba yin pas na gzugs te /
translated: Since it is an action that is transformed, it is form.

original: lag pas reg pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: lag pas reg pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: Since it is transformed through contact with the hand, and so on, it is said to be “form.”

original: tshor ba myong ba'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: tshor ba myong ba'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: Feeling has the identity of experience.

original: zhes bya ba ni de la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas so //
translated: Since it has the nature of experience, and so on, it is said to be “feeling.”

original: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste //
translated: Discrimination apprehends the signs of objects.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'du shes ring po la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'du shes ring po la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: The nature of perception is to apprehend signs of long, etc.

original: 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa'i rnam par smin pa 'phen par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa'o // zhes bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa'i rnam par smin pa 'phen par byed pa ste /
translated: Formation is the formation of what is not.🔽The nature of formation is to project the result of evolution, since volition, etc., project the result of evolution.

original: sems pa la sogs pas rnam par smin pa 'phen par byed pas 'du byed rnams la mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya'o //🔽yul la so sor rnam rig pa //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pas rnam par smin pa 'phen par byed pas 'du byed rnams la mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya'o // yul la so sor rnam rig pa //
translated: Therefore, formation is called the formation of what is not.🔽Consciousness is the awareness of objects.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yul rnams so sor rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yul rnams so sor rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of consciousness is to be aware of objects such as form, etc.

original: phung po sdug bsngal rang mtshan nyid //🔽ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la sogs @296a * //
analyzed: phung po sdug bsngal rang mtshan nyid // ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la sogs @296a * //
translated: The aggregates have the nature of suffering.

original: pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The aggregates have the nature of suffering because they are suffering in the sense of the suffering of suffering, etc.

original: khams kyi rang bzhin sbrul gdug 'dod //
analyzed: khams kyi rang bzhin sbrul gdug 'dod //
translated: The realms have the nature of a poisonous snake.

original: ces bya ba ni ji ltar sbrul gyis skyes bu 'dzin pa de bzhin du khams kyis kyang skyes bu rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji ltar sbrul gyis skyes bu 'dzin pa de bzhin du khams kyis kyang skyes bu rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as a snake harms a person, so the elements harm people.

original: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the elements are called “poisonous snakes.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: ” In order to explain that,

original: 'dzin par chos mthun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin par chos mthun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “in terms of similarity of function in grasping.

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: ” In order to explain the characteristic of the sense bases,

original: skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “sense bases” and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi skye ba'i sgo yin pas skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi skye ba'i sgo yin pas skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: They are called “sense bases” because they are the doors for the arising of mind and mental factors.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: sdug bsngal 'byung zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the arising of suffering” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ni sems las byung ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i bshad pa dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sems las byung ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i bshad pa dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Since suffering is included among the mental factors, it does not contradict the basic explanation.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristic of dependent origination,

original: rten cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rten cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “dependent origination,” etc.

original: 'di ni rgyu'i sgo nas mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'i sgo nas mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is the statement of the characteristic from the point of view of cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'du 'phrod kyis rab tu phye ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'du 'phrod kyis rab tu phye ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “because it is distinguished by the combination of dependent origination,”

original: tshegs yod par 'gyur ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par 'gyur ba yin pas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid can no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshegs yod par 'gyur ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par 'gyur ba yin pas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid can no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: because the existence of dependent origination is the existence of combination. Thus, he says that dependent origination has the characteristic of combination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristic of the six perfections,

original: stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “emptiness,” etc.

original: sngar bstan pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the perfection of giving, which was previously taught, is stated from the point of view of result.

original: de yod na dngos po stong pa yod pas so //🔽tshul khrims gdung med mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid 'di yang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: de yod na dngos po stong pa yod pas so // tshul khrims gdung med mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid 'di yang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: If that exists, then an empty thing exists.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid can gyi pha rol tu phyin pas bde 'gror skye bas na ngan 'gror gdung ba med pas so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid can gyi pha rol tu phyin pas bde 'gror skye bas na ngan 'gror gdung ba med pas so //
translated: The perfection of morality is characterized by freedom from torment, because one is born in a happy realm through the perfection of morality, as previously explained, and is thus free from the torment of miserable realms.

original: bzod pa khong khro med mtshan nyid //🔽ces bya ba ni bzod pa ni khro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas so //
analyzed: bzod pa khong khro med mtshan nyid // ces bya ba ni bzod pa ni khro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas so //
translated: The perfection of patience is characterized by non-anger.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus ni dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir kha na ma @296b thob ste sdig pa med pas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus ni dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir kha na ma @296b thob ste sdig pa med pas so //
translated: The perfection of effort is characterized by non-remorse, because effort is characterized by the embracing of virtue and thus is free of evil, i.e., is non-remorseful.

original: bsam gtan sdud pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: bsam gtan sdud pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The perfection of meditation is characterized by concentration.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi sgo nas byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi sgo nas byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams bsgoms pas so //
translated: through the door of meditative absorption.

original: shes rab chags med mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: shes rab chags med mtshan nyid de //
translated: The defining characteristic of wisdom is non-attachment.

original: zhes bya ba ni des dngos po 'ga' la yang chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni des dngos po 'ga' la yang chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because of the absence of attachment to any entity whatsoever.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the summary, he says:

original: pha rol phyin pa drug rnams kyi //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa drug rnams kyi //
translated: The six perfections

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the defining characteristics of the four meditative concentrations, etc.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says: meditative concentration, and so on.🔽The defining characteristic of the immeasurables is said to be non-aversion.🔽The defining characteristic of the liberations is said to be the absence of attachment.

original: mi 'khrugs pa mtshan nyid du gsungs zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i sgo nas mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /🔽de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa mtshan nyid du gsungs zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i sgo nas mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The defining characteristic of the bases of overpowering is said to be the absence of obscuration.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative absorptions is said to be non-distraction.🔽The defining characteristic of the forms of non-perception is said to be the absence of conceptualization.

original: de dag khong khro spangs pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag khong khro spangs pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The defining characteristic of the spheres of mastery is said to be the absence of obstruction.🔽The defining characteristic of the spheres of totality is said to be the absence of restriction.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The defining characteristic of the applications of mindfulness is said to be the absence of fear.🔽The defining characteristic of the right efforts is said to be the absence of laziness.

original: nges par 'byung byed rang mtshan nyid //
analyzed: nges par 'byung byed rang mtshan nyid //
translated: The defining characteristic of the bases of supernatural power is said to be the absence of obstruction.🔽The defining characteristic of the faculties is said to be the absence of weakness.🔽The defining characteristic of the powers is said to be the absence of suppression.🔽The defining characteristic of the branches of enlightenment is said to be the absence of darkness.🔽The defining characteristic of the path is said to be the absence of error.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is said to be the absence of confusion.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the path is said to be the absence of error.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the applications of mindfulness is said to be the absence of fear.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the right efforts is said to be the absence of laziness.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the bases of supernatural power is said to be the absence of obstruction.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the faculties is said to be the absence of weakness.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the powers is said to be the absence of suppression.🔽The defining characteristic of the meditative development of the branches of enlightenment

original: ces bya ba ni 'khor bas 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas so//
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'khor bas 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas so//
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of samsara.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa dag ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa dag ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meditative stabilizations, etc., have been explained previously.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems bskyed pa gsum par bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems bskyed pa gsum par bshad zin to //
translated: The meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the formless [absorptions], etc., have been explained in the third generation of the Thought.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni sems bskyed pa bzhi par bstan zin to ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni sems bskyed pa bzhi par bstan zin to ;
translated: The thirty-seven aids to enlightenment have been explained in the fourth generation of the Thought.

original: / stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the three doors of liberation, such as emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, The characteristic of emptiness is . . .
